1:1: In the Name of Allāh, The Most-Merciful (to His creation) , the Ever-Merciful (to His believing servants) .
1:2: All praises be to Allāh, the Lord of the worlds (for His perfect attributes and benevolent and just actions) .
1:3: The Most-Merciful (to His creation) , the Ever-Merciful (to His believing servants) .
1:4: The Sole Master and Judge of the Day of Reckoning and Recompense (in which His perfect authority, justice and wisdom will manifest) .
1:5: It is You alone (O Allāh) that we worship and it is You alone that we ask for help (in Your obedience and in all of our affairs) .
1:6: Guide us to the straight path (of beneficial knowledge coupled with righteous action) .
1:7: The path of those (Prophets and their truthful, righteous followers) upon whom You have bestowed favour, not of those who earn Your anger (by not acting upon what they know) and nor of the astray (who act without knowledge) .
2:2: (This is) that Book (containing knowledge of previous scriptures) about which there is no doubt (that it is from Allāh) —it contains guidance for the pious (who benefit from its admonitions and abide by its teachings) .
2:3: Those who believe in (what He has informed them regarding) the unseen, establish (the daily) prayers, and spend (upon the needy) out of what We have provided for them (of wealth and sustenance) .
2:4: And who believe in what has been revealed to you, (O Muḥammad) , and what was revealed before you (of previous scriptures) , and in the Hereafter they have firm conviction.
2:5: Those (are the ones who) are upon (right) guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.
2:6: Indeed, those who (stubbornly) disbelieve (and are engrossed in their disbelief) —it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they will not believe.
2:7: Allāh has placed a seal upon their hearts and upon their hearing, and over their vision is a veil (because they showed no desire for truth, goodness and guidance after it had been made clear to them) . And for them is a great punishment (for their stubborn disbelief) .
2:8: And from among mankind are some who say, "We have believed in Allāh and the Last Day," but they are not really believers.
2:9: They (think they can) deceive Allāh and those who believe (through their hypocrisy) , but they do not deceive except themselves and they perceive this not.
2:10: In their hearts is a disease (of doubt, disbelief and hypocrisy) , so Allāh increased their disease (by subjecting them to trials in which they preferred disbelief) . And for them is a painful punishment because they used to tell lies (to mislead others) .
2:11: And when it is said to them, "Do not cause corruption on the earth (through your disbelief, sin, treachery and sedition against those who believe) ," they say, "Indeed, we are but reformers (who rectify and make peace) ."
2:12: Indeed, they are the ones who are the mischief-makers (in reality) , but they perceive this not (due to their ignorance, disbelief and arrogance) .
2:13: And when it is said to them, "Believe as the people— (the companions of Muḥammad and his followers) —have believed (both inwardly and outwardly, with the heart, tongue and limbs combined) ," they say, "Should we believe like the fools have believed?" Indeed, it is they who are the fools (in reality) , but they know (it) not.
2:14: And when they meet those who believe, they say (with their tongues what is not in their hearts) —"We believe". But when they are alone with their evil ones (from their chiefs and leaders) , they say, "Indeed, we are with you, we were only mocking (the believers by pretending to be with them) ."
2:15: (But) Allāh mocks them (in return) and grants them respite in their transgression, prolonging them therein so that they wander blindly (as recompense for their mockery of those who believe) .
2:16: Those are the ones who have purchased (the inferior merchandise of) error in exchange for (the valuable price of) guidance. So their trade was profitless, and nor were they guided.
2:17: Their similitude is that of the one who— (in the darkness) —kindled a fire, and when it illuminated what was around him (and brought him benefit and relief from potential harm) , Allāh took away their light and left them in complete darkness (so) they could no longer see.
2:18: They are deaf (to hearing goodness) , dumb (from speaking it) and blind (from seeing truth) , so they will not return (to the right path because they abandoned it with knowledge and intent) .
2:19: Or (their similitude is) like a rainstorm from the sky within which is darkness, thunder and lightning. They put their fingers in their ears against the stunning thunderclaps for fear of death. But Allāh is encompassing of the disbelievers.
2:20: The lightning almost snatches away their sight. Every time it lights (the way) for them, they walk therein. But when darkness envelopes them, they stand (still) . And if Allāh had willed, He could have taken away their hearing and their sight. Indeed, Allāh has power over all things.
2:21: O mankind! Worship your Lord (alone) , who created you and those before you so that you may become pious.
2:22: Who made for you the earth as a stretched out expanse (for provision, settlement and repose) and the sky a ceiling, and who sent down water from the sky and brought forth thereby fruits as provision for you. So do not set up rivals for Allāh (in worship) while you know (that none deserves to be worshipped but Him alone) .
2:23: And if you (O unbelievers) are in doubt about (the truthfulness of) what We have sent down upon Our servant (Muḥammad) , then produce a chapter of its like and call upon your witnesses (and your deities) besides Allāh (as your supporters and helpers in this endeavour) , if you are truthful.
2:24: But if you do not (bring a chapter of its like) —and you will never be able to do so (in the future) —then (declare your belief in Allāh, His Messenger and His Book and thereby) fear the Fire whose fuel is men and stones, (which is already created and) prepared for the disbelievers (in Allāh and His messengers) .

2:101: And (instead of believing in this Qurʾān) (or: abiding by their Torah) they (the past and contemporary Israelites) followed what the devils rehearsed (of magic) during the reign of Solomon (which they falsely attributed to him) . It was not Solomon who disbelieved (as they claim) , but the devils (among men) disbelieved, teaching people magic and what was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut (as a trial for men) . But they (the angels) did not teach anyone without (advising them by) saying: “We are (sent as) a trial, so do not disbelieve (by learning and practicing magic) .” However, they learned from them both (of magic) that by which they separate between a man and his wife, but they are unable to harm anyone through it except by Allāh’s permission. And they learn what harms them and does not benefit them. And they (the Israelites in the era of Solomon and those who inherited it thereafter) certainly knew that whoever purchased (magic) would not have any share in the hereafter. And evil indeed is that for which they sold themselves, if only they knew.

But indeed, a party of them do conceal the truth (that is in their scriptures regarding the Prophet and the Kaʿbab in Bakkah, in Paran, the desert of Ḥijāz) while they know it.

2:157: Those are the ones upon whom are praises, blessings and mercy from their Lord and (more) mercy (thereafter) . And it is those who are the (rightly) guided ones.

2:181: The month of Ramaḍān (is the one) in which the Qurʾān was revealed, a guidance for people and clear proofs of guidance (regarding tawḥid, messengership and law) and criterion (between truth and falsehood, right and wrong) . So whoever among you sights the (new crescent of) the month, let him fast it. And whoever is ill or on a journey, then (let him make up his missed fasts) from an equal number of other days (thereafter) . Allāh wants ease for you and does not want hardship for you and (wants) for you to complete the period and to magnify Allāh (with His praises) for that which He has guided you to, and that you may be grateful (to Him with reverent obedience) .

So let them respond to Me (by obeying My commands) and let them believe in Me (more strongly) that they may proceed upon right guidance.

2:191: And kill (those who fought against you) wherever you encounter them and expel them from wherever they have expelled you (the city of Mecca) . The tribulation (of disbelief, polytheism and persecution of the believers) is worse than (the believers) killing (them at the Sacred Mosque) . Do not fight them by the Sacred Mosque until they fight you therein (first) . If they fight you, then kill them them and such is the (just) recompense of the disbelievers.
2:192: But if they cease (fighting you, and repent and believe) , then indeed, Allāh is All-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
2:193: And fight them until there is no more tribulation (the forces of idolatry, and what they entail of oppression and persecution) and (until) worship is acknowledged to be for (none but) Allāh. If they cease then there is to be no hostile recompense except against the wrongdoers (who do not cease fighting and persecution) .
2:194: (Your sanction to fight, if required, in) the sacred month (of Dhū al-Qaʿdah) is for (the polytheists wanting to fight you in) the sacred month, and for (all) violations (of sanctities) there is lawful retribution. So whoever assaulted you, then assault him in the same way that he assaulted you. And fear Allah (by being just with your enemy) , and know that Allāh is with those who fear him (through reverent obedience) .
2:221: And they ask you about the menstruation (of women) . Say: It is a harm (to have intercourse with them during it) , so keep away from women during menstruation and do not approach them (for intercourse) until they have become pure. And when they have purified themselves, then come to them from where Allāh has ordained for you (in any manner you please in the permitted place) . Indeed, Allāh loves those who constantly repent and He loves those who purify themselves.

2:251: Those messengers, We favoured some over others (by making them superior in some qualities and aspects) . Among them were those that Allāh spoke to (directly) and He raised some of them in degrees (of honour) . And we gave to Jesus, Son of Mary, clear, evident signs and We supported him through the Sanctified Spirit (Gabriel). Had Allāh so willed, the succeeding generations (who came after those messengers) would not have fought each other, after clear evidences had already come to them (through those messengers) . However, they differed among themselves. From them were those who believed and from them were those who disbelieved. And if Allāh had willed, they would not have fought each other, but Allāh is the doer of whatever He wills.

2:254: Allāh! There is none worthy of worship (in truth) except Him (alone) , the Ever-Living (who never dies) , the Self-Subsisting Sustainer (of all things) . Drowsiness does not overtake Him, and nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. (Therefore) , Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is ahead of them (of the hereafter) and what is behind them (of affairs past in the world) . And they do not encompass anything of His knowledge except that which He wills (to reveal to them) . His Kursī extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most Exalted, the Magnificently Great.

2:266: Would one of you like to have a garden of date palms and grapevines beneath which rivers flow having all (kinds of) fruit therein, but he is stricken with old age (when he is most in need) and has weak offspring (unable to help him) and it is struck by a whirlwind containing fire, and is burned (entirely) . Thus does Allāh make clear to you the signs (regarding the deeds of the hypocrite and the insincere worshipper) that you may reflect.
2:281: The Messenger has believed in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and (so have) the believers (who are described in the beginning of the sūrah) . 4:151: … They are the disbelievers in truth. And we have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
4:152: But those who believe in Allāh and His Messengers and do not differentiate between any one of them, to those He will give them their rewards. And ever is Allāh Oft-Forgiving, Merciful.
4:153: The (Jews among the) People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven (as did Moses, to be convinced of your prophethood) . But (their ancestors) had asked of Moses (what was) even greater than that, so they said: “Show Allāh to us direct (so we can see him with our eyes) .” So We struck them with the lightning strike for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf (for worship) after the clear evidences had come to them (those that led Pharoah to free them) , and We pardoned (them for) that (descent into idolatry) . And We gave Moses clear authority (over them, to force their repentance from it) .
4:154: And We raised over them the mountain (making it a canopy over them) to take from them (a firm) covenant (to adhere to the Torah) and We said to them (on another occasion, after their period of wandering in the wilderness) : “Enter the gate (of the town) while bowing humbly (and seeking forgiveness) ” (but they disobeyed) , and We said to them: “Do not transgress the Sabbath (by hunting for fish) ” (but they disobeyed) , and We took from them a strict covenant (which they did not adhere to) .
4:155: And (We cursed and punished them) for their breaking of the covenant, and their disbelief in the signs of Allāh (those that forced Pharoah to free them, and the Gospel and the Qurʾān) , and their killing of the prophets (unjustly) without right, and their saying (to the messengers) : “Our hearts are wrapped (and don’t understand) .” Rather, Allāh has sealed (their hearts) because of their disbelief, so they do not believe (at all) , except a small number (from them, such as ʿAbd Allāh bin Salām, Mukhayrīq and their likes) .
4:156: And (We cursed them) for their disbelief (in Jesus the Messiah) and their uttering against Mary (the pure and purified, the most chaste of women) a mighty slander (that she had illicit relations and gave birth to an illegitimate child) .
4:157: And (for) their (boastful and sarcastic) saying: “Indeed, we killed ‘the (so-called) Messiah, Jesus, (the illegitimate) son of Mary, the (so-called) messenger of Allāh’”, but they did not kill him nor did they crucify him, but it was made to appear to them (that they had killed him) . And verily, those (Jews and Christians) who differ over it are in doubt regarding it. They do not have any (confirmed) knowledge regarding it except the following of conjecture. And they did not kill him (as a matter of) certainty.
4:158: Rather, Allāh raised him (alive) to Himself, and ever, is Allāh All-Mighty (who cannot be overcome) , All-Wise (in everything that He does) .
4:159: And there is none from the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) except that he will surely believe in him (Jesus) (after his descent from the heaven) before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection, he will be a witness against them (testifying that he fulfilled his trust and conveyed the message, and that he is a humble servant of Allāh, a worshipper and not the worshipped) .
4:160: Hence, for (great) wrongdoing done by those who repented (after worshipping the calf) , We made unlawful to them (certain) good (and wholesome) foods which had been lawful to them (such as the fat of cattle and sheep) , and for their hindering from Allāh’s path, many (people) .
4:161: And for their taking of usury while they had been prohibited from (taking) it (categorically, from anyone) , and their consuming the wealth of people with falsehood (through bribery, deception, fraud and all prohibited means) , and We have prepared for the disbelievers among them (who persist upon disbelief, oppression and sin) a painful punishment (on top of their punishment in this life) .
4:162: But those who are firm in knowledge among them (the Jews, their learned sages such as ʿAbd Allāh bin Salam, Mukhayrīq, Usayd bin Thaʿlabah and others) , and the believers, they believe in what has been revealed to you and what was revealed before you (to Moses, Jesus and the prophets) , and the establishers of prayer, and the givers of zakāh and the believers in Allāh and the Last Day, it is to them that We will give a great reward.
4:166: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong (and injustice in addition to that, by concealing the Prophet’s description in their scripture) , Allāh is not going to forgive them, and nor going to guide them to a path (that leads them to Islām) .
4:167: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong (and injustice in addition to that, by concealing the Prophet’s description in their scripture) , Allāh is not going to forgive them, and nor going to guide them to a path (that leads them to Islām) .
4:168: Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong (and injustice in addition to that, by concealing the Prophet’s description in their scripture) , Allāh is not going to forgive them, and nor going to guide them to a path (that leads them to Islām) .
4:169: Except the path of Hell (that they have chosen for themselves) , to abide therein forever. And for Allāh, that has always been easy (to bring to completion) .
4:171: O People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians) , do not exaggerate in (the affairs of) your religion (by exceeding the limits with respect to Jesus, Son of Mary) and do not say of Allāh (anything) but the truth. Verily, the Messiah, Jesus, Son of Mary is (no more than) the Messenger of Allāh and (a servant of His, created through) His Word (of command, “Be”) which He delivered to Mary (through Jibrīl) , and a (created) spirit from Himself (blown into Mary by Jibrīl, without impregnation by a man) . So believe in Allāh and (all) His Messengers and do not say: “Three.” (That you) desist (from this speech) is better for you. Verily, Allāh is but one Deity, Sublime is He from having a son. To Him belongs what is in Heavens and what is in the Earth, and sufficient is Allāh as Disposer (of all affairs) .
4:172: Never would the Messiah be ashamed (and consider himself to be above) being a servant of Allah (who is engaged in His worship) , nor would the angels near (to Him) . And whoever disdains worshipping Him (exclusively) and is arrogant (towards His worship) , He will gather them to Himself all together (and judge between them) .
5:31: Indeed, the recompense for those who wage war against Allāh and His Messenger and strive upon the earth with corruption— (by acts of murder, banditry, kidnapping, rape and terrorism) —is that they are killed, or crucified, or that their hands and feet are cut off from opposite sides, or that they are exiled from the land. That is disgrace for them in (this) world, and in the hereafter, they will have a mighty punishment.
5:32: Indeed, the recompense for those who wage war against Allāh and His Messenger and strive upon the earth with corruption— (by acts of murder, banditry, kidnapping, rape and terrorism) —is that they are killed, or crucified, or that their hands and feet are cut off from opposite sides, or that they are exiled from the land. That is disgrace for them in (this) world, and in the hereafter, they will have a mighty punishment.
5:33: Indeed, the recompense for those who wage war against Allāh and His Messenger and strive upon the earth with corruption— (by acts of murder, banditry, kidnapping, rape and terrorism) —is that they are killed, or crucified, or that their hands and feet are cut off from opposite sides, or that they are exiled from the land. That is disgrace for them in (this) world, and in the hereafter, they will have a mighty punishment.
5:34: Except those who repent— (and come back after having committed these crimes) — before you (capture them and) gain power over them. Then know that Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
5:41: O Messenger, let those not grieve you who hasten to disbelief from those (hypocrites) who say: “We believe” with their mouths while their hearts do not believe ∴ and from those who are Jews ∴ are avid listeners (who listen for the purpose) of lying and listeners (Banū Qurayḍhah, who listen for the purpose of spying) for another people who have not come to you (in person) (the Jews of Khaybar) . They distort the words (of the Torah) from their proper places. They say: “If you are given this (ruling of flogging and scalding the adulterer instead of stoning) then accept it, and if you are not given it, then beware.” And he for whom Allāh intends the tribulation (of error and misguidance) , you are unable to do anything for him against Allāh. They are the ones whose hearts Allāh does not want to purify (from disbelief and hypocrisy) . For them is a disgrace in this world (through the exposure of the hypocrisy of the hypocrites, and the alteration of the Jewish rabbis of their Torah) , and for them is great punishment in the hereafter.
5:42: They are avid listeners to lies (or: avid listeners for the purpose of lying) , devourers of what is unlawful (through bribery in judgements) . So if they come to you (O Muḥammad, regarding the dispute between themselves) , then judge between them or turn away from them. And if you judge, then judge between them with justice. Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.
5:43: But how do they come to you for judgement while they have the Torah (which they claim to follow) , in which is Allāh’s (unabrogated) judgement (regarding the adulterer and the law of retribution) ? Then they turn away (even) after that, and those (who do that) are not (really) believers
5:44: Indeed, we sent down the Torah (upon Moses) , in which there was guidance and light. The prophets who submitted (their will to Allāh, including Muḥammad) judged by it for the Jews, as did the rabbis and scholars (of the past and those in the era of the Prophet who were truthful about the judgement regarding adultery in the Torah) , from that which they had been entrusted of preservation of Allāh’s Book, and for which they were witnesses (against those who lied and altered the Torah) . Therefore (O rabbis and scholars of the Jews) , do not fear the people, but fear Me and do not sell My signs for a small price (by concealing the truth) . And whoever does not judge by what Allāh has revealed, then they are the disbelievers.
5:45: And We ordained for them therein that a life (taken) for a life, an eye for an eye, a nose for a nose, an ear for an ear, a tooth for a tooth, and wounds (like for like) is (lawful) retribution. But whoever is charitable with (his right of retribution) , it shall be an expiation (of sin) for him. And whoever does not judge by what Allāh revealed, then they are the oppressors.
5:46: And following after them— (the Israelite Prophets) —we sent Jesus, son of Mary, confirming that which came before him of the Torah (who believed in it, acted upon and judged by it) , and we gave him the Injīl (Gospel) in which was guidance (to truth) and light (in removing doubts) , and as confirmation of what had come before it of the Torah, and as guidance and admonition for the pious.
5:47: (And We commanded them thus:) “And let the People of the Gospel judge by what Allāh revealed therein (of truth, guidance, unabrogated law and the good news of a prophet to come, without distortion and alteration) .” And whoever does not judge by what Allāh has revealed, then they are the (rebellious) sinners.
5:48: And We revealed to you (O Muḥammad) the Book in truth, in confirmation what came before it of scripture and as a criterion over it. So judge between them (the People of the Book) by what Allāh has revealed (in this Qur’ān and what is unabrogated of past scripture if they raise their disputes to you) , and do not follow their desires, away from what has come to you of the truth. To each (nation) among you (from the nations of Moses, Jesus and Muḥammad) , We prescribed a law and a (clear) way. Had Allāh willed, He would have certainly made you a single nation, but (He intended) to test you in what He gave you (of guidance and law) . So race towards the good deeds (by following the Qurʾān which has confirmed all truth in past scripture and abrogated it) . To Allāh is the return of you all, then He will inform you about that in which you used to differ (regarding the truth) .
5:49: And judge (O Muḥammad) between them by what Allāh revealed and do not follow their desires and beware of them (the corrupt scholars of the Jews) , lest they tempt you away from some of what Allāh revealed (in the Torah regarding the prescribed punishments for crimes) . And if they turn away (from the judgement of the Qurʾān and unabrogated Torah law) , then know that Allāh only intends to afflict them with some of their (past) sins (to hasten their punishment) . And indeed, many among mankind are (rebellious) sinners.
5:50: Then is it the judgment of (the era of) ignorance (the laws of the polytheists and idol-worshippers) that they (the Jews who came to you) seek (after you had judged for them with truth and justice from their own scripture) ? But who is better than Allāh in judgement for a people who are certain (in faith) .
5:51: O you who believe! Do not (be like the hypocrites who) take the Jews and Christians as allies, for they (the Jews) are allies of each other (and the Christians likewise) (or: they are allies of each other in their enmity towards you) . And whoever takes them as an ally, then indeed, he is one of them. Verily, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoers.
5:52: So you see those in whose hearts is a disease (of doubt and hypocrisy) hastening to their (allegiance) , saying: “We are afraid that misfortune may befalls us (if Muḥammad is defeated and they, the Jews, regain power) .” So perhaps Allāh will bring a victory (for Muḥammad over his adversaries) or a decision from Him (which exposes the affair of the hypocrites) , and they become regretful over what they concealed in themselves.
5:53: And (thereafter) those who believe will say (to the Jews regarding those hypocrites) : “Are these the ones who swore by Allāh their strongest oaths that they were indeed with you (in loyalty and support) ?” Their deeds have become worthless, and they have become losers.
5:71: They have certainly disbelieved who say: “Allāh is the Messiah, son of Mary” while the Messiah said “O Children of Israel, worship Allāh (alone) , my Lord and your Lord.” Indeed, he who associates (others) with Allāh (in His unicity and worship) , then Allāh has forbidden Paradise for him, and his abode will be the Fire. And for the wrongdoers, there are no helpers (to deliver them) .
5:72: They have certainly disbelieved who say: “Allāh is the Messiah, son of Mary” while the Messiah said “O Children of Israel, worship Allāh (alone) , my Lord and your Lord.” Indeed, he who associates (others) with Allāh (in His unicity and worship) , then Allāh has forbidden Paradise for him, and his abode will be the Fire. And for the wrongdoers, there are no helpers (to deliver them) .
5:73: They have certainly disbelieved who say: “Allāh is the third of three.” But there is no god (worthy of worship in truth) except One God. And if they do not desist from what they say, there will surely afflict those who (continue to) disbelieve among them a painful punishment.
5:74: So will they not repent to Allāh (from those beliefs by affirming His unicity) and ask Him for forgiveness (for what they falsely attributed to Him) ? And Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
5:75: The Messiah, son of Mary was not except a messenger, (many) messengers have passed on before him, and his mother was truthful (to the utmost, in belief, word and deed) . They both used to eat food (like everyone else, having human needs and limitations, unlike their Lord) . Look at how We make clear the signs for them, then look at how they are deluded (away from the truth) .
5:76: Say (O Muḥammad) : “Do you worship besides Allāh, that which possesses no power to harm you and nor benefit you while Allāh (alone) is the All-Hearing (of all that men say) , the All-Knowing (of their states, predicaments and needs) ?”
5:77: Say (O Muḥammad) : “O People of the Scripture, do not exceed the limits in your religion (with exaggeration, extremism and neglect) beyond the truth, and do not follow the desires of a people (from your predecessors) who had gone astray before (with respect to the laws of the Torah, and Jesus and the Gospel) , and had misled many and strayed from the sound path (of right conduct) .”
5:78: Cursed were those who disbelieved among the Children of Israel on the tongue of David and Jesus, son of Mary. That was because they disobeyed (their Lord) and used to transgress (His limits) .
5:79: They never used to forbid one another from (the habitual) evil that they did (such as bribery in judgement or violation of the Sabbath) . How wretched (and evil) was what they used to do.
5:80: You see many of them (the Jews from the People of the Scripture, such as Kaʿb bin al-Ashraf and those feigning Islām) allying with those (polytheists and idol-worshippers) who disbelieve (in order to wage war against you, to protect their interests) . How wretched (and evil) is what their souls have sent forth, for which reason Allāh has become angry with them, and in the punishment (of the hereafter), they will abide forever (for their disbelief, hypocrisy and treachery) .
5:81: And if they had (truly) believed in Allāh and the Prophet and what was sent down to him, they would not have taken them as allies, but many of them are defiant sinners (who oppose their own scripture and messenger) .
5:82: You will surely find the severest of people in enmity towards the believers (to be) the Jews and those who associate partners (with Allāh in worship) (the polytheists and idolators) . And you will surely find the nearest of them in affection to the believers those who say: “We are Christians.” That is because among them are priests (given to learning) and monks (given to worship) and because they are not arrogant.
5:83: And when they hear what has been sent down to the Messenger (in this Qurʾān of the story and true status of Jesus and Mary) , you see their eyes overflowing with tears because of what they have recognised of the truth. They say: “Our Lord, we have believed, so write us down among the witnesses (who testify to Your unicity and the truth of Your messengers and their message to mankind) .”
5:84: “And why should we not believe in Allāh (as the only God worthy of worship) and what has come to us of the truth (in the Qurʾān) . And we wish for our Lord to admit us (to Paradise) with the righteous.”
5:85: So because of what they said (of words of truth and justice, out of firm conviction) Allāh rewarded them with gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever. And that is the reward of the doors of good.
5:86: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our signs, they are the companions of Hellfire.
5:106: (Listen and be warned of) the Day when Allāh will gather the messengers and say: “What was the response you received (from men to your message) ?” They will say: “We have no knowledge (like your knowledge, about what they did after us, and their hidden intentions) , indeed, You (alone) are the knower of all things hidden.”

5:110: (The Day) When Allāh will say: “O Jesus, son of Mary, remember My favour upon you (whom I made a prophet) and your mother (whom I purified and chose over all women) when I supported you with the Holy Spirit (Gabriel) so that you (could) speak to the people in the cradle (to defend your mother) and in maturity (to convey My message) , and when I taught you (the art of) writing (or: scripture) , and wisdom (through deep understanding) , and the (law of the) Torah and the Gospel, and when you designed from clay (what was) like the form of a bird with My permission, then you breathed (life) into it and it became a (living) bird with My permission, and you healed those born blind and the leper with My permission, and when you brought forth the dead with My permission, and when I restrained the Children of Israel from you (when they plotted to humiliate you and have you killed) when you came to them with (many miracles as) clear evidences (of your prophethood) and those who disbelieved among them said: ‘This is nothing but plain magic.’”
5:111: “And when I inspired to the disciples: ‘Believe in Me and in My messenger’, they said: ‘ (Bear witness O Jesus) , We have believed (in Allāh’s unicity) and bear witness that we are Muslims (who are sincere in belief, and submit to His will through obedience) .’”
5:112: “And (remember O Jesus) when the disciples said: ‘O Jesus, son of Mary, will your Lord respond (to a request) to send down to us a table (spread with food) from the heaven?’ He said: ‘Fear Allāh, if indeed, you are (truly) believers.’”
5:113: “They said: ‘We wish to eat from it and to let our hearts be reassured (with certainty) and to have (certain) knowledge that you have been truthful to us, and so that we may be amongs its witnesses (for those who do not observe it) .’”
5:114: (Seeing their correct objective) Jesus, son of Mary, said: “O Allāh, Our Lord, send down to us a table spread (with food) from the heaven, that it may be for us, the first and the last of us, a festival and a sign from You (demonstrating your Lordship and exclusive right to worship) , and provide for us, for You are the best of providers.”
5:115: Allāh said: “Indeed, I will send it down to you, but whoever among you disbelieves afterwards, then I will punish him with a punishment which which I have not punished anyone among the worlds.”
5:116: And (remember the Day) when Allāh will say: “O Jesus, son of Mary (confirm for them, to establish the proof against them) , did you say to people, take me and my mother as two gods (to worship) besides Allāh?” He will say: “Glorified are You (from all imperfection) . It was not for me to say what I had no right (to say) . If I had said it, You would have known it. You know what is within myself and I do not know what is within Yourself. Indeed, You (alone) are the knower of all things hidden.”
5:117: “I did not say to them except what Your commanded me to say to them, that ‘Worship Allāh (alone) , my Lord and your Lord.’ And I was a witness over them while I dwelt among them (as to which of them established this and which of them did not) , but when You took me up (to the heaven) , you were the Watcher over them, and You are a witness over all things.”
5:118: “If you punish (the disbelievers among) them, then indeed, they are Your servants, and if You forgive (the believers among) them, then indeed, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise (whose might and wisdom necessitates this just recompense) .”
5:119: Allāh will say (after Jesus has answered) : “This is the Day when the truthful (who worshipped Allāh and obeyed His messengers) will benefit from their truthfulness.” They will have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allāh is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. That (reward of Paradise) is the great success.
5:120: To Allāh (alone) belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and whatever is within them (of the angels, Jesus, the prophets and messengers and all creatures) . And He is powerful over all things.

6:77: Then, when he saw the moon rising (up from the horizon) he said (to his people) : “This is (supposed to be) my lord (according to you) .” So when it disappeared he said (hinting to his people as to their misguidance) : Unless my Lord makes me (remain) upon guidance (and protects me from your association) , I shall surely be among the astray people.”
6:78: Then, when he saw the sun rising up, he said (to his people) : “This is (supposed to be) my lord (according to you) , this is greater (in its illumination than the stars and the moon) .” But when it disappeared, he said (completing his argument against them) : “O my people, indeed, I am free from (the created, subjected, temporal, fleeting, disappearing things) that you associate (as partners in worship with Allāh) .
6:79: Indeed, I have turned my face (in exclusive devotion and worship) towards He who originated the Heavens and the Earth, being uprightly inclined towards truth, and I am not of the associationists (who worship others alongside Allāh) .

39:4: If Allāh wished to take a son (for Himself) , He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He wills (as a son) . But Sublime (is He from such a thing) . He is Allāh, the One, the Subduer (who is never overcome) .

46:2: The revelation of the Book is from Allāh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.
46:3: We did not create the Heavens and Earth and whatever is in between them except with the truth (of the statement that none deserves to be worshipped except Allāh alone) , and (for) an appointed term. But those who disbelieve turn away— (while engaged in amusements and distractions) —from that about which they are warned (of the resurrection and recompense) .
46:4: Say (O Muḥammad) : “Have you considered (the affair of) what you invoke besides Allāh? Show me what they have created of the earth (as evidence for your worship of them) . Or did they have a share in (the creation of) the heavens (such that they deserve worship) ? Bring me a book (revealed before this Qurʾān which commands this) or some trace of (transmitted) knowledge (to prove your claim) if you are truthful.
46:5: And who is more astray (in religion and intellect) than he who invokes besides Allāh those who will not respond to him until the Day of Resurrection and who are unaware of their invocation (which is being directed to them) .
46:6: And when the people (the worshippers and the worshipped) are gathered (on the Day of which they were warned) , they— (who were taken as deities and worshipped) —will become enemies to them— (who had worshipped them) —and will become deniers of their worship, (freeing themselves from them and the false worship directed to them) .
46:7: And when Our verses (which are) clear (in their evidences and truthfulness) are recited to them, those who disbelieve say of the truth (in these verses) when it comes to them: “This is clear magic!”
46:8: Or do they say (when it is recited to them) : “He (Muḥammad) has forged it (as revelation from Allāh) ?” Say: “If I have forged it, then you possess no power to protect me in anything from Allāh (and His punishment) . He is most knowledgeable of what you say (in private) among yourselves about it (that it is a mere fabrication, or magic, or poetry, or tales) . Sufficient is He as a Witness between me and you (that I am truthful and you are liars) . Yet He is the Oft-Forgiving (to those who repent) , Ever-Merciful (to His believing servants) (perhaps that you may be drawn to repentance) .
46:9: Say (O Muḥammad) : “I am not a novelty, the first among the messengers (of Allāh) (as many came before me) . I do not know what will be done with me or with you (in the affair of this world) . I (do not fabricate or innovate anything, but) only follow what is revealed to me, and I am not except a clear warner.
46:10: Say: “ (O Pagans of Quraysh and later, O Jews of Medina) , have you considered that if this Qurʿān was from Allāh, and you disbelieved in it while a witness among the Children of Israel— (the Prophet Moses or the learned Jewish scholar, ʿAbd Allāh bin Salām) —testified to its like (in the Torah, of monotheism, messengership, resurrection and recompense) , and then believed in it while you arrogantly reject it (that you are not anything but astray) ?” Verily, Allāh does not guide the wrongdoing people.
46:11: And those who disbelieve (from the Nobles of Quraysh, and then later, the Jews) say to those who believe: “If (the message of Muḥammad) was a good thing, then they (the weak and poor or the likes of ʿAbd Allāh bin Salām) would not have preceded us to it.” And when they do not guide themselves by it they will say (in order to explain it away) : “This (Qurʾān is composed of the tales of) ancient falsehood (which Muḥammad has compiled) .”
46:12: And before it — (this Qurʾān) —was the Scripture of Moses as a guide and mercy (to its adherents) (but which they, the Jews, did not adhere to) . And this — (the Qurʿān) —is a confirming Book (revealed) in an Arabic tongue to warn those (Pagans) who do wrong and (to serve) as good tidings to the doers of good.
46:13: Verily, those who say: “Our Lord is Allāh (besides whom none is worthy of worship) ” and then remain steadfast (upon this statement with obedience and righteousness) , there shall be no fear over them (in the Hereafter) and nor shall they grieve (over what they leave behind after death) .
46:14: Those are the inhabitants of Paradise, abiding therein forever as reward for what they used to work (of righteous deeds) .
46:15: And We have enjoined upon man to be dutiful and kind to his parents. His mother bore him (in her womb) with hardship and gave birth to him with (more) hardship. And his bearing (in the womb) and weaning (period) is thirty months (in total) . (Then he continues to grow) until, when he reaches the peak of his youth, and reaches (the age of) 40 years, he says: “O my Lord, grant me the ability to be grateful to you for Your favour (of guidance) which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and to work righteousness that pleases You, and make righteous for me my offspring. Indeed, I repent to you and I am of the Muslims (in submission to You alone) .”
46:16: Those are the ones from whom We shall accept the best of their deeds (the ones which are rewardable, the obligatory and commended) and overlook their evil deeds, (whereby they shall) enter among the (generality of the) inhabitants of Paradise. (That is) the promise of truth which they used to be promised (by the Messengers of their Lord) .
46:17: But as for the one who says to his parents (when they call him to belief in Allāh and the resurrection) : “Fie to you both! Are you promising me that I shall be brought out (of the earth again) while generations have already perished before me (without being resurrected) ”, the while they (the parents) invoke Allāh for help (in guiding their son) (and say to their son) : “Woe be to you! Believe! Indeed, the promise of Allāh is true.” But he says (in response) : “This is nothing but the tales of the ancients (written and passed on which you came across and believed in) .”
46:18: Those are the ones against whom the word (of punishment) has become justified and put into effect (whereby, through this fate of theirs, they) enter among (the destroyed) nations which had passed on before them of jinn and men. Indeed, they were losers (for destroying themselves with sins) .
46:19: And for all— (believers and disbelievers, whose mention has preceded) —are degrees (of reward and punishment) for what they have done. And (it is as such) so that He may recompense them fully for their deeds without them being wronged.
46:20: And on the Day when those who disbelieved (in the Messengers and their call) are exposed to the Fire, (it will be said to them) : “ (Have) you exhausted your good things (which you were given) in your worldly life, and took your pleasure from them (?) . So (now) on this Day you will be recompensed (in full) with a punishment of humiliation because you used to be arrogant upon the earth without due right, and because you used to disobey rebelliously.
46:21: And mention (to them) (O Muḥammad) (the story of Hūd) the brother of (the nation of) ʿĀd, when he warned his people in (the region) of al-Aḥqāf, and warners had already passed before him and after him, (saying to them) : “Worship none but Allāh (alone) . Indeed, I fear for you the torment of a mighty day.”
46:22: They said: “Have you come to us (out of envy in order) to mislead us away from our gods? Then bring to us what you have promised us (of punishment for worshipping these gods) , if you are of the truthful.”
46:23: He said: “Verily, the knowledge (of the time it shall befall you) is with Allāh (alone) . And I convey to you that which I have been sent with (of revelation) . However, I see that you are a people showing foolish ignorance (of the consequences of your deeds) (and in requesting the hastening of your punishment out of mockery) .
46:24: Then when they saw it as a dense, large cloud— (spanning the horizon) —approaching their valleys, they said (in rejoicement) : “This is a cloud bringing us rain.” (Hūd said) : “Rather, it is what you asked to be hastened. A wind (within the cloud) wherein is a painful punishment.”
46:25: Destroying everything (it was decreed to destroy) by the command of its Lord. So they became such that nothing could be seen except (the structures) of their dwellings. Thus do we recompense the criminal people.
46:26: And We had certainly established them (in the land) with such (bodily strength, length of life and abundant wealth) as We have not established you (O Pagans of Quraysh, and which if We did, you would have exceeded them in transgression) . And We made for them faculties of hearing, seeing and understanding (with the hearts) . But their hearing, seeing and hearts did not avail them in anything (from Allah’s punishment) when they continued denying the signs of Allāh, and they were completely encompassed by that (punishment) which they used to mock.
46:27: And indeed, We have destroyed what surrounds you of the cities (such as Ḥijr, ʿĀd, Thamūd, Sodom, Maʾrib and others) and We diversified the (types of) signs (shown to them) perhaps that they might return (from disbelief to belief) .
46:28: So why did those whom they took as gods besides Allāh as a means of nearness (to Him) not aid them (when the punishment fell) . Rather, they (the deities) left them in the lurch (or they, the polytheists, left their deities in the lurch) . And that was their false statement (of disbelief) and what they had been fabricating (that their deities bring them closer to Allāh) .
46:29: And (mention, O Muḥammad) when We directed to you a group of (three to ten of) the Jinn (who were upon the religion of the Jews) , listening to the Qurʾān. And when they attended (its recitation) , they said (among themselves) : “Listen in silence.” And when it was finished, they went back to their people as warners.
46:30: They said: “O our people! Verily, we have heard a Book revealed after Moses, confirming what came before it (of the Torah) , guiding to the truth and to a straight path.”
46:31: “O our people! Respond to— (Muḥammad) —the caller of Allāh and believe in him (and what he has come with) . He (Allāh) will forgive you of your sins and protect you from a painful punishment.”
46:32: And whoever does not respond to Allāh’s caller, then he will not render (Allāh) incapable on earth (by trying to escape from Him) , and he will not have (any) protectors besides Him (who can repel His punishment when it comes) . Those (who do not respond to the call) are in clear error.
46:33: Do they not know that Allāh, who created the heavens and the earth and was not rendered incapable (or fatigued) by their creation, is surely able to give life to the dead (a matter far easier for Him than the creation of the heavens and earth) . Yes indeed, He is able over all things (that He desires to create and wishes to do) .
46:34: And on the Day those who disbelieved (in the call of the Messengers) will be exposed to the Fire (it will be said) : “Is this (punishment you are being subjected to) not the truth (of which you were informed by the Messengers) ?” They will say: “Yes, by our Lord (it is the truth) !” He will say: “Then taste (now) the punishment (of which you were informed) because you used to disbelieve.”
46:35: Therefore, be patient (O Muḥammad) as those with firm will and resolution among the Messengers were patient (after they were rejected) . And be not in haste regarding (what is justified upon) them (of punishment) . On the Day they will see that which they are promised, it will be as if they did not remain (in this world) except an hour of a day. (This Qurʾān is a) notification (conveyed from Allāh to you, through His Messenger, for you to take heed and reflect) . So are any destroyed— (despite the vastness of Allāh’s mercy and bounty) —except a (rebelliously) disobedient people?
47:1: Those (Pagans of Mecca) who disbelieve (in Allāh’s signs and His right to be worshipped alone) and hinder (others) from (entering) the path of Allāh, He will render vain their deeds (of scheming against the Prophet) .
47:2: But those (Muslims of Medina) who believe and work righteous deeds and believe in what has been sent down upon Muḥammad (of the Qurʾān) —and it is the truth from their Lord—He will expiate for them their sins and make good their condition (in this world and the next) .
47:3: That is because those who disbelieve follow falsehood— (which is Satan and his call) —and (because) those who believe follow the truth from their Lord. Thus does Allāh set forth for mankind their similitudes (regarding the outcomes of their actions) .
47:4: So when you meet those who disbelieve (in the field of battle) , then strike their necks until when you have weakened their strength (by killing many and wounding others) , then tie the bonds (of captivity upon them) strongly (so they are unable to escape and cause harm) . Then— (in accordance with what benefits the cause of Islām) — either free them with kindness or hold them to ransom, (and remain engaged in all of this) until the war (waged against you) lays down its burdens. That (is what you are commanded) and if Allāh had so willed, He could have punished (and destroyed) them (without you) . But (He commanded you to fight against them) in order to test some of you with others. And those who are killed in the path of Allāh, then He would never cause their deeds to be lost.
47:5: He will guide them (to being firm in the grave in the barzakh, and on the path leading to Paradise in the hereafter) and rectify their condition (in the hereafter) .
47:6: And admit them to (their residences in) Paradise which He has made known to them.
47:7: O you who believe, if you aid (the cause of) Allāh, He will aid you (against your enemy) and make your foothold firm (upon faith and upon the straight path and against your enemy) .
47:8: But those who disbelieve, then ruin (or misery or humiliation) is for them and He will render vain their deeds.
47:9: That is because they hate that which Allāh has sent down (of this Qurʾān) , so He made vain their deeds (of apparent righteousness) .
47:10: Have they (who reject the Prophet) not travelled through the earth (in the lands of ʿĀd, Thamūd, Lūṭ, Ḥijr and others) and seen how was the end of those before them (who rejected their Prophets) ? Allāh destroyed them completely and for the disbelievers (of Quraysh) is a similar fate (if they do not believe) .
47:11: That is because Allāh is the mawlā (the protector and aider) of those who believe and because the disbelievers, there is no mawlā for them.
47:12: Indeed, Allāh will admit those who believe and work righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. But those who disbelieve enjoy themselves (in this world) and eat as the cattle eat (concerned only with food, pleasure and pastime without any consideration for the Hereafter) , and the Fire will be an abode for them.
47:13: And how many a city (has there been) , which was more intense in power than your city (of Mecca) which expelled you? We destroyed them (when they rejected Our Messengers) and there was no helper for them.
47:14: So is he who is upon clear evidence (from revelation) with respect to (the affair of singling out and worshipping) His Lord like those to whom the evilness of their action(s) (of ingratitude, disbelief and polytheism) has been beautified for them, while they follow their desires (in choosing disbelief over belief) ?
47:15: The description of Paradise which the pious have been promised: In it are rivers of water that is pure and unadulterated, and rivers of milk the taste of which never changes, and rivers of wine delicious to those who drink, and rivers of purified honey. And they shall have every type of fruit therein as well as forgiveness from their Lord. (Are those who will enjoy this reward forever) like those who will dwell forever in the Fire and be given boiling water to drink which cuts up their bowels?
47:16: And among them (the disbelievers) are those (hypocrites) who (come to) listen to you (when you teach or deliver a sermon) until when they depart from you, they say to those (of your companions) who have received knowledge (from you) : “What did he (Muḥammad) say just now?”, (out of mockery, or out of ignorance and lack of comprehension) . They are the ones over whose hearts Allāh has sealed (making them devoid of comprehension and sincerity) , and they follow their desires (in choosing disbelief over belief) .
47:17: But those who receive (and follow) guidance, He increases them in guidance and bestows on them their (works of) piety.
47:18: So are they (who disbelieve) waiting except for the Hour to come upon them suddenly? But some of its signs have already come. Then how will they benefit from their remembrance (of their evil past, their remorse and their repentance) when it comes to them?
47:19: So (be firm in your) knowledge (O Muḥammad) that none has the right to be worshipped except Allāh (alone) . And seek forgiveness for your shortcoming and for (the shortcoming of) the believing men and women. And Allāh knows of your movement (during the daytime, or in this world) and your resting place (during the night, or in the hereafter) .
47:20: And those who believe say: “Why has a chapter (of the Qurʾān) not been sent down?” But when a decisive chapter is sent down (with a clear command) and fighting is mentioned therein, you will see those in whose hearts is a disease (of doubt and hypocrisy) looking at you with a look of one overcome by death. So woe be to them.
47:21: (To give) obedience and (say) a good word (was more befitting for them) . And when the affair (of fighting) became certain, if they had been true to Allāh (with sincerity and obedience) , it would have been better for them (than hypocrisy and disobedience) .
47:22: So would you then—if you turned away (from Allāh's commands) —go on to cause corruption on earth (by spilling unlawful blood) and sever your ties of kinship (as you used to in the pre-Islāmic days of ignorance) ?
47:23: Those (who cause corruption and sever ties of kinship) are the ones whom Allāh has cursed, so He made them deaf (to hearing truth) and blinded their sight (from recognising good) .
47:24: So do they not ponder carefully over the Qurʾān (whereby they would be directed to all good) , or are there locks on (their) hearts (preventing its guidance, admonitions and teachings from entering them) ?
47:25: Indeed, those (Hypocrites or People of the Scripture) who turned back (from belief) after the guidance had become clear to them— (about the command of fighting in the Qurʾān or their sure knowledge that Muḥammad is the one described in their scriptures) — Satan seduced them (by beautifying their errors) and prolonged their term (of pursuing false hopes by means of deception) .
47:26: That is because they (the Hypocrites and the People of the Scripture) said to those who hate what Allāh sent down (the Pagans of Quraysh) : “We will obey you in part of the matter (of enmity towards Muḥammad and stay behind from fighting alongside him so as to weaken him for you) .” But Allāh knows their secrets.
47:27: Then how will it be when the Angels take them (in death) while striking their faces and their backs?
47:28: That (beating by the Angels during death) is because they followed what angered Allah (of treachery against Muḥammad and concealing his description in their scriptures) and (because they) disliked (what earns) His pleasure, so He made their deeds (of apparent righteousness) to be worthless.
47:29: Or do those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy and doubt) think that Allāh will never bring out (and expose) their concealed feelings (of jealousy, enmity and hatred) .
47:30: And had We willed, We would certainly have shown them to you and you would have known them by their marks. But you will surely know them (henceforth) by the deviated tone of (their) speech (which reveals their intentions and agendas) and Allāh knows all your deeds (and willl recompense you for them) .
47:31: And We shall certainly test you until We observe those who strive (in the cause of Allāh) and those who are patient. And We shall test your affairs (to make known the truthful from the liar) .
47:32: Verily, those (Hypocrites and People of the Scripture) who disbelieve and hinder (people) from the path of Allāh, and contend against the Messenger after (the truth of his) guidance has become clear to them, they will not harm Allāh in anything, and He will render vain their deeds (so that they are fruitless in this life and without reward in the next) .
47:33: O you who believe! Obey Allāh (by obeying His Messsenger) and obey the Messenger (by worshipping and obeying Allāh) and do not render vain your deeds (through hypocrisy, doubt, disobedience and insincerity) .
47:34: Verily, those who disbelieve, and hinder (people) from the path of Allāh and then die as disbelievers, Allāh will never forgive them.
47:35: So do not be weak and call for peace while you are superior and dominant over them (in your knowledge of your Lord, in your proof for your religion, and in your war of ending their injustice) . And Allāh is with you (through His aid) and He will never deprive you of (the full reward of) your deeds.
47:36: The worldly life is only (idle) play and (diversionary) pastime, but if you believe (in His sole right to worship) and fear Allāh (by avoiding sin and disobedience) , He will give you your reward and not ask you for your wealth (in return for the delivery of His message) , (or: because He is its true owner and is not in need) , (or: unless it is for obligatory charity) .
47:37: If He should ask you (for your wealth) , and press you (for it) , you would withhold (from giving) and He would, (thereby) , bring out your inner feelings of resentment and malice (towards parting with your wealth) .
47:38: Here you are—as those invited to spend in the cause of Allāh—but among you are those who are miserly. And whoever is miserly (in spending for Allāh’s cause) is only miserly towards himself. And Allāh is the Independent One (free of all need) while you are the poor ones in need. So if you turn away (from faith, obedience and spending in His cause) , He will replace you with some other people, and they will not be of your likes (in miserliness and disobedience) .
48:1: Indeed, We have given you (O Muḥammad) a manifest victory (through this treaty of yours with the polytheists at Ḥudaybiyyah) .
48:2: So that (through the outcome of this treaty) Allāh may forgive you what has passed of your mistakes (prior to Prophethood) and what followed (thereafter) (of your mistakes in leaving a greater good for a lesser one) , and (so that) He may complete His favour upon you (by giving ascendancy to Islām) and guide you to (steadfastness upon) a straight path (by increasing your faith and certainty) .
48:3: And (so that) Allāh may (on account of this treaty) assist you with a mighty assistance (in spreading truth and conquering Mecca) .
48:4: He it is Who (on the Day of Ḥudaybiyyah) sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers (for their obedience to Allāh and His Messenger in the matter of the treaty) that they may increase in faith (and certainty in all future legislations) alongside their present faith (in whatever has already been revealed of truth and guidance) . And to Allāh belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth (which He could have unleashed upon the polytheists if He so willed) —and ever is Allāh all-Knowing (of His creation) , all-Wise (in His words and actions) .
48:5: That He may admit the believing men and believing women— (through their increased faith and certainty) —to gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever and (that He may) expiate from them their sins. And that, with Allāh, is ever a mighty success.
48:6: And that He may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women (in the city of Medina) and the polytheist men and polytheist women— (with defeat, grief and anxiety) —those who think evil thoughts about Allāh (that He will not aid His Prophet and the Believers and not raise His word over theirs) . An encirclement of evil is upon them (through defeat in this world and punishment in the next) . Allāh has become angry with them, has cursed them and has prepared for them (the fire of) Hell, and (what) an evil destination it is.
48:7: And to Allāh belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth (which He can unleash upon the polytheists and hypocrites if He so wills) —and ever is Allāh almighty (in His power) , all-wise (in His words and actions) .
48:8: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness (over creation) (or: over your nation) and a bearer of glad tidings (of reward for the believers who obey you) and a warner (for the disbelievers) (or: the sinful believers) .
48:9: So that (by way of his message and call) you may believe in Allāh and His Messenger and honour him (with obedience and support) and respect him and (so that) you glorify Him morning and afternoon.
48:10: Indeed, those who pledge allegiance to you (O Muḥammad, that they will never flee from you) are (in reality) pledging allegiance to Allāh. The Hand of Allāh is over their hands (while they pledge) . So he who breaks his word (with Allāh) , only breaks it to his own harm. And he who fulfils that which he promised Allāh, He will give Him a great reward.
48:11: Those who remained behind (from accompanying you to ʿumrah) among the bedouins (from the tribes of Ghifār, Juhaynah, Ashjaʿ, Aslam and others) will say to you (out of diplomacy and dissimulation) : “Our possessions and our families preoccupied us, so ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: “So who has power to prevent Allāh at all if He desires harm for you (and your possessions and families) or desires benefit for you?” Rather, ever is Allāh aware of what you do (despite your attempts to deceive us) .
48:12: But you thought that the Messenger and the Believers would never return to their families, ever (thinking that their enemies would annihilate them and Allāh would not help them) and that (thought) was beautified in your hearts (by Satan) , and you did presume an evil presumption (founded on hypocrisy) and you became a people ruined (and unfit for any goodness) .
48:13: And whoever did not believe in Allāh and His Messenger (by believing in what he brought and being sincere in belief, word and deed) , then We have prepared for the disbelievers a Blazing Fire.
48:14: And to Allāh belongs the sovereignty of the Heavens and Earth (wherein He makes His creational and legislative judgements) . He forgives whomever He wills and punishes whomever He wills. And ever is Allāh Oft-Forgiving and Merciful (to he who repents from disbelief and hypocrisy) .
48:15: Those who remained behind (from accompanying you to ʿumrah from which you were turned away by the Pagans of Mecca) will say, when you depart toward the war booty (of Khaybar) to take it, “Let us follow you (and fight alongside you) .” They wish to alter Allāh’s words (that the booty of Khaybar is for those who witnessed Ḥudaybiyyah) . Say: “Never will you (be allowed to) follow us, thus did Allāh say before.” So they will say, “Rather, you envy us (that we should take from the booty with you) .” But they were not understanding save little (about their rights and obligations) .
48:16: Say to those who (of the Hypocrites who) remained behind (from Ḥudaybiyyah) of the bedouins: “You will be called (by Abū Bakr or ʿUmar) to (fight) a people given military power (Banū Ḥanīfah and Musaylamah, the false prophet) (or: the Persians and Romans) , you will fight them until they submit.” So if you obey (and fight them) , Allāh will give you a good reward (from war booty, support in this life and Paradise in the hereafter) , but if you turn away as you turned away before (in the year of Ḥudaybiyyah) , He will punish you with a painful punishment.
48:17: (In contrast to the Hypocrites) , there is not upon the blind any guilt, nor upon the lame any guilt, nor upon the ill any guilt (for remaining behind from Jihād) . And whoever obeys Allāh and His Messenger (by striving in His cause) , He will enter him into gardens beneath which rivers flow. And whoever turns away (when conscripted for Jihād) , He will punish him with a painful punishment.
48:18: Allāh was certainly pleased with the Believers when they pledged allegiance to you beneath the tree (at Ḥudaybiyyah) and He knew what was in their hearts (of truthful intent and fulfilment of their pledge) , so He sent down tranquility upon them (that His promise will become true) and rewarded them with an imminent victory.
48:19: And much war booty (from the Jews of Khaybar) (or: the Persians and Romans) which they will take. And ever is Allāh Mighty and Wise.
48:20: Allāh has promised you much booty that you will acquire (in future victories, such as Khaybar) and has hastened for you (this treaty of Ḥudaybiyyah for that purpose) and restrained the hands of people (with concealed enmity and aggression) from you, that it may be a sign for the Believers (that Allāh and His Messenger are truthful) and (that) He may guide you to a straight path (of increased guidance, firmness and certainty) .
48:21: And (Allāh has promised) other (victories) which have not been within your power (thus far) . Allāh has encompassed them (with His knowledge and power) , and ever is Allāh powerful over all things.
48:22: And if those (Pagans of Mecca) who disbelieve had fought you (at Ḥudaybiyyah) (or: the factions who allied with the Jews of Khaybar against you) , they would have turned their backs (and fled) (due to Allāh forsaking them and aiding you) . Then they would not find a protector and nor a helper (to aid them against you) .
48:23: This (aiding the Believers against the associationists and disbelievers) has been the way of Allāh which has occurred before (with past nations) . Never will you find any change in the way of Allāh.
48:24: And it is He who restrained their hands from you and your hands from them (the Pagans) in the midst of Mecca (at Ḥudaybiyyah) after He made you overcome them (when they fled and you took some of them as captives ) . And ever is Allāh of what you do, all-Seeing.
48:25: They (the Pagans of Makkah) are the ones who disbelieved and hindered you from the Sacred Mosque (by preventing you from ʿumrah) and the sacrificial animals were prevented from reaching their place. And (you would have been permitted to enter Makkah) had it not been for (the presence of) believing men and believing women (who were concealing their faith) whom you did not know, lest you tread over them (in the course of fighting the disbelievers and kill them) , whereby dishonour would befall you without (your) knowledge. (All of this was so) that Allāh may admit to His mercy whom He wills. If they (the believing men and women) had been apart (from the disbelievers) we would have punished those who disbelieved among them (the people of Makkah) with a painful punishment...
48:26: ...given that those who disbelieved had put into their hearts chauvinism (for their deities and the way of their forefathers) , the chauvinism of the (pre-Islamic) era of ignorance (causing them to prevent the Prophet and His Companions from making ʿumrah and refusing to acknowledge His messengership in the writing of the treaty and refusing the writing of the basmalah therein) . So Allāh sent down His tranquility upon His Messenger and the Believers (preserving them from such chauvinism which may have lead them to fight the Pagans) and made them adhere to the word of piety (lā ilāha illallāh, which made them fear Allāh’s displeasure) and they were more worthy of it (than the Pagans of Mecca) and were (destined to be) its people (in Allāh’s prior knowledge as He had chosen them for His religion) . And ever is Allāh, of all things, Knowing.
48:27: Indeed Allāh was truthful to His Messenger (in showing him) the vision in truth (in which the Messenger saw himself and his Companions entering Mecca and making ʿumrah) (and which Allāh shall fulfil and make true) : You will surely enter the Sacred Mosque, if Allāh wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and shortened, you will not fear (your enemy while in iḥrām making ʿumrah) . Thus, He knew what you did not know (about the believing men and women in Mecca who concealed their faith, which you may have killed unknowingly had you fought) and He granted besides that a near victory (with the treaty of Ḥudaibiyyah) .
48:28: It is He who sent His Messenger with (beneficial knowledge as) guidance and (righteous action as) the religion of truth that He may make it prevail over all other religion (after the return of Jesus, son of Mary) . And sufficient is Allāh as a witness (that Muḥammad is His Messenger, despite the Pagans refusal that it should be written in the treaty) .
48:29: Muḥammad is the Messenger of Allāh, and those with him are stern against the disbelievers, merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and prostrating (in prayer) , seeking bounty from Allāh and (His) pleasure. Their mark (on the Day of Resurrection) is (light) on their faces from the trace of prostration (or: the mark of humility and awe on their faces from the effect of frequent prostration) . That is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is as a plant which produces its offshoots and strengthens them so they grow firm and stand upon their stalks, delighting the sowers—so that Allāh may enrage by them the disbelievers (because of their unity, strength and firmness upon religion) . Allāh has promised those who believe and do righteous deeds among them forgiveness and a great reward (which never expires) .
49:1: O you who believe, do not put yourselves ahead of Allāh and His Messenger (by speaking before him) (or: by preceding his command and prohibition and making decisions in affairs of war) and fear Allāh. Verily, Allāh is all-Hearing, all-Knowing.
49:2: O you who believe, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet and do not speak to him loudly as you speak aloud to one another, lest your deeds become worthless while you perceive not.
49:3: Verily, those who lower their voices in the presence of Allāh’s Messenger (out of veneration and respect) they are the ones whose hearts Allāh has tested (and purified) for piety (through His commands and prohibitions and worldly trials) . For them is forgiveness (for their past sins) and a great reward.
49:4: Indeed, those (of the bedouins of Banū Tamīm) who call you (O Muḥammad) from behind the chambers (of your wives) —most of them do not comprehend (due to their overwhelming ignorance of Allāh’s religion) .
49:5: And if they had (shown respect towards you and) been patient until you (could) come out to them, it would have been better for them (in their religious and worldly affairs) . But Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Merciful.
49:6: O you who believe, if there comes to you a disobedient one with information, verify (his report) , lest you harm people in ignorance (of the true state of affairs) and thereafter become regretful over what you have done (in haste and error) .
49:7: And know that among you is the Messenger of Allāh (so fear Allāh with respect to him) . If he were to obey you in much of the matter (in which you express your opinions in affairs unclear) you would fall into much hardship (with burdens of sin) . However, Allāh has endeared faith to you and has beautified it in your hearts and He has made disbelief (in Allāh) , (the) sin (of lying) and disobedience (of His Messenger) hateful to you. Those (so described) , they are the rightly guided ones (who are upon the path of truth) .
49:8: (This endearment and beautification is) a bounty from Allāh and favour (from Him) , and Allāh is all-Knowing (of who deserves guidance and misguidance) , all-Wise (in His speech, deed, legislation and decree) .
49:9: If two parties among the believers should fight (each other) , then make settlement between them (through the Book of Allāh) . But if one of them revolts against the other (and refuses compliance with the judgement of Allāh’s Book) , then fight you (all) against the one that revolts until it complies with the command of Allāh. Then if it complies (by returning to truth) , then make reconciliation between them (by making the transgressing party abide by) justice and act justly (between them) . Verily, Allāh loves those who are just.
49:10: The believers are but brothers (to one another in Islām) , so make reconciliation between your brothers (individuals or parties) (if they differ or fight) . And fear Allāh (in all of your affairs by not opposing His command and not disobeying Him) that you may receive mercy.
49:11: O you who believe, let not a people mock (and belittle) other people, perhaps they (who are mocked) may be better than them (who mock) . Nor let women (mock and belittle) other women, perhaps they (who are mocked) may be better than them (who mock) . Nor insult one another and nor call each other with (offensive) nicknames. How evil it is (to bring upon others, through offensive nicknames) (or: bring upon oneself, through such evil conduct) the label of disobedience after having faith. And whoever does not repent (from such evil conduct) then those are the wrongdoers.
49:12: O you who believe, avoid much suspicion. Indeed, much of suspicion (being devoid of evidence and truth) comprises sin. And do not spy (to seek out errors, shortcomings and what is hidden of others) and let not some of you backbite others. Would one of you like to (physically) eat the flesh of his brother when dead. You would hate (to do) it (or: you would hate people knowing that you did it) (so hate backbiting in a like manner) . And fear Allāh, indeed Allāh is Accepting of repentance, Merciful (to His believing servants) .
49:13: O mankind, We have created you from a male (Ādam) and female (Eve) (making you all of equal lineage) and We made you into nations and tribes that you may know one another (and fulfil each other’s rights) . Verily, the most honourable of you with Allāh is the most pious of you (and not the noblest in lineage or most affluent) (so do not be boastful and belittle others) . Indeed, Allāh is all-Knowing, all-Aware.
49:14: The bedouins (of Banī Asad who accepted Islām during an era of famine) say: “We have believed.” Say: “You have not (yet) believed but say: ‘We have (merely entered Islām) by submitting (outwardly) ’ for (the reality of) faith has not yet entered your hearts (because you proclaimed Islām for a motive, fearing captivity and loss or hoping for gain) . And if you obey Allāh and His Messenger (through righteousness) , He will not deprive from your deeds anything (of reward) . Indeed, Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Merciful.
49:15: Indeed, the (true) believers are (only) those who believe in Allāh and His Messenger and thereafter never doubt (during trials and tribulations) but strive with their possessions and wealth in the cause of Allāh. It is they— (when they say: ‘We are believers’) —who are the truthful ones.
49:16: Say (to those bedouins who claim true faith) : “Are you informing Allāh about your religion (that you claim is in your hearts) ?” While Allāh knows what is in the Heavens and what is in the Earth and Allāh is Knowing of all things?
49:17: They (impress it upon you) as a favour that they accepted islām (without having fought against you, unlike others) . Say: “Do not make out your Islām as a favour to me. But rather (be accepting and humble that) Allāh has conferred a favour upon you that He guided you (with the guidance of knowledge and direction) to faith, if you are indeed (desirous of being) truthful (in your claim to faith) .”
49:18: Indeed, Allāh knows the unseen (hidden affairs) of the Heavens and Earth (from what is concealed in the mountains, oceans, beneath the earth and the hearts of men) . And Allāh is all-Seeing of what you do.
50:2: But they— (the Pagans of Mecca) —wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves (calling them to pure monotheism and warning them of the resurrection) . So the disbelievers said: “This is a strange thing indeed.”
50:3: “When we have died and become dust (shall we be resurrected) ? That is a far-fetched return.”
50:4: We already know what the Earth diminishes of them (through death and decomposition) and with us is a Preserved Book (with all things recorded) .
50:5: But they rejected the truth (of the Qurʾān) when it came to them, so they are in a confused state (regarding it) .
50:6: Have they not looked at the heaven above them (and observed) how We constructed it and beautified it and (how) it has no rifts?
50:7: And the Earth, We have spread it out and We cast firmly rooted mountains therein and We produced growth therein of every beautiful, (delightful) kind.
50:8: An insight and reminder, (in particular) for every (sincere) repentant servant.
50:9: And We send down from the sky a blessed water and We cause to grow therewith gardens and (repeating) harvests of grain.
50:10: And tall date-palms, having clusters (of fruit) arranged in layers.
50:11: As provision for the servants. And We give life therewith to dead land. Thus will be the resurrection (of the dead) .
50:12: Before them, (the Pagans of Mecca) the people of Noah, the Companions of the Rass and the Thāmūd had all denied (their respective messengers) .
50:13: And (the People of) ʿĀd, the Pharoah and the Brethren of Lot.
50:14: And the Companions of the Wood and the People of Tubbaʿ. All of them denied the messengers (sent to them) , so My threat was justly enacted.
50:15: Were We then exhausted by the first creation (such that We are unable to recreate them again) ? But they are in a confused state regarding a new creation (over which We are most able) .
50:16: And we already created man (aforetime) and We know (all that) his soul whispers to him, and We are nearer to him (with our all-encompassing knowledge) than his jugular vein.
50:17: (Remember) that the two receivers (of man’s deeds) receive them (for recording in the scroll) while they are seated (and ready to inscribe) —one on the right and one on the left.
50:18: Not a word does he (or she) utter except that there is an observant (watcher) ready (to record) .
50:19: And the (intoxicating) stupor of death will come with truth (upon the heedless, arrogant denier) . (And it will be said) : ‘That is (the reality) you have been (trying to) avoid!’
50:20: And the Horn will be blown (for the second time, for the resurrection of bodies) . That is the Day for which warning (had been given) .
50:21: And every person will come with an (angel) driving him (to the gathering plain) and (another angel, or his actions) as a witness (over him) .
50:22: (It will be said to the disbeliever) : You remained heedless of this (inevitable reality) , so we have removed your cover from you and your sight, this day, is indeed sharp, (in fear of what is to come) .
