50:23: And his companion (angel) will say: “This (record of his deeds) is what I have with me, prepared.”
50:24: (The command will be given to two angels) : “Throw into Hell every stubborn (ungrateful) disbeliever...”
50:25: “... Preventer of the goodness (of faith and of obligatory charity) , transgressor and doubter (in monotheism, messengership and resurrection) ...”
50:26: “... Who set up another deity (as an equal) to Allāh. So throw him (O you two angels) into the severe punishment (of Hellfire) .”
50:27: His (devil) companion will say: “O my Lord, I did not mislead him (into disbelief, oppression and sin) , but he himself had already (chosen to be) far astray (from the truth) .”
50:28: Allāh will say: “Do not dispute with each other in My presence, for I had already advanced the threat to you (by way of My messengers) .”
50:29: “ (And as such) , the sentence (of justice) that comes from Me cannot be changed, and never would I be unjust to the servants.”
50:30: The Day on which We will say to Hell: “Have you been filled?” and it will say: “Are there more (to come) ?”
50:31: And Paradise will be brought near to the Pious— (while they look on) —without being far (from them) .
50:32: (It will be announced) : “This (is the reward) you were promised— (it is granted) to every oft-repenting, preserver (of Allāh’s covenant) .”
50:33: “Who, (when alone) , feared the Most-Merciful unseen— (in this worldly life before the hereafter) — and came with a heart turned to Him (in penitence and obedience) .”
50:34: “Enter therein with peace (and safety from death, ailments and cessation of reward) . This is the Day of eternal life (in bliss) .”
50:35: They will have whatever they wish therein (of delights and pleasures) , and with Us is more reward— (a glance at the Face of Allāh, the Mighty and Majestic) .
50:36: And how many a generation before them did We destroy who were more severe in (fighting) power than them. They traversed the lands (in conquest and settlement) . (But) was there any place of refuge (when the punishment of Allāh came) ?
50:37: Verily, in that is certainly a reminder for the one who has a heart (that comprehends) or who listens (attentively) while he is a witness (fully present in heart and mind) (and reflects over the fate of those nations) .
50:38: And We did indeed create the Heavens and the Earth and whatever is between them in six days, yet no fatigue touched Us (at all) .
50:39: So bear patiently (O Muḥammad) over what they say of (rejection, lies and fabrications) , and glorify (Allāh) with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting— (the dawn, noon and afternoon prayers) .
50:40: And for a part of the night— (in the sunset and night prayers) —glorify (Him) with His praise, and (likewise) after the (completion) of (the prescribed prayers wherein is) prostration.
50:41: And listen (in wait) on the Day when the (angel) caller will call from a near place (to signal the arrival of the Final Hour) .
50:42: The Day they will hear the blowing (of the Horn) in truth. That is the Day of Emergence (from the graves to the place of accounting) .
50:43: Verily, it is We who give life (to the dead) and cause (the living) to die, and to Us is the final destination.
50:44: On the Day the earth will split open for them— (the dead) —to rush forth— (in reponse to the angel caller) . That is a gathering easy for us (to make) .
50:45: We are most knowledgeable of what they say, and you are not a tyrant over them (to force them upon guidance) . But (simply) remind with the Qurʾān the one who fears My threat.
51:1: By (the phenomenon of) the winds that scatter dust (and other debris) .
51:2: And those (winds, clouds or women) that bear heavy weight (of clouds, water or late pregnancy) .
51:3: And those (ships) that sail with ease (over the seas) .
51:4: And those (angels) who distribute each matter (from Allāh's decree regarding blessings and provision) .
51:5: Verily— (by the signs within these phenomena) —what you have been promised (of resurrection, judgement and recompense) is indeed true.
51:6: And indeed, the Judgement and Recompense is most certainly going to occur.
51:7: By the (phenomena of the) heaven possessing (wave-like) pathways (or beauty and adornment) .
51:8: Indeed, you are in differing speech (regarding the Prophet and this Qurʾān) .
51:9: Misguided away from it (the Qurʾān) are those who have been misguided (by such speech) .
51:10: (So) cursed be the premeditated liars (who spread doubts and lies regarding Allāh and His signs) .
51:11: Who are immersed in a flood of heedlessness (and ignorance) .
51:12: They ask (out of mockery) : “When is the Day of Recompense?”
51:13: It is the Day that they will be tormented over the Fire (for their denial) .
51:14: (It will be said) : “Taste the torment (of your denial) . This is what you would (mockingly) request (from the believers) to be hastened.”
51:15: Indeed, the pious will be in (the midst of) gardens and springs.
51:16: Having (previously) received what their Lord gave them (of commands) , (and now, this reward) with acceptance. Indeed, even before that— (prior to receiving His commands) —they were already doers of good.
51:17: They— (the few pious ones) —would sleep not in comfort during the night except little.
51:18: And in the hours before dawn, they would be seeking (Allāh’s) forgiveness.
51:19: And in their material possessions there was a (designated) right for the needy petitioner and the deprived (of basic needs) .
51:20: And on the Earth are (evident) signs for those having certainty (in Allāh’s unique right to worship) .
51:21: And in (the creation, growth and bodily functions of) your own selves, will you not see?
51:22: And in the heaven is (the water that brings you) your provision and whatever you are promised (of the decrees of Allāh,the occurrence of the Hour and the recompense) .
51:23: Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, it is indeed truth, just as it is (truth) that you (are able to) speak.
51:24: Has there come to you the story of the honoured (angel) guests of Abraham?
51:25: When they entered upon him and said: “ (Greetings of) peace.” He replied: “Peace (be upon you) , (you are) a people unknown (to me) .”
51:26: Then he turned (and intimated) to his family (to honour the guests) , and (thereafter) came with a fat (roasted) calf.
51:27: Then he placed it near them and said: “Will you not eat?”
51:28: Then he felt a sense of fear of them (when they ate not) . They said: “Do not fear.” And they gave him good tidings of a learned boy (Isaac) .
51:29: Then his wife came forward with a loud voice and struck her face and said: “A barren old woman (giving birth) !”
51:30: They said: “Thus has said your Lord, indeed He is the All-Wise (in what He does) , the All-Knowing (of the beneficial interests of His servants) .”
51:31: He (Abraham) said: “Then what is your purpose (for coming here) O messengers?”
51:32: They said: “We have been sent to a criminal people (who associate partners with Allāh, have rejected their messenger and commit filthy acts) .”
51:33: To send down upon them (a punishment of) stones of clay.
51:34: Marked by your Lord for the transgressors.
51:35: And We brought out whoever was in them— (the cities of sin and transgression) —of the Believers.
51:36: And We found not therein other than a (single) household of Muslims.
51:37: And We left therein a sign (of admonition) for those who fear the painful punishment.
51:38: And (likewise) in Moses (there is a sign) , when We sent him to Pharoah with clear authority (in the form of definitive proof and dazzling evidence) .
51:39: But he turned away (in denial) with his column of supporters and said: “ (This is but) a magician, a madman.”
51:40: So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea while he was blameworthy (in his stubborn disbelief, transgression and sin) .
51:41: And in (the people of) ʿĀd (there is a sign) , when we sent against them a (destroying) , barren wind (bereft of goodness) .
51:42: It spared nothing of what it came upon but made it like decayed ruins (of vegetation, trees, and bones) .
51:43: And in (the People of) Thamūd (there is a sign) , when they were told: “Enjoy yourselves for a while— (the passing of mere days) .”
51:44: But they insolently disobeyed the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them (in death) as they looked on (having waited in denial for three days) .
51:45: And they were unable to rise up (after being struck) and nor were they able to defend themselves— (having been made powerless) .
51:46: And the People of Nūḥ aforetime (were also destroyed) . Indeed, they were a defiantly sinful people.
51:47: And the heaven, We constructed it— (as a vast, raised, protective ceiling) —with strength and indeed, We are of vast resources (in creating and expanding provision therein) .
51:48: And the Earth We have spread out (for settlement and repose) , and how excellent a Spreader (thereof) We are.
51:49: And of everything We created (contrasting and complimentary) pairs that you may remember (the uniqueness of Allāh) and take admonition (therefrom) .
51:50: So flee (from disobedience, ingratitude and punishment) to Allāh— (and what is with Him of mercy and reward) . Verily, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51:51: And do not set up another deity alongside Allāh. Verily, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
51:52: Likewise (O Muḥammad) , no messenger came to those before them— (the Pagans of Mecca) —except that they said: “ (He is) a magician or a madman”.
51:53: Did they (the previous nations) convey this (statement of disbelief) to them (and encourage them upon it) ? Rather, they (the Pagans of Mecca) are a transgressing people (in their own right) .
51:54: So turn away from them (O Muḥammad) , for you are not to be blamed— (as you have conveyed the message to them) .
51:55: And remind (with this Qurʾān) , for verily, the reminder benefits the believers.
51:56: And I did not create the Jinn and Men except to worship Me.
51:57: I desire not from them any provision, and nor do I desire that they feed Me.
51:58: (On the contrary) , it is Allāh who is the Great Provider, the possessor of mighty strength.
51:59: And verily, those (of the Pagans of Mecca) who have oppressed have a portion (of torment) like the portion of their predecessors (from the disbelieving nations) . So let them not ask Me to hasten (the torment upon them) .
51:60: So woe to those who have disbelieved from (that) day of theirs which they have been promised (for their punishment) .
52:1: By the (Mount of) Ṭūr (upon which Allāh spoke to Moses from above) .
52:2: And by a Book inscribed— (this Qurʾān) .
52:4: And by the oft-frequented House (in the seventh heaven in which the angels worship continuously, or the Kaʿbah in Mecca) .
52:5: And by the ceiling (of the heaven) raised high.
52:6: And by the sea that is contained (by land) (and which will be kindled ablaze on the Day of Judgement) .
52:7: (By all these phenomena) , indeed, the punishment of your Lord (upon the disbelieving ingrates) will surely befall.
52:8: There is none to prevent it.
52:9: On the Day that the heaven will (sway and) shake with a severe shaking.
52:10: And the mountains will pass by with a swift passing (disappearing as dust) .
52:11: Then woe, that Day, (of justified punishment and ruin) to the deniers.
52:12: Who, in their vain disputation (against the truth and its people) , are playing around, amusing themselves.
52:13: On the Day they will be thrust towards the Fire of Hell with a forceful thrust.
52:14: (It will be said to them) : This is the Fire which you used to deny.
52:15: Is this (Hellfire) merely magic then (just as you considered the Qurʾān and its message to be magic) ? Or is it that you (would arrogantly) not see (during your worldly life) ?
52:16: Enter and taste (the fire) (which envelopes from every direction) . Then, whether you are patient or impatient, it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed for what you used to do.
52:17: Verily— (in total contrast to the deniers) —the pious will be in gardens and bliss.
52:18: Enjoying (with great delight) what their Lord has given them, alongside (their knowledge) that their Lord saved them from the punishment of the Hellfire.
52:19: (They will be told) : “Eat and drink with joy because of what you used to do.”
52:20: They will recline (with great ease and comfort) on thrones arranged next to each other. And we shall marry them to fair (beautiful) women with (lovely) large eyes.
52:21: And those who believe and whose offspring follow them in faith, We will join their offspring with them, and We will not decrease the (reward) for their deeds in anything. Every person is held in pledge (only) for that which he (or she) has earned.
52:22: And we will provide them fruit and meat of whatever (kind) they desire.
52:23: They will pass around to each other a cup (of non-intoxicating wine) , there being no false, evil speech arising therefrom, and nor any commission of sin (thereby) .
52:24: And circulating around them will be young servants of theirs (to serve them) — (having such radiance) as if they were protected pearls.
52:25: And some of them will turn to others, questioning each other (about the toils and hardships of the world) .
52:26: They will say: “Indeed, we were previously among our families, fearful (of sins and of Allāh’s punishment) .”
52:27: Then Allāh conferred favour upon us— (by guiding us) —and saved us from the punishment of the scorching fire.
52:28: Indeed we used to invoke him before (in sincere worship, seeking deliverance from punishment) . Indeed it is He who is the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.
52:29: So remind (O Muḥammad, in order to establish Allāh’s proof upon humanity) for you are not—by the favour of your Lord—a soothsayer (who receives information from the jinn) , nor a madman (who is devoid of intellect) .
52:30: Or do they say: “He is a poet, for whom we await the calamities of life (so that he dies young, as did his father, so that we are done away with him for good) .”
52:31: Say (to them) : “Wait (for my death) , for indeed, I am (also) with you among the waiters (until Allāh’s command arrives regarding you) .”
52:32: Or do their intellects command them with this— (to lie upon you) —or are they (simply) a transgressing people (refusing to see truth from falsehood) ?
52:33: Or do they say: “He (Muḥammad) has forged it (this Qurʾān) ”? Rather, (it is out of arrogance that) they do not believe (and not due to any proof they have) .
52:34: Then let them produce a speech like it, if they are truthful (about Muḥammad forging revelation) .
52:35: Or were they created by nothing, (and without purpose) , or were they the creators (of themselves) ?
52:36: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain (in their knowledge regarding creation, resurrection and recompense) .
52:37: Or are the treasures of your Lord— (of revelation, rain and provision) —with them (such that they apportion them) , or are they tyrants (who assume the authority to do as they like) ?
52:38: Or do they have a stairway (to ascend the sky) by means of which they listen (and acquire knowledge of revelation and the unseen) ? Then let their listener come with a manifest proof (that what they are upon is the truth) .
52:39: Or does He (Allāh) have daughters (which you falsely ascribe to Him and which you view with shame and bury alive if born to you) while you have sons?
52:40: Or do you (O Muḥammad) , ask them for a payment (for delivering your message) such that they are burdened with debt (and thus unable to receive your message with acceptance) ?
52:41: Or do they have (access to) the knowledge of the unseen (that you, O Muḥammad will die before them, or of events unknown to you) , such that they write it down (and use it to reject you and your message) ?
52:42: Or do they intend a plan (against you O Muḥammad, by reviling you and questioning your integrity) . But those who disbelieve, they themselves are the object of a plan (in which Allāh will aid His Messenger and his followers against them and obliterate their idolatrous religion) .
52:43: Or do they have a deity (that is worthy of being invoked and worshipped) besides Allāh? Sublime and Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him (of partners, equals and rivals in worship) .
52:44: And if they were to see (our punishment in the form of) a fragment from the sky falling (upon them) they would say (in denial and arrogance) : “ (This is nothing but) clouds, gathered on top of each other”, (and continue upon their disbelief) .
52:45: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will faint (with horror) (from seeing the justice that will be meted out to them) .
52:46: The Day when their plotting (against the Prophet and his cause) will not avail them at all, and nor will they be helped (in averting punishment from themselves) .
52:47: And indeed for those who have done wrong (by their disbelief and ingratitude) there is another punishment (in this life and in the grave) before that (of the hereafter) , but most of them do not know.
52:48: And wait patiently (O Muḥammad) for the decisive judgement of your Lord, for indeed, you are (being watched and guarded) under Our Eyes, and glorify with the praises of your Lord when you arise (from sleep) .
52:49: And during (a part of the) night glorify His praises also, and at the setting of the stars (when dawn arrives) .
53:1: By the (phenomenon) of the star when it descends (and vanishes with the appearance of dawn) .
53:2: Your companion— (O Pagans of Quraysh) —has not erred (in the knowledge he has been given) nor has he erred (in his sincerity of purpose) .
53:3: Nor does he speak out of the desire (of his own soul) (and forge revelation thereby) .
53:4: It is nothing but revelation revealed to him (containing guidance, rectitude and piety which he follows) .
53:5: Taught to him by one intense in power, (the Angel Gabriel) .
53:6: Possessor of beauty and soundness (in body and mind) (who then) ascended (to his place) .
53:7: While he (Gabriel) was in the highest part of the horizon.
53:8: Then he (Gabriel) approached and came closer (to the Prophet) .
53:9: And he was at a distance of two bow lengths or nearer (to him) .
53:10: Then He (Allāh) revealed to His servant what He revealed (of the Qurʾān and its legislation) (through Gabriel) .
53:11: The heart (of the Prophet) lied not about what it saw (of the signs of Allāh, and Gabriel on the Night of Ascent) .
53:12: So will you then dispute with him over what he saw (and reject him) ?
53:13: And he certainly saw him (Gabriel) on another descent.
53:14: Near the Lote Tree of the utmost boundary (of the seventh heaven) .
53:15: Near it is the Garden of retreat (in which lies the habitations of martyrs) .
53:16: When there covered the Lote Tree that which covered it (of a floor of gold) .
53:17: The sight (of the Prophet) did not swerve (to the right or left) , nor did it transgress (beyond what it had been commanded to see) .
53:18: He certainly saw (on that night) of the greatest signs of his Lord (such as Jibrīl in his original form) .
53:19: So have you considered (the feminized deities) of al-Lāt and al-ʿUzzā.
53:20: And al-Manāt, the other third one (which the Pagans worship as ‘daughters’ of Allāh) ?
53:21: Is the male (offspring) for you whilst He has the female (assigned to Him) ?
53:22: That, then, is an (errant) unjust division.
53:23: They are nothing but mere names which you have assigned to them —you and your forefathers—for which Allāh sent down no authority. They follow but presumption and what their souls desire, though there has certainly come to them guidance from their Lord.
53:24: Or shall (the disbelieving) man have whatever he wishes (of the alleged intercession of his false deities) ?
53:25: Then to Allāh belongs (all authority in) the Hereafter and (here, in) the first (life) .
53:26: And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail (anyone in) anything, except after Allāh has granted permission (for it to be made) for whom He wills and is pleased with.
53:27: Verily, those who do not believe in the Hereafter (as it should be believed in or are doubtful regarding it) name the Angels with female names.
53:28: But they have no (firm) knowledge of this — (of the affair regarding the hereafter, or the naming of the angels) . They follow but presumption. And verily, presumption does not avail anything against the truth.
53:29: Therefore, turn away (O Muḥammad) from the one who turns his back on our Reminder — (this Qurʾān) —and desires not except the worldly life.
53:30: That is their extent of knowledge, (to claim their deities are daughters of Allāh and to pursue the world while ignoring the hereafter) . Verily, your Lord is most knowledgeable of who strays from His path and He is most knowledgeable of who follows right guidance.
53:31: To Allāh belongs whatever is in the Heavens and whatever is in the Earth— (an ownership wherewith He guides whom He wills and misguides whom He wills) —in order that He may recompense those who do evil with what they have done and reward those who do good with the best reward (which is Paradise) .
53:32: (They are) those who avoid major sins and immoral deeds, save the lesser sins (those which are done rarely and not persisted upon) . Indeed, your Lord is of vast forgiveness (for the one who errs and then repents) . He was most knowledgeable of you when He produced you (in the form of Ādam) from the (materials of the) earth and when you were fetuses in your mothers’ wombs. So do not praise and ascribe purity to yourselves, for He is most knowledgeable of the one who is fearfully dutiful (to Him) .
53:33: Have you observed— (the case of al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah) — who (accepted Islām and then) turned away (from it) ?
53:34: And gave a little (of his wealth to his Pagan companion who promised to bear his burden of punishment) and then stopped.
53:35: Does he possess the knowledge of the unseen (that his companion will save him from the punishment of Allāh for his idolatry and polytheism) such that he sees (the affairs of the hereafter) ?
53:36: Or has he not been informed of what was in the Scrolls of Moses?
53:37: And (in the Scrolls of) Abraham who fulfilled (all of what He was commanded and dutifully conveyed the messages of his Lord) ?
53:38: That no bearer will bear the burden (of the crime and sin) of another.
53:39: And that there shall not be for man except what he strives for (with his own deeds, good or bad) .
53:40: And that his striving will soon be seen (on the scales of his deeds on the Day of Judgement) .
53:41: Then he will be recompensed with the fullest and most complete of recompense.
53:42: And that to your Lord is the return (of all beings and affairs) (and of all perfections in attributes) .
53:43: And that it is He who causes (His servants) to laugh and to weep (through His decrees) .
53:44: And that it is He (alone) who causes death and gives life (through His decreed ways and means) .
53:45: And that it is He who created the (complimentary) pair (of two spouses) , the male and the female.
53:46: From a drop of sperm (that is programmed to initiate pregnancy) when it is emitted.
53:47: And that upon Him is to bring forth the next creation (just as He initiated the first creation) .
53:48: And that it is He (alone) who enriches (His servants) and suffices (them) .
53:49: And that it is He (alone) who is the Lord of Sirius.
53:50: And that it is He who destroyed the first (people of the nation of) ʿĀd.
53:51: And the Thamūd (He destroyed them as well) , and He spared none of them.
53:52: And the people of Noah (He destroyed) aforetime. Indeed, it was they who were the most oppressive and transgressing.
53:53: And the overturned cities (of Sodom) He hurled down (and destroyed) .
53:54: And then covered them with what He covered them (of brimstone and fire) .
53:55: Then— (after all the above) —which of the favours of your Lord do you do doubt and dispute?
53:56: This (Prophet, Muḥammad) is a warner from the (series of) warners of old.
53:57: The approaching Day (of Resurrection and Judgment) has drawn near.
53:58: Besides Allāh, (this Day) has none that can avert or delay it (or reveal and manifest it) .
53:59: Then do you wonder at this statement, (the Qurʾān, the best and noblest of speech) ?
53:60: Yet you laught at it (mockingly) and do not weep (on account of its threats and admonitions) .
53:61: While you heedlessly engross yourself (in pastimes and pleasures) .
53:62: So prostrate to Allāh and worship (Him alone) .
54:1: The (Last) Hour (in which the heavens and earth will perish) has drawn near (while they continue to mock and reject) and the moon has been split (as a sign for them) .
54:2: And (even) if they see a sign (as great as the splitting of the moon) , they turn away and say (with arrogant transgression) : “This is fleeting magic (whose effect will soon expire) (or: This is powerful magic superceding all other magic) .”
54:3: And they belied (the Prophet and what they saw with their own eyes) and followed their (futile) desires (which Satan beautified for them) , yet every matter has its established purpose and outcome (or: every matter decreed leads to good for those who do good and evil for those who do evil) .
54:4: And there has already come to them of news (regarding past disbelieving nations in this Qurʾān) wherein there is (sufficient warning) to prohibit them (from their disbelief and associationism) .
54:5: (The conveyance of this news is) far-reaching wisdom (from Allāh, to guide some and establish His proof against others) —but warning (or: warners) avails them not (since their hearts have been sealed due to their rejection of His Signs) .
54:6: So turn away from them (O Muḥammad) (for they have waiting for them) a Day (when) the Caller calls them to a terrifying thing (of resurrection, accountability and recompense) .
54:7: With eyes humbled (by the terror that has penetrated their hearts) they will come out of the graves as if they were locusts spread (far and wide) .
54:8: (And) hasten towards the Caller (who directs them to the gathering plain) . The Disbelievers (whose punishment has drawn close) will say: “This is a difficult day.”
54:9: Before them (the Pagans of Mecca) did the people of Nūḥ deny (the truth) . So they denied Our servant (again and again) and said: “A madman”, and he was repelled (with threats and abuse) .
54:10: So he invoked his Lord (saying) : “I have been overcome (by their insolent rebellion) , so aid (me) .”
54:11: So We opened the gates of heaven with water gushing forth (continually in abundance) .
54:12: And We caused the earth to gush forth with springs, and the water (of the heaven and the earth) met for a matter already determined (in the Book of Decrees of justice against the oppressors) .
54:13: And We carried him on a (ship) made of planks and nails (or: prows that cut through the water) .
54:14: Sailing under our watchful guard as reward for he (Nūḥ, of tremendous patience) who had been rejected.
54:15: And We have left it (the drowning) (or: the ship) as a sign, so is there any that will remember (and take admonition therefrom) ?
54:16: So (do you not observe) how (severe) was My punishment and My warning (for those who disbelieve in My Messengers) .
54:17: And We have certainly made the Qurʾān easy for (memorisation, comprehension and) remembrance, so is there any who will remember (and take admonition therefrom) ?
54:18: (The People of) ʿĀd denied (their Prophet, Hūd) and how (severe) was My punishment and My warning (for those who disbelieve in My Messengers).
54:19: Indeed, We sent upon them a furious screeching wind on a day of continuous (bitter) calamity (lasting seven nights and eight days) .
54:20: Plucking out men (from the ground, separating their heads from their bodies, and thrusting them into the air) as if they were uprooted trunks of palm trees (separated from their branches and tossed down) .
54:21: So how (severe) was My punishment and My warning (for those who disbelieve in My Messengers).
54:22: And We have certainly made the Qurʾān easy for (memorisation, comprehension and) remembrance, so is there any who will remember (and take admonition therefrom) ?
54:23: Thamūd denied the warning (brought to them by their Prophet, Ṣāliḥ) .
54:24: So they said: “A man among us, alone, that we should follow (while we are great in number) ? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness (or: hardship and punishment through what he calls us to of obedience to him) .”
54:25: “Has the Reminder been sent to him (Ṣāliḥ) from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar (who merely seeks authority over us with his lie of prophethood) .”
54:26: They will know tomorrow (when the Hour is established upon them by their destruction) who is the insolent liar.
54:27: Indeed, We are sending the (great favour of the) she-camel as a trial for them, so observe them (and how they treat it) and be patient (in calling them to rectification) .
54:28: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (the she-camel and) them, each one’s (right of) drink to be attended (by turn of each day, without transgression of this right) .
54:29: But they called their companion (the most wretched of their tribe) , and (following their wish) he killed (the she-camel with his sword) .
54:30: So how (severe) was My punishment and My warning (for those who disbelieve in My Messengers) .
54:31: Indeed, We sent upon them (by way of Jibrīl) one blast (from the sky) and their (bodies) became like the dried stalks (used for animal pens) .
54:32: And We have certainly made the Qurʾān easy for (memorisation, comprehension and) remembrance, so is there any who will remember (and take admonition therefrom) ?
54:33: The people of Lot denied the warning (he gave them regarding their polytheism and lust for men) .
54:34: Indeed, We sent upon them a violent torrent of stones (to destroy them all) , except the family of Lot. We saved them before dawn.
54:35: As a favour from Us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
54:36: And he had already warned them of Our powerful grasp, but they doubted the warning.
54:37: And they had (come to his home and) sought from him his guests (to commit sodomy with them) . So we blinded their eyes (when they broke into his home) , “So taste (now) my punishment and warning.”
54:38: And there came upon by morning an abiding (or: deserving) punishment (which will deliver them to eternal punishment in the hereafter) .
54:39: So taste (now) My punishment and warning.
54:40: And We have certainly made the Qurʾān easy for (memorisation, comprehension and) remembrance, so is there any who will remember (and take admonition therefrom) ?
54:41: And there had certainly come to the people of Firʿawn (through Moses and Aaron) warning(s) (by way of numerous signs) .
54:42: They denied Our signs, all of them (of which they were inwardly convinced) . So we seized them (in vengeful punishment for their disbelief and oppression) with a seizing of one Mighty (in punishment) , Powerfully Able (to do what He wishes, with none to prevent Him) .
54:43: Are your disbelievers (O Pagan Arabs) better than those (of former destroyed nations) ? Or do you have (from Allāh) immunity (from punishment) (granted to you) in previous scriptures.
54:44: Or do they say: “We (of Mecca) are a (large) gathering (standing united against our opponent) , (and we will be) victorious (through our mutual aid of each other) .
54:45: The (large) gathering (of theirs) will be defeated (at Badr, and elsewhere) and they will turn on their backs (in flight from battle) .
54:46: Rather, the Hour is their appointed time, and the (punishment following the) Hour is more disastrous and more bitter (than their defeat at Badr) .
54:47: Verily, the Criminals (who dispute about Qadar) are in error (in this life) and (will burn in a kindled, roaring) Fire (in the next) .
54:48: The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces (it being said) , “Taste the touch of Saqar (Hell) .”
54:49: Verily, all things. We created (them) with Qadar (their prior determination and ordainment inscribed in the Preserved Tablet) .
54:50: And (the execution of) Our command is but one (word, “Be” and it is) , like (the swiftness and ease of) a glance with the eye (or: wink of an eye) (which once in motion, can never be undone) .
54:51: And We have already destroyed your likes (among prior nations who did as you have done) , so is there any that will receive admonition (knowing that the way of Allāh with all such people is one) ?
54:52: And everything they (of previous nations) have done is in written records (of the Angels, and in the Preserved Tablet) .
54:53: And every small and great thing (of their deeds) is written (in the Preserved Tablet) (prior to its occurrence) .
54:54: Indeed, the pious (who feared and obeyed Allāh) will be in gardens (of bliss) and rivers (of wine, honey and milk) (or: perpetual daytime, absent any night) .
54:55: (Sitting, on account of their truthfulness) in a seat of truth (devoid of frivolity and sin) , near a King, Powerfully Able (over all things) .
55:2: (Through His mercy He) Taught the Qurʾān (to His Prophet, making it easy for you to recite and remember) .
55:3: He created man (Ādam and his offspring) (with the best of statures) .
55:4: He taught him speech (to express meanings, thoughts and feelings) .
55:5: The sun and moon are (ordained by Him to be in continuous motion) with precise determination (of their circular orbits) .
55:6: The stars (or: stalkless plants) and the trees both prostrate (in submission to Allāh) (so worship them not) .
55:7: And the Heaven He raised it (high over the Earth) and imposed the measure of justice (upon His creatures) (with which their deeds will be weighed in the hereafter) .
55:8: So that you transgress not in giving due measure (among yourselves) .
55:9: And establish the weight (of all things) with justice and do not fall short in giving due measure (and thereby commit oppression) .
55:10: And the Earth He laid out for all the creatures (so they may take it as a repose) .
55:11: Therein are fruits (with all kinds of colours, tastes and fragrances) and date-palms with fruit-stalks (enclosing dates) .
55:12: And grains (wheat, barley, corn, rice and others) having leaves and stalks (to nourish them) , and vegetation (of various types) (or: sweet-scented plants) .
55:13: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:14: He created man (Ādam) from clay like (that of) pottery.
55:15: And He created Jinn (Iblīs) from a smokeless flame of fire
55:16: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:17: (He is) the Lord of the two easts (places of sunrise at the two solstices) and the Lord of the two wests (places of sunset at the two solstices) .
55:18: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:19: He released the two seas (of the heaven and the earth) (or: of freshwater and saltwater) to meet (with each other) .
55:20: Between them is a barrier (so that) neither of them transgress (the limit set by Allāh) .
55:21: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:22: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:23: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:24: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:25: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:26: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:27: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:28: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:29: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:30: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:31: (After leaving you to do as you wish) We will attend to you, O classes (of Jinn and Men) (and recompense you with justice) .
55:32: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:33: O company of Jinn and Mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the boundary regions of the heavens and the earth (to flee on the Day of Judgement) (or to escape death in this life) , then pass (if you can) ! You will never pass (them) except with power, authority (from Allāh) .
55:34: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:35: There will be sent upon you both— (jinn and men) —smokeless flames of fire and molten brass (or: smoke) (to prevent you from fleeing on that day) .
55:36: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:37: And when the heaven splits open, (melts) and becomes (yellow, then) rose-coloured.
55:38: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:39: So on that Day there will not be asked about his sin, (neither) man nor jinn.
55:40: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:41: The criminals willl be known by their marks (of disbelief, sin and transgression that become apparent as blackened faces of humiliation and blue eyes of terror) and they will be seized by the forelocks and feet (to be cast in the Fire) .
55:42: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:43: This is the Hell whose (existence) the criminals (would) deny (and which they now see directly with their eyes, in a state of humiliation and scorn) .
55:44: They will go (back and forth) between (being punished by) it (the Fire) and (being punished with) boiling hot water (that melts flesh but spares the bone) .
55:45: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:46: But for he who fears the standing (before his) Lord (on the Day of Judgement) (and abandons sin and disobedience) are two gardens.
55:47: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:48: (These two gardens) having spreading branches (providing shade, replete with fruits of various colours) .
55:49: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:50: In them both are two springs (of sweet water) that flow.
55:51: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:52: In them both are of every fruit, two kinds (each distinct in its colour and taste) .
55:53: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:54: (They will be) reclining on couches (whose) linings are from silk brocade and the fruit of the two gardens will be hanging low (for easy reach) .
55:55: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:56: In them are women restricting their glances (to their husbands) , (whom) neither man nor jinn has had intercourse with prior to them (their husbands) .
55:57: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:58: As if they are like rubies and coral (in their beauty) .
55:59: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:60: And is the recompense for good (done in this life) except good (in the hereafter) ?
55:61: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:62: And besides these two (gardens) (for the foremost in goodness) there are two (other) gardens.
55:63: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:65: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:66: In them both are two springs (of water) gushing forth.
55:67: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:68: In them are (trees of) fruit, date-palms and pomegranates.
55:69: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:70: In them are (women) good (in their manners) and beautiful (in their appearance) .
55:71: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:72: Houris, reserved in pavilions (waiting on their husbands, restraining their glances, without any desire for other men) .
55:73: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:74: Whom no man or jinn before them (their husbands) has penetrated with intercourse.
55:75: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:76: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
55:77: So which of the blessings (and powers) of your Lord— (O jinn and men) —will you both deny?
55:78: Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honour (who deserves veneration and obedience) .
56:1: When the Inevitable Occurrence (of the Resurrection) occurs (after the blowing of the Horn) .
56:2: There will be, (upon its occurrence) , no denial (or any exception, return or reversion) .
56:3: It will lower (the criminals and tyrants who were exalted in the world into Hellfire) and raise (the pious and righteous who were lowered in the world into Paradise) .
56:4: When the earth is shaken with a violent shake.
56:5: And the mountains are crushed with a crushing (into debris) .
56:6: And become dust dispersed (that becomes nothing) .
56:7: And you become (of) three kinds (in accordance with your deeds) .
56:8: So the companions of the right (who were foremost in good deeds) (or: who are given their scrolls in their right hands) , what (will tell you who) are the companions of the right (whose affair is great) ?
56:9: And the companions of the left (who spent their lives in disobedience) (or: who are given their scrolls in their left hands) , what (will tell you who) are the companions of the left?
56:10: And those foremost (in Islām) (or: in emigration) (or: in righteousness) (or: in the daily prayers) , will be foremost (in Paradise) .
56:11: Those are the ones brought near (to Allāh) .
56:13: A multitude of those (who are foremost) will be from the first (generations of believers) (or: believers from past nations) .
56:14: And a few of those (who are foremost) will be from the later (generations of believers) (or: believers of this nation) .
56:15: (They will be) on (ornamented) thrones woven (with gold and precious stones) .
56:16: Reclining on them, facing each other.
56:17: Serving them will be young boys made immortal.
56:18: With cups, jugs and a glass from a flowing spring (of wine) .
56:19: They will not suffer any headache from it, nor will they be intoxicated.
56:20: And fruit (of abundant variety) from which they may choose.
56:21: And the meat of fowl (of any type) that they desire.
56:22: And (for wives, they will have) fair women with wide (beautiful) eyes.
56:23: Having the likenesses of protected (pure) pearls (that are untouched) .
56:24: As a reward for what they used to do.
56:25: They will not hear therein vain talk or sinful (speech) .
56:26: But only a saying (of salutation) , “Peace, peace” (or: a saying that is not vain, idle or false ) .
56:27: And the companions of the right, what (will tell you who) are the companions of the right (whose affair is great) ?
56:33: (Being) neither limited (to season) nor ending (in its supply) (or:difficult to acquire) .
56:34: And (they will be upon) couches raised high (or: accompanied by women raised high above the women of the world in their beauty) .
56:35: Indeed, We have created them— (the women of Paradise) —with a (special) creation.
56:37: Lovingly devoted (to their husbands) , of equal age.
56:38: For the companions of the right.
56:39: (Comprising) a multitude from the first (generations of believers) (or: believers from past nations) .
56:40: And a multitude from the later (generations of believers) (or: believers of this nation) .
56:41: And the companions of the left and what (will tell you who) are the companions of the left (whose affair is dire) ?
56:42: (They will be) in scorching fire and boiling (scalding) water.
56:43: And a shadow of (intensely) black smoke.
56:44: (Which is) neither cool, nor good (to see) (causing them grief, sadness and anxiety) .
56:45: Indeed, before that (in the world) , they were (preoccupied in) enjoying luxury.
56:46: And they used to persist in (committing) great sin (such as associationism, usury and murder, without repenting from it) (or: swearing a false oath that they will never be resurrected) .
56:47: And they used to say: “When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed, to be resurrected?”
56:49: Say (O Muḥammad) : “Indeed, (all of) the former and later (people) .”
56:50: “Will surely be gathered together for the appointment of a known day (for accountability and recompense) .”
56:51: Then indeed you, O astray deniers (of Allāh, His Books and His Messengers and the Resurrection) .
56:52: (You) will surely eat from trees of Zaqqūm (the vilest, most hideous and bitter of trees) .
56:53: Then (you will) fill therewith, your bellies.
56:54: And (will) drink on top of it from boiling water.
56:55: And (will) drink as the drinking of thirsty camels (who are never satiated due to disease) .
56:56: That will be their (provision of) entertainment (which they sent forth for themselves) on the Day of Recompense.
56:57: We created you (after you were nothing) , so why do you not believe (that We are also able to resurrect you after death) ?
56:58: Have you seen (and considered how We create you from the semen) that you emit?
56:59: Is it you who create (the embryo, fetus and child out of) it or are We the creators (thereof)?
56:60: We have decreed death among you (so as to replace some of you with others) , and We are not to be outdone (in Our creative power) ...
56:61: To change your likenesses and create you in (forms and appearances) that you do not know.
56:62: And indeed, you have already known the first creation (of man, after he was nothing, and his procreation thereafter) , so why do you not remember (and take heed of the resurrection after death) ?
56:63: Have you seen (and considered) what you sow (in the ground of lifeless seed) ?
56:64: Is it you who makes it (alive and) grow (into provision) or are We the grower (thereof) ?
56:65: If We willed, We could make it (dry) stubble, and you would be regretful (for your lost efforts) (or: be amazed as to how it could have been ruined) .
56:66: (Saying) : “Indeed, we are (now) ruined (or: without profit and indebted) .”
56:67: “Rather, we have been deprived (of the fruits of our efforts) .”
56:68: Have you seen (and considered) the (life-sustaining and thirst-quenching) water that you drink?
56:69: Is it you who brought it down from the clouds (as earth-reviving rain and flowing rivers) or is it We who bring it down?
56:70: If We willed, We could make it (very) salty (and unsuitable for drink and agriculture, as just recompense for your sins) , so why are you not grateful (for Allāh’s bounties) ?
56:71: Have you seen (and considered) the fire that you ignite?
56:72: Is it you who produced its tree (as fuel) , or are We the producer (thereof) ?
56:73: We made it a reminder (of Hellfire in the next world) and a utility (of comfort, giving light and warmth) for the travellers (in this world) .
56:74: So glorify (with abundant praises) the name of your Lord, the All-Mighty.
56:75: So no (the affair is not as you claim that this Qurʾān is magic, poetry, or divination) , I swear by the setting places of the stars (or: the piecemeal revelation of the Qurʾān) .
56:76: And verily, it is indeed an oath—if you could know—(that is) mighty.
56:77: That (this) is indeed a noble recital (qur’ān) (which instils nobility in its believers) .
56:78: In a Book well-guarded (wherein are all revelations) .
56:79: Which none can touch (to descend with it as revelation) except the purified (and sinless angels) .
56:80: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
56:81: Is it in this (Qurʾānic) discourse that you (disbelievers) are deniers?
56:82: And do you make your (gratitude for the) provision (which He bestows upon you) to be that you deny (His blessings and favours and ascribe them to others instead) ?
56:83: So (if you are correct in your denial) why do you not (intervene) when the (soul of a dying person) reaches the throat...
56:84: And you are, at that moment, looking on...
56:85: And We (through our soul-taking angels, and Our knowledge, sight and power) are closer to him than you, but you do not see...
56:86: Then why (do you) not, if you are not to be reckoned (and recompensed as you claim) …
56:87: … bring it back (to the body) , if you truthful (but you will not be able to do so) .
56:88: So if he (the deceased) was of those brought near (to Allāh, having been foremost in goodness) .
56:89: Then (for him is merciful) rest (from the world) and (good) provision and a garden of pleasure.
56:90: And if he was of the companions of the right (who fulfilled the obligations and shunned the prohibitions) .
56:91: Then (the angels will say to him) : “Peace (and safety) for you, (you are) from the companions of the right.”
56:92: But if he is of the deniers (of resurrection) , the astray ones (far from belief and righteousness) .
56:93: Then (for him is) the (entertaining) provision of boiling water.
56:95: Verily this (death, resurrection and the division of men in accordance with their deeds) , is indeed the true certainty.
56:96: So glorify (with praises) the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
57:1: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth (of all living and non-living things) glorifies Allāh (with His perfection and praise, in acknowledgement of His Lordship) , and He is the All-Mighty (in just recompense) , the All-Wise (in the governance of His creation) .
57:2: His is the dominion of the heavens and the earth (none escapes His decree therein) . He gives life (to the lifeless earth and the seed of plants and men) and causes death (after life) , and He is all-powerful over everything.
57:3: He is the First (before Whom there is none) , the Last (after Whom there is none) , the Most High (above Whom there is none) , the Most Near (closer than Whom there is none) , and He is all-knowing of everything.
57:4: It is He Who created the heavens and the earth and then rose over the Throne. He knows (all the particulars of) what penetrates into the earth (of rain and seeds and the bodies of the deceased) and what emerges from it (of plants and vegetation) and what descends from the heaven (of His angels, judgements, rain and provision) and what ascends to it (of angels, the supplications and deeds of men, and their souls after death) . And He is with you (in His knowledge) wherever you are, and Allāh is all-seeing of whatever you do.
57:5: His is the dominion (and the creational and legislative governance) of the heavens and the earth, and to Allāh return all the matters (of the world and the hereafter, of the deeds and their doers, for judgement) .
57:6: He causes the night to merge into the day (until they are of equal length) and the day to merge into the night (until they are of equal length) and He is all-knowing of what is (concealed) in the breasts.
57:7: (Hence,) believe in Allāh and His Messenger and spend (in His cause, upon the poor and needy) from that (wealth and property) over which He made you successive trustees (and which will be inherited after you) . So those who believe among you and spend (of their possessions) , for them will be a great reward.
57:8: And what is (the matter) with you that you do not believe in Allāh (with no reason or excuse remaining) while the Messenger (is in your presence and) calls you (with clear evidences) to believe in your Lord, and He has (already) taken your covenant (by means of the innate disposition, reason and comprehension which He bestowed upon you) , if you are (truly) believers?
57:9: It is He who sends down signs (of) clear evidence (comprising truthful reports, just laws, beneficial reminders and inimitable speech) upon His servant (Muḥammad) (as proof of his truthfulness) that He may take you out from the darknesses (of ignorance, misguidance, injustice, disbelief and idolatry) to the light (of guidance) . And verily, Allāh is most-kind, most-merciful to you (by desiring to remove you from disbelief to faith through revealed and rational evidences) .
57:10: And what is (the matter) with you that you do not spend in Allāh’s path (without any fear of poverty) while to Allāh belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth. Not equal among you are those who spent (of their wealth) before the conquest (of Mecca) and fought (when the need was greatest) . Those are greater in degree than those who spent after (the conquest) and fought. But to all, Allāh has promised the best (reward) , and Allāh is all-aware of whatever you do.
57:11: Who is it that will lend to Allāh a goodly loan (by spending in His cause, seeking only His pleasure and reward) so that He will multiply it for him ( on the Day of Judgement by 10 to 700 times) and he will have (as his repayment) a noble reward (of Paradise) ?
57:12: On the Day that you shall see the believing men and the believing women, their light (of faith and guidance, whose brightness will be according to their deeds) will proceed before them (on the bridge over Hellfire) and in their right hands (will be their scrolls of deeds) . (It will be said) : “Your glad tidings today are (of) gardens, beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein forever. That (indeed) , is what is the great success.
57:13: On the (same) Day, the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed (as they come to the bridge over Hellfire and the outward light of Islām shared by all is removed, leaving the hypocrites without light) : “Wait for us (a little) so we can take some of your light (for we were with you in the world) .” It will be said: “Go back to your rear (in the darkness from where you came) and seek light (from there) .” And a wall will be placed between them (and the believers) , its interior (on the side of the believers) contains mercy (Paradise) , but on the outside of it is torment (Hellfire) .
57:14: They (they hypocrites) will call to the believers: “Were we not with you (observing the prayers and other obligations) ?” They will say: “Yes (outwardly) , but you put yourselves into temptation (with hypocrisy, sins, desires and lusts) , and (eagerly) awaited (our destruction) (or: kept delaying your repentance) , and doubted (in tawḥīd, prophethood and resurrection) , and false, wishful thinking (of being forgiven) (or: of defeat and subjugation of the believers) deceived you until Allāh’s command (for your appointed time) came (to you) , and the arch-deceiver (Satan) deceived you concerning Allāh (by telling you that Allāh is forgiving, kind and will not punish you) .
57:15: So today (O hypocrites, who cowardly concealed their disbelief) , no ransom will be taken from you and nor from those who disbelieve (who openly proclaimed their disbelief) . Your abode is the Fire, it is most worthy of (embracing and looking after) you (and your deeds) , and wretched is the destination (of he who ended in the Fire) .
57:16: Has the time not come for those who believe, that their hearts should become (soft and) humbly submissive at Allāh’s remembrance and what has come down (in this Qurʾān) of the truth, and that they should not become like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long time passed over them (between the sending of prophets, wherein they altered their scripture, took their priests and rabbis as lords, inclined to the world and sold His signs for a miserable price) , so their hearts hardened (and became corrupt, unreceptive to admonition) , and many of them are rebellious sinners.
57:17: Know that (just as) Allāh gives life to the earth (with rain) after its death (He can revive your hearts with His guidance and revive your bodies after death) . We have made clear to you the signs (that are evidence for His power) , perhaps that you will understand (and take heed) .
57:18: Indeed, the charitable men and the charitable women (who frequently give of their wealth to the poor and needy) and lend to Allāh a goodly loan (with utmost sincerity) , it will be multiplied for them (from 10 to 700 times or more) , and they will have a noble reward (for their loan and their truthfulness) .
57:19: And those who believe in Allāh (that He alone is worthy of worship) and (in all of) His messengers, they are the truthful. And the martyrs (who die or are killed in Allāh’s cause) , for them is their reward and their light. But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs, they are the companions of the Fire.
57:20: Know that the life of this world is (but the distractions of) play, and amusement, and (outward) beautification and mutual boasting among you (about qualities and achievements) and rivalry in (amassing) wealth and offspring. (It is) like the example of rain whose (fresh, green and colourful) vegetation, amazes the tillers (at the time) . Then (afterwards) it dries and you see it turn yellow, then it becomes debris. And in the hereafter is a severe punishment (for those who prefer the world) and forgiveness from Allāh and pleasure (for those who prefer the hereafter) . And the life of this world is but the (temporary) enjoyment of delusion.
57:21: Race towards (repentance and deeds that earn you) forgiveness from your Lord and a garden (of Paradise) whose width is like the width of the heaven(s) and earth, (already) prepared for those who believe in Allāh and His Messengers. That is the bounty of Allāh, He gives it to whomever He wills, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.
57:22: No calamity befalls you in the earth, nor in yourselves (of harm, injury, illness and death) except that it is (already inscribed) in a book (of record) before We bring them (the souls and the calamities) into existence. Verily, (to create the souls and record all of their encounters) that is easy for Allāh.
57:23: (Thus, have all things been written) in order that you may not despair over what has eluded you (of worldly provision, gains and possessions) (but show patience) and nor (proudly) rejoice over what He has given you (from His bounty) (but rather, show gratitude) . And Allāh does not love every prideful boaster.
57:24: Those (prideful boasters) who are miserly (with what is in their hands of knowledge and wealth, and do not fulfil the rights upon them) and enjoin upon people (such) miserliness (then He is not in need of their charity) . And whoever turns away (from Allāh’s command) , then indeed, Allāh is the Richly Independent (without need of anyone or anything) , the Praiseworthy (for His tremendous bounty) .
57:25: Indeed, We have sent Our messengers with clear evidences and revealed with them the Scripture and the Balance (of justice) that mankind may abide by justice (between themselves in their affairs) . And We sent down iron wherein is great military strength (for shields, swords and weapons) and benefits for the people (in agriculture, craftsmanship and construction) , and so that Allāh may make evident (what is in His prior knowledge as to) who will aid Him and His messengers (while believing firmly) in the unseen (and who will not) . Verily, Allāh is Perfectly Strong (against His enemies) and All-Mighty (in meting out just retribution) .
57:26: And indeed, We sent Noah and Abraham (as messengers) and placed in their offspring prophethood and scripture, and among them is he who is guided (to the truth) but many of them are defiant sinners (who choose disbelief and misguidance) .
57:27: Then, following in their footsteps, We sent Our messengers (such as Moses, Elias, David, Solomon, Jonah and others) , and followed (them) with Jesus, son of Mary, and We gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy (founded upon love, as healing for hardened hearts) . But the monasticism (which they imposed upon themselves) , they innovated it (to imitate Jesus and flee the harm of the kings and leaders) , We did not prescribe it for them, but (they innovated it) to seek Allāh’s pleasure, yet (those who came after them) they did not observe it with its true observance (but consumed people’s wealth and sought leadership by it) . So We gave those who believed (in Jesus truthfully and followed his way) among them their reward, but many of them are defiant sinners (who altered his message and belittled his law) .
57:28: O you who believe (in Moses and Jesus) , fear Allāh and believe in His Messenger. He will give you a double portion of His mercy (for having believed in both a past messenger and prior scripture and this messenger and this Qurʾān) and He will give you a light (of guidance) by which you will walk (straight among people in this life, guiding them, and in the hereafter to Paradise) and He will forgive you (your sins) . And Allāh is Oft-Forgiving (to those who repent) , Ever-Merciful (to His believing servants) .
57:29: So that the People of the Scripture (who disbelieved out of jealousy because their expected prophet was not from their lineage) may indeed know that they have no power over anything from Allāh’s bounty (which He gives to those who believe in Muḥammad after believing in Moses and Jesus) , and that (all) bounty is in the hand of Allāh, He gives it to whomever He wills. And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.
58:1: Indeed, Allāh has heard the statement of (the woman) who disputes with you regarding her husband (who pronounced divorced upon her in a manner of pre-Islāmic ignorance) and complains to Allāh (about her situation) . And Allāh hears your (private) discussion. Verily, Allāh is all-hearing (of all voices at all times) , all-seeing (of all things at all times) .
58:2: Those among you who pronounce divorce (to separate) from their wives (by saying to their wives that they are to them “like their mothers’ backs” and therefore unlawful for them) , then they are not their mothers. None can be their mothers but those who gave birth to them. And verily, they speak (with) a repugnant statement and a falsehood. And indeed, Allāh is certainly pardoning (towards those who err upon ignorance) , and oft-forgiving (to those who repent) .
58:3: And those who pronounce (this type of divorce, “ḍhihār”) from their wives, then (wish to) go back on what they said, then the freeing a slave (is enjoined upon them as expiation) before they touch one another (in intimate relations) . That (command) is what you are admonished with (so that you refrain from such a repugnant practice) , and Allāh is all-aware of whatever you do.
58:4: And whoever does not find (the ability to free a slave) then a fast of two consecutive months (is enjoined) before they touch one another. And whoever is unable (to fast) , then the feeding of sixty poor people (is enjoined) . That, in order that you may believe (completely) in Allāh and His Messenger (and not mix deeds of faith with repugnant deeds) , and those are the limits (of law) set by Allāh. And for the disbelievers (whose disbelief leads to such repugnant ways) is a painful punishment.
58:5: Indeed, those (hypocrites among the Pagan Arabs and their allies from the Jews) who oppose (the limits of law set by) Allāh and His Messenger are abased as those (hypocrites) before them were abased (in the Battle of the Trench) . And We have sent down clear signs (of evidence) , and for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment.
58:6: On the Day that Allāh will resurrect them all (from their graves) and inform them of what they did (of evil) while they (will have) forgotten it. Allāh has enumerated it (all) , and Allāh is a witness over everything.
58:7: Have you not considered that Allāh knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth (and that nothing remains hidden from Him) ? There is no secret counsel of three except that He is their fourth, nor of five except that is their sixth, and nor less than that or greater except that He is with them (through His all-encompassing hearing, seeing and knowledge) wherever they may be. Then He will inform them (the hypocrites and their allies) of what they did on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, Allāh is all-knowing of everything.
58:8: Have you not considered those (hypocrites and their allies) who were prohibited from secret counsels, then they revert to that which they were prohibited from, and converse among themselves with sin and (plots of) aggression (against the believers) and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they (the hypocrites) come to you, they greet you (with pre-Islāmic greetings) (or: they, the Jews, greet you with words intended as a curse) by that which Allāh does not greet you (which is “salām”, the greeting of peace) and they say among themselves: “ (If Muḥammad is indeed a prophet) why does Allāh not punish us for what we say?” Sufficient for them is (the) Hell that they will burn in, and what an evil destination (it is) .
58:9: O you who believe (or: O you who hypocrites who claim to believe) (or: O you who believe in Moses) , when you hold secret counsel then do not converse with (speech that involves) sin, (and which is about) aggression and disobedience to the Messenger, but converse with righteouness and piety. And fear Allāh to Whom you will be gathered.
58:10: Secret counsels (for conspiracy) are from (the beautifications of) Satan (who directs the hypocrites and their allies) , so that those who believe are grieved (through fear of harm or bad news) , but he will not harm them at all (through his allies) , except by the permission of Allāh (to test the believers) . And upon Allāh (alone) let the believers place their reliance.
58:11: O you who believe, when you are told to make space in the gatherings (for others) , then make space, Allāh will make space for you (in your homes and provision in Paradise) . And when you are told to arise (towards goodness, the prayer, or battle) , then depart. Allāh will raise those who believe among you (for their obedience to the Messenger) and those given knowledge by degrees (over others) . And Allāh is all-aware of whatever you do.
58:12: O you who believe (who have ample means) , when you (wish to) privately consult with the Messenger, then give something in charity (to the poor and needy) before your consultation. That is better for you and purer. But (those besides them) if you do not find (the means to do so) , then indeed, Allāh is oft-forgiving, ever-merciful.
58:13: Are you afraid of spending in charity before your private consultation? If so, and you do it not, and Allāh has turned to you (with mercy and forgiveness by its abrogation) , then (at least) establish the prayer, give the zakāh and obey Allāh and His Messenger. And Allāh is all-aware of whatever you do.
58:14: Have you considered (the affair of) those (hypocrites) who make allies of a people with whom Allāh is angry. They are neither of you (the Muslims, in religion) , nor of them (the Jews, with whom they allied, not in lineage and nor religion) , and they swear to a lie (that they are believers and did not carry information to their allies, the Jews) while they know (that they are lying) .
58:15: Allāh has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was (truly) evil what they used to do (of treachery towards the believers) .
58:16: They took their (false) oaths as a screen (to protect themselves and their wealth and possessions) and hindered from Allāh’s path (through their false oaths, alliances, sedition and treachery) , so for them is a humiliating punishment.
58:17: Never will their wealth and nor their children avail them against (the punishment of) Allāh at all (in this life, nor the next) . They are the companions of the Fire, they will dwell therein forever.
58:18: On the Day that Allāh will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they will think that they are upon something (with their false oaths and that they will deceive Allāh) . Indeed, (without question or doubt) , it is they who are the liars (whose staunch hypocrisy never left their souls, even after death) .
58:19: Satan has dominated them (through his whisperings and incitements) and made them forget the remembrance of Allāh. They are the party of Satan. Indeed, (without question or doubt) , the party of Satan, they will be the (complete) losers.
58:20: Indeed, those who oppose Allāh and His Messenger (in secret, while openly feigning loyalty) , they will be among the lowliest (the most disgraced) (in this life and the next) .
58:21: Allāh has written (in His Book of decrees) : “I will surely overcome, I and My messengers.” Indeed, Allāh is Perfectly Strong (against His enemies) and All-Mighty (in meting out just retribution in this life and the next) .
58:22: You will not find a people (genuinely) believing in Allāh and the Last Day having affection for those who contend with Allāh and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their relatives. Those, He has written (true) faith in their hearts, and strengthened them with a spirit (of light and guidance) from Himself. And He will enter them into gardens beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein forever. Allāh is pleased with them and they are pleased with Him. They are the party of Allāh. Verily, (without doubt) , the party of Allāh are the successful.
59:1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth (of all living and non-living things) glorifies Allāh (with His perfection and praise, in acknowledgement of His Lordship) , and He is the All-Mighty (in just recompense) , the All-Wise (in the governance of His creation) .
59:2: It is He Who expelled those who disbelieved (and violated their covenant through treachery, Banū al-Naḍīr) from the People of the Scripture out of their homes at the first gathering (of the exile of the Jews from Arabia) . You did not think that they— (Banū al-Naḍīr) —would leave (due to their affluence, unity, weapons and power) . And they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allāh. But Allāh came upon them from where they did not expect, and He cast terror into their hearts (when the hypocrites failed them) , so they destroyed their homes with their own hands and the hands of the believers. So reflect (and take admonition) O possessers of vision.
59:3: And had it not been that Allāh had decreed exile for them (for wisdoms and benefits returning to the believers) , He would have punished them in (this) world (with killing and captivity instead) , and for them in the hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
59:4: That (which befell them) is because they (enmitously) opposed Allāh and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allāh, then indeed, Allāh is severe in punishment.
59:5: Whatever you have cut down of their palm trees or left standing on their trunks, then it was by Allāh’s permission, and (it was decreed by Allāh that some of you should do that without knowing) in order that He may disgrace the rebellious sinners.
59:6: And what Allāh restored (of property) to His Messenger from them (the Banū Naḍīr) , then you did not embark (on any expedition) for it with horses or camels, but Allāh empowers His messengers over whomever He wills, and Allāh is powerful over everything.
59:7: And what Allāh restored to His Messenger (from the wealth and possessions) of the people of the townships, then it is for Allāh (to judge with respect to its distribution) and His Messenger (to take possession of) and (distribute) for (the benefit of his) near relatives (who are prohibited from receiving charity) , and the orphans, and the poor, and the traveller (in need) so that (this wealth) does not become a monopoly between the rich among you. Whatever the Messenger gives you (from the wealth that you deserve) (or: of a command) , take it, and whatever he prohibits you from, refrain (from it) . And fear Allāh, indeed, Allāh is severe in punishment.
59:8: (And so that this wealth does not become a monopoly among the rich, there is also a share) For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and (deprived of) their possessions, (and emigrated) seeking bounty from Allāh and (His) pleasure, and aiding (the cause of) Allāh and His Messenger. Those (ones) , they are the truthful.
59:9: And (there is also a share for) those who were settled (in Madīnah) and (adopted) faith before them. They (the Anṣār) love those who emigrated to them (while fleeing persecution, leaving their homes and possessions) and do not find in their breasts any want of what (the emigrants) were given, but give them preference over themselves (by giving to them from their best possessions) , even though they (themselves) are in need. And whoever is saved from his own covetousness, then it is those who are the successful.
59:10: And (there is also a share) for those who came after them, saying: “Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith, and do not place in our hearts any resentment towards those who believe. Our Lord, indeed, You are most-compassionate, ever-merciful.”
59:11: Have you not considered those (such as ʿAbd Allāh bin Ubayy) who displayed hypocrisy, saying to their brethen who disbelieved from the People of Scripture (the Jews of Banū al-Naḍīr) : “If you are expelled (from Madīnah) , we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey anyone regarding you, ever. And if you are fought, we will surey aid you.” But Allāh testifies that they (they hypocrites) are indeed, liars.
59:12: If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And if they were to aid them (by coming to fight) , they would surely turn their backs (and flee) , and then they (Banū Naḍīr) would not be aided.
59:13: Indeed, you (believers) are (held with) more intense fear in their hearts than Allāh. That is because they (Banū Naḍīr) are a people who do not understand.
59:14: They (the Jews of Banū Naḍīr) will not fight you all together— (as an army, man to man) —except in fortified cities or from behind walls (due to their cowardliness and fear) . Their enmity between themselves (the Jewish tribes) (or: the Jews and the Hypocrites) is severe. You think they are together (because of their hatred towards you) , but their hearts are divided (in their desires and their religions) . That is because they are a people who comprehend not.
59:15: (Theirs, Banū Naḍīr, is) like the example of those before them (Banū Qaynaqāʾ who broke their covenant and the polytheists who were defeated at Badr) , they tasted the evil consequences of their own affair (when they were punished for their transgression in this world) and they will have a painful punishment (in the hereafter) .
59:16: (The example of they hypocrites and the Jews of Banū al-Naḍir whom they deceived is) like the example of Satan when he says to man: “Disbelieve.” But when he disbelieves (and arrives on the Day of Resurrection upon disbelief) , he (Satan) says: “Indeed, I am innocent of you, indeed, I fear Allāh, the Lord of the Worlds” (hoping that this will save him) .
59:17: So the (final) outcome of both (parties) is that they will be in the Fire, abiding therein forever, and that is the (just) recompense of the (oppressive) wrong-doers.
59:18: O you who believe, fear Allāh (and be righteous) . And let (each) soul look (and reflect over) what it has put forth for tomorrow (on the Day of Reckoning) , and (hasten to) fear Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is well aware of whatever you do.
59:19: And do not be like those (hypocrites, the deniers of Jesus, and the unrepentant sinners) who forgot Allāh, so He made them forget themselves. Those ones, they are the defiant sinners.
59:20: Not equal are the companions of the Fire (who forgot Allāh and His rights) and the companions of Paradise (who remembered Him with obedience and righteousness) . The companions of Paradise, they are the successful ones (who will attain what they sought, and be saved from what they feared) .
59:21: If We had sent down this Qurʾān upon a mountain (that was in the place of these people who forgot Allāh and had hard hearts, and it was capable of understanding it) , you would have seen it humbled and cracking (in pieces) out of the fear of Allāh (that the Qurʾān’s words, meanings, admonitions and eloquence bring about) . And (all of) these examples (which have preceded) , We strike them for people perhaps they will reflect.
59:22: He is Allāh, besides Whom there is no other deity (worthy of worship) , Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Most-Merciful (to His creation) , Ever-Merciful (to His believing servants) .
59:23: He is Allāh, besides Whom there is no other deity (worthy of worship) , the Sovereign King, the Perfectly Pure, the Impeccably Flawless, the Granter of Faith and Security, the Trustworthy Ever-Watchful Witness, the All-Mighty, the Compelling Subduer, the Justly Proud. Glorifed is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.
59:24: He is Allāh, the Creator, the Originator, the Fashioner (of forms) , to Him belong the (most) beautiful names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth glorify (His perfection) , and He is All-Mighty (in just recompense), All-Wise (in the governance of His creation).
60:1: O you who believe, do not take My enemies and your enemies as close allies, showing them affection (by revealing military secrets to them) , while they have disbelieved in what came to you of the truth (and showed enmity to you first) . They expel the Messenger and you (from your home) (only) because you believe in Allāh, your Lord (and worship no other gods) . If you have (truly) come out for (the purpose of) jihād in My cause, and seeking My pleasure (then do not take them as close allies) . You secretly show them affection (by divulging secrets of war) , but I am most-knowing of what you have concealed and what you have proclaimed. And whoever does it among you, then he has certainly strayed from the sound path (of right conduct) .
60:2: If they get the better of you, they would be as enemies to you and stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you with evil (by striking, killing and reviling you) , and (before everything else) they wish that you would disbelieve (just like them) .
60:3: (Should you disobey Him in order to please your relatives, then) Never will your relatives and nor your children benefit you on the Day of Resurrection, (wherein) He will judge between you (all) . And Allāh is all-seeing of whatever you do.
60:4: (As for those who divulge military secrets, then) There has indeed been an excellent example (or: lesson) for you (to take and follow) in Abraham and those with him (of prophets) , when they said to their people (who met them with disbelief, enmity and aggression) : “Verily, we are free of you and from whatever you worship besides Allāh.
