We have disbelieved in (the idols that) you (believe in, and deny that your worship of them is truth and justice) , and animosity and hatred has arisen between us forever, until you believe in Allāh alone”, except the saying of Abraham to his father (which is not to be followed) : “I shall certainly seek forgiveness for you, but I possess no power to do anything for you against Allāh (if you worship deities besides Him) .” (They said) : “Our Lord, upon You have we placed our trust, and to You have we turned (in penitence and obedience) , and to You is our return (in the hereafter, after death) .”
60:5: (They said:) “Our Lord, do not make us a trial for those who disbelieve (by giving them the upper hand, causing them to think that they are upon the truth and thereby, persist upon their disbelief) , and forgive us Our Lord. Indeed, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.”
60:6: There has certainly been an excellent example in them to follow for whoever hopes in Allāh and the Last Day. And whoever turns away (from what Allāh has commanded) , then indeed, Allāh is the Richly-Independent (being most unneedy of His creation) , the All-Praiseworthy (for His just, wise and beneficial commands) .
60:7: Perhaps Allāh will put affection between you and those among them to whom you have been enemies (by guiding them to Islām) , and Allāh is able (to turn the hearts) , and Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful (to those who heed admonition and refrain from sin) .
60:8: Allāh does not forbid you—with respect to those who do not fight you because of religion and who do not expel you from your homes—from being kind towards them and behaving justly with them. Indeed, Allāh loves those who act justly.
60:9: But it is only regarding those— (the chiefs and leaders of disbelief, and the staunch haters and opposers) —who fought you because of religion and expelled you from your homes and aided in your explusion, that Allāh forbids you from taking as allies. And whoever takes them as allies, then those, they are the oppressive wrongdoers.
60:10: O you who believe, (with respect to those with whom you made a treaty) when the believing women come to you as emigrants (from the land of disbelief) , then examine them (by making them swear that they are sincere in faith and did not leave due to hatred of their spouses, or seeking marriage or the world) . And if you know them to be believing women, then do not return them to the disbelievers. They (the believing women) are not lawful (wives) for them, and nor are they (the polytheists) , lawful (husbands) for them. But give them (the polytheists whose wives left them for faith and emigration) what they had spent (as dowry on their former wives) . And there is no blame upon you to marry them if you have given them their dowry. And do not maintain (marriage bonds with) the disbelieving women (who emigrate to the polytheists) , but ask for what you had spent on them (as dowry) , and let them (the polytheists) ask for what they spent (on the believing women that left them) . That is the judgement of Allāh by which He judges between you, and Allāh is All-Knowing (of what is best for His servants) , All-Wise (in His judgements and laws) .
60:11: And if (they, the disbelieving polytheists reject the above and do not abide by it) (or: it is in relation to those with you have no treaty and) you have lost any of your wives to the disbelievers, and you subsequently gain war-booty (through just war) , then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent (on their former wives as dowry) . And fear Allāh, in Whom you are believers.
60:12: O Prophet, (on this day of the conquest of Mecca and henceforth) when the believing women come to you pledging that they will not associate anything with Allāh (in worship) , and will not steal, and nor commit unlawful sexual intercourse, and nor kill their children (due to shame of fear of poverty) , and nor bring forth a slander that they have invented between their arms and legs (by falsely attributing a child to their husbands) , and will not disobey you in what is good (and right) , then accept their pledge, and ask forgiveness (from Allāh) for them. Verily, Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
60:13: O you who believe, take not as allies a people with whom Allāh has become angry (the Jews, by divulging secrets to them, as some of you divulged to the polytheists) . They have despaired of the hereafter (that they should have any share or reward therein) just as the disbelievers (who have died and are) from the inhabitants of the graves have despaired (of having any share or reward therein) .
61:1: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth (of all living and non-living things) glorifies Allāh (with His perfection and praise, in acknowledgement of His Lordship) , and He is the All-Mighty (in just recompense) , the All-Wise (in the governance of His creation) .
61:2: O you who believe, why do you say that which you do not do (when it is enjoined upon you) ?
61:3: It is greatly hated to Allāh that you say that which you do not do.
61:4: Indeed, Allāh loves those who fight in His cause in a row, as if they are a compact structure (firmly fixed without gaps, unified and steadfast in their intent and goal) .
61:5: And (mention, O Muḥammad, to those who say that which they do not do) when Moses said to his people: “O my people, why do you harm me (with your disobedience and opposition to me) while you certainly know that I am Allāh’s messenger to you?” So when they deviated (by disobeying the commanded of Moses to fight in Allāh’s cause against the Amalekites in the Holy Land for the establishment of tawḥīd) , Allāh caused their hearts to deviate (from being receptive to truth) , and Allāh does not guide the defiantly sinful people.
61:6: And (mention, O Muḥammad, to those who say that which they do not do) when Jesus, son of Mary, said: “O Children of Israel, I am Allāh’s messenger to you, confirming what came before me of the Torah, and giving good tidings of a messenger to come after me whose name is Aḥmad (the most praising of His Lord’s perfection and glory and the most praised by men for his virtues) .” But when he (the prophesied messenger, Muḥammad) came to them (the Israelites in and around Madīnah) with clear evidences (that he is the prophet spoken of by Jesus, that he confirms the Torah and guides them away from their errors) , they said: “This is plain magic.”
61:7: And who is more unjust than the one who fabricates a lie against Allāh (that His signs are magic, or that His prophet is a magician) while he is being invited to Islām (the religion of Abraham, Moses and Jesus, to worship only one Lord) . And Allāh does not guide the oppressive people (who knowingly do wrong) .
61:8: They desire to extinguish Allāh’s light (of truth and guidance) with their mouths (by their fabrications and lies) , but Allāh will perfect His light (through Muḥammad’s victory and then the descent of Jesus) , even though the disbelievers (of all factions) detest it.
61:9: It is He Who sent His messenger with the guidance (of the Qur’ān) and the religion of truth (comprising tawḥīd and just law) to (aid it and) make it manifest over all other religion (through proofs and evidences and the descent of Jesus) , even though the polytheists detest it.
61:10: O you who believe, shall I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?
61:11: (It is that) you believe in Allāh and His messenger and strive hard in Allāh’s cause with your wealth and your lives (to make His word and that of His messengers uppermost) . That is best for you, if you were to know.
61:12: He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and (to) pleasant dwellings in gardens of eternity. That is the great achievement (of success) .
61:13: And (you will receive) another (blessing in this life) that you love: aid from Allāh (against your enemies) and an imminent victory (through people entering Islām in droves, and the peaceful conquest of Mecca) . And give glad tidings to the believers (so that they may participate in this transaction) .
61:14: O you who believe, be helpers (in the cause) of Allāh (in this aforementioned transaction and respond) as when Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples: “Who are my helpers for (the cause of) Allāh?”, the disciples responded: “We are Allāh’s helpers (who will strive in His cause) .” So a faction of the Children of Israel believed (that he is Allāh’s servant and messenger) and a faction disbelieved (by denying that he is Allāh’s Messenger, or saying he is Allāh or is Allāh’s son) , so (with the sending of Muḥammad) We supported those who believed (in the true call of Jesus) against their enemy (who had rejected Jesus, or persecuted his true followers, or altered his religion) , and they became uppermost.
62:1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth (of all living and non-living things) glorifies Allāh (with His perfection and praise, in acknowledgement of His Lordship) , the King (who governs the affairs of His servants for their best interests) , the Perfectly Pure One (who is free of all that the polytheists associate with Him and who purifies His servants from disbelief and idolatry) , the All-Mighty (in honour and strength, who confers honour to His believing servants) , the All-Wise (who teaches wisdom to His servants) .
62:2: It is He Who (after sending prophets and messengers to the Israelites) sent among the unlettered (Arabs) a messenger from themselves, reciting to them His verses, purifying them (from the impurities of disbelief and idolatry) and teaching them the Book and the Wisdom (taught by past messengers) , though they were, before (the sending of the messenger) , in plain misguidance.
62:3: And (We sent him also) to others among them (from the people of all nations) , who have not yet (come and) joined them (the unlettered in faith) . And He is the All-Mighty (in His power) , the All-Wise (in sending an unlettered messenger) .
62:4: That— (revelation and messengership) —is the bounty of Allāh which He gives to whomever He wills (and chooses from His servants) . And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.
62:5: The example of those who were (given from Our bounty and) entrusted with the Torah (to teach and uphold it) and then did not uphold it (and taunted the unlettered Arabs that they have no Book, have no Sabbath, and that only they are Allāh’s beloved) is like that of a donkey who carries volumes (of books) . Wretched is the example of the people who deny Allāh’s signs (and support the polytheists against the believers who confirm the law of Moses) . And Allāh does not guide the oppressive people (who knowingly do wrong) .
62:6: Say: “O you who are Jews, if you claim that you are the (beloved) friends of Allāh to the exclusion of (other) people, then (genuinely) wish for death (with your tongues) (to escape the life of this world, its material possessions and its punishments for the perpetual bliss of the hereafter) , if you are (really) truthful (about being special and favoured) .”
62:7: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of (their fear of the punishment for) what (deeds) their hands have sent forth. And Allāh is All-Knowing of the oppressors (who knowingly do wrong) .
62:8: Say: “Indeed, the death from which you flee (because you hate it and never truly wish for it) , then it will certainly meet you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unseen and the seen (from Whom no deed is hidden) , and He will then inform you of what you used to do.”
62:9: O you who believe, when the call to prayer is made on the day of Jumuʿah, then proceed (with eagerness and composure) to the remembrance of Allāh and leave (your preoccupation with) trade. That is better for you if you were to know.
62:10: And when the prayer is completed, then disperse through the land and seek of Allāh’s bounty (for your provision) , and remember Allāh often (with acts of obedience) so that you may succeed.
62:11: But when they see a trade (for merchandise) or enjoyment (of sorts) , they disperse to it and leave you (while you) stand (giving the sermon) . Say: “What is with Allāh (of reward for prayer and remembrance) is better than the amusement and the trade (they rush to) , and Allāh is the best of providers.”
63:1: When the hypocrites come to you (O Muḥammad) , they say: “We testify that you are Allāh’s messenger.” And Allāh knows that you are you indeed His messenger (whether they testify to it or not) , and Allāh testifies that indeed, the hypocrites are certainly liars (who do not believe what they say) .
63:2: They have taken their oaths as a screen (for their sedition and hypocrisy, to preserve their wealth and status) , and thereby, hindered (others) from Allāh’s path. Verily, it was evil what they used to do.
63:3: That (evil of theirs) is because they (initially) believed (without faith settling in their hearts) , then they disbelieved, so their hearts were sealed (upon disbelief) , and thus, they do not understand (the reality of faith and righteousness) .
63:4: And when you see them, their bodily (appearances) please you, and if they speak, you listen to their speech (because of its sweetness and eloquence) . (They are) as if blocks of wood propped up (but which are in reality hollow and devoid of benefit) . They think every shout is against them (due to their cowardice and constant fear of exposure) . They are the enemy, so beware of (trusting) them. May Allāh curse (and destroy) them, how are they deluded (from the truth) ?
63:5: And when it is said to them: “Come (and acknowledge your sins) , Allāh’s Messenger will ask forgiveness for you”, they turn their heads aside (in aversion) and you see them turning away (from this invitation) while they are arrogant.
63:6: It is all the same upon them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them (it will avail them not) . Allāh will never forgive them (for persisting upon disbelief and hypocrisy) . Verily, Allāh does not guide the defiantly sinful people.
63:7: They are the ones who say: “Do not spend on those who are with ‘Allāh’s messenger’ until they (suffer hunger and poverty and) desert (him) .” However, the treasures of (provision in) the heavens and the earth belong to Allāh (who gives and withholds and enlarges and restricts) , yet the hypocrites do not understand.
63:8: They say: “If we return to Madīnah, the more honourable (ʿAbd Allāh bin Ubay, the chief hypocrite) will expel from it the lowly (the Messenger) .” Yet all honour belongs to Allāh, and to His Messenger, and to the believers, but the hypocrites do not know.
63:9: O you who believe, (be unlike the hypocrites and) do not let your possessions and children divert you from (establishing) Allāh’s remembrance (through the prayer and other obligations) . And whoever does that, then they are the losers.
63:10: And spend (in Allāh’s cause) from what We have provided you before death comes to one of you and he says (in severe regret, asking for the impossible) : “My Lord, if only you would delay me for a short while so I may give charity and be among the righteous.”
63:11: But Allāh will never delay a soul when its (appointed) term has come. And Allāh is Fully Aware of whatever you do.
64:1: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth (of all living and non-living things) glorifies Allāh (with His perfection and praise, in acknowledgement of His Lordship) . To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs (all) praise, and He is powerful over all things.
64:2: It is He Who created you, then, among you is the disbeliever (who denies His favour) and among you is the believer, and Allāh is All-Seeing of whatever you do.
64:3: (Does not the disbeliever see that) He created the heavens and the earth with the truth (that He alone is worthy of worship and that the doers of good and evil will receive their just recompense) , and He formed you and perfected your forms (for that purpose) , and to Him is the (final) return.
64:4: He knows (all the details of) what is in the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare. And Allāh is All-Knowing of what is (concealed) in the breasts (of men) .
64:5: (O disbelievers) Has the news not come to you of those (bygone nations) who disbelieved before? So they tasted the heavy burden of their affair (in this world) , and they will have a painful punishment (in the hereafter) .
64:6: That is because their messengers used to come to them with clear evidences, but they said: “Are men to guide us?” So they disbelieved and turned away. But Allāh dispensed (with them) and Allāh is Richly-Independent, (unneedy of their faith and works) , Praiseworthy (for His innumerable bounties upon them) .
64:7: Those who disbelieve (falsely) claim that they will never be resurrected (after death) . Say: “Yes, by my Lord, you will most surely be resurrected (just as easily as you were created) and then, you will most surely be informed of what you did. And that is easy for Allāh.”
64:8: Therefore, believe in Allāh (Your Lord) and His Messenger and the Light (of the Qurʾān) which We have sent down. And Allāh is All-Aware of whatever you do (whether you believe or not) .
64:9: (He will inform you of what you did on) The day He will gather you (all) for the Day of the Gathering, that is the Day of Mutual Loss and Gain. And whoever believes in Allāh and works righteousness, He will wipe away his sins from him (on that Day) and admit him to gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. That is the greatest success.
64:10: But those who disbelieved and denied our (recited and observed) signs, those are the companions of the Fire, abiding therein (forever) , and what an evil destination (it is) .
64:11: No affliction befalls (you, O believers) except by the permission of Allāh. And whoever believes in Allāh (and accepts that it is decreed by Him) , He will guide his heart (to submit to His command and have certainty in his belief) , and Allāh is All-Knowing of everything.
64:12: And obey Allāh and obey the Messenger, but if you turn away (to disobedience (, then it is only upon our Messenger (to make) the clear conveyance (to establish the proof) .
64:13: Allāh, there is none worthy of worship but He, so upon Allāh (alone) , let the believers rely.
64:14: O you who believe, indeed among your wives and your children are (those whose love prevents you from Allāh’s obedience, and hence, are) enemies to you, so beware of them. But if you pardon, overlook and forgive (them) (after you gain comprehension in religion) then indeed, Allāh is Oft-Forgiving (to those who forgive) , Ever-Merciful (to those who show mercy) .
64:15: Your wealth and children are only a trial, but Allāh! With Him is a great reward.
64:16: So fear Allāh as much as you are able (through obedience) and listen (to Allāh’s Word) and obey (His command) and spend (in Allāh’s cause with charity) , it is better for your selves. And whoever is saved from the covetousness of his soul (for wealth and possessions) , then it is those who are the successful.
64:17: If you lend to Allāh a goodly loan, He will multiply it for you and forgive you. And Allāh is Most-Appreciative (of those who spend in His cause) , Most-Forbearing (towards those who sin) .
64:18: Knower of the unseen and the seen, the All-Mighty (in giving just recompense) , the All-Wise. (in the governance of His creation) .
65:1: O Prophet, (say to your nation:) When you (intend to) divorce women (henceforth) , divorce them at (the commencement of) their waiting period (when they become pure from menses and you have not had a relation with them) , and keep count of the waiting period. And fear Allāh, your Lord (with respect to their rights) , and do not turn them out of their (husband’s) homes—nor should they themselves leave (during the waiting period) —unless they commit clear immorality (such as theft, fornication or displaying vile character) . And those are the limits (set by) Allāh. And whoever transgresses the limits of Allāh, then he has wronged himself. (So keep these limits as) You (the one who divorces his wife) do not know, perhaps Allāh will bring about some affair after that (by returning her back to you) .
65:2: And when they— (the divorced women) — have reached their term (of completing three cycles of purity, before their ritual bath from the third menses) , then either retain them with good manners (by excusing them for their errors, slips and shortcomings) , or part with them with good manners (without speaking ill of them) . And bring two just men among yourselves to witness (the return or the separation, to cut off doubts and future claims) and establish the testimony for Allāh. That (instruction) is taken with acceptance (and as an admonition) by he who believes in Allāh and the Last Day. And whoever fears Allāh (by keeping these commands and limits) , He will make a way out for him.
65:3: And will provide for him from where he does not (imagine or) expect. And whoever relies upon Allāh, then He will suffice him (for all of his needs) . Verily, Allāh will accomplish His purpose (regarding you) . Allāh has already made a set measure for everything.
65:4: And those who no longer expect menstruation among your women—if you doubt (about whether they no longer expect menstruation) —then their waiting period is three months. And (likewise) , those who have not menstruated, (their waiting period is three months) . And those who are pregnant (when they are divorced or their husbands die) , their waiting period is until they give birth. And whoever fears Allāh (with reverent obedience) , He will make his affair easy for him.
65:5: That is Allāh’s command, He sent it down to you, and whoever fears Allāh (by avoiding what displeases Him) , He will wipe away his sins enlarge his reward.
65:6: House them (the divorced women) in (the same place) that you dwell, according to your means, and do not harm them in order to oppress them (so that they leave) . And if they are pregnant, then spend upon them, until they give birth. And if they breastfeed (your child) for you, then give them their payment, and make counsel between yourselves regarding what is good (for the child’s feeding, according to what is customary) . But if there is discord between you (regarding this matter) , then another (woman) can breastfeed (the child) for him (the father) .
65:7: Let the man of abundant means spend from his wealth (for the child's feeding and provision) and he whose provision is restricted, let him spend from what Allāh has given him (of wealth, or the ability to earn it) . Allāh does not burden a soul except according to what He has given him. After (this) hardship, Allāh will make ease (for him) .
65:8: And how many a township showed insolence towards the command of its Lord and His messengers, so We reckoned it with a severe reckoning (by comparing its gratitude with Our favours, with no lenience therein) and punished it with a terrible punishment (in this life and the next) .
65:9: And it tasted the evil consequences of its affair (of insolent disbelief and disobedience) , and the outcome of its affair was loss (selling eternal bliss of the hereafter for the temporal, measly gains of the world) .
65:10: Allāh has prepared a severe punishment for them, so fear Allāh (by keeping His commands) O people of understanding who have believed. Allāh has sent down to you a remembrance (the Qurʾān) .
65:11: (Conveyed by) A messenger who recites to you the verses of Allāh that clearly explain (His just laws and wise commands) that He may bring out those who believe and do righteous deeds from the darknesses into the light. And whoever believes in Allāh and works righteousness, He will enter him into gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein forever. Allāh has perfected for him a provision (therein) .
65:12: It is Allāh Who has created seven heavens and of the earth, the like of them (in number) . The command (of Allāh regarding their governance) descends between them (the heavens and the earth) that you may know that Allāh is powerful over all things, and that Allāh has encompassed everything in knowledge.
66:1: O Prophet, why do you prohibit yourself (from enjoying) what Allāh made lawful for you (of good and wholesome things) , seeking the pleasure of your wives. And Allāh is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
66:2: Allāh has already ordained for you (O believers) the dissolution of your oaths (through atonement) . And Allāh is your master, and He is All-Knowing (of what is best for you) and All-Wise (in what He has legislated for you) .
66:3: And when the Prophet confided speech (regarding a matter) to one of his wives, so when she divulged it (to another, thinking there is no harm in it) and Allāh made it known to him, he informed (her) of part of it and ignored a part (out of kindness) . So when he informed her about it, she said: “Who told you this?” He said: “The All-Knowing, the All-Aware told me.”
66:4: If you two (wives) repent to Allāh (it is best) , for your hearts have swerved (from righteous conduct) . But if you cooperate against him, then indeed Allāh is his protector, and thereafter, Jibrīl and the righteous of the believers (the prophets) (or: Abū Bakr and ʿUmar) , and the angels are (his) helpers.
66:5: Perhaps, if he divorced you (all) , his Lord would replace (you) for him (with) wives better than you, (who are) Muslims (establishing the obligations) , believers, devoutly obedient, (frequent) repenters, (sincere) worshippers, fasters (or: emigrators) (or: loyal companions) , whether previously married or virgins.
66:6: O you who believe, guard yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is men and stones, over which are angels, stern (showing no mercy or compassion) and severe (in strength and punishment) . They do not disobey Allāh in what He commands them, but do what they are commanded.
66:7: (These angels will say:) “O you who disbelieved, make no excuses this day (for the time of excuses and repentance has been cut off) . You will only be (justly) recompensed for what you used to do (of evil in the world) .”
66:8: O you who believe, repent to Allāh with sincere (truthful) repentance. Perhaps your Lord will wipe away your sins and enter you into gardens beneath which rivers flow (on) the Day when Allāh will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them (on the bridge over the Fire) and on their right (in accordance with their deeds) . They will say (when the light is extinguished for the hypocrites) : “Our Lord, perfect our light and forgive us. Indeed, You are powerful over all things.”
66:9: O Prophet, strive against the disbelievers (by fighting them for their aggression and hindrance after inviting them to truth, invalidating their falsehood, and establishing the proof against them) and the hypocrites (by admonishing and exposing them) , and be stern towards them. And their refuge is Hell (if they do not repent and believe) , and (what) a wretched destination it is.
66:10: Allāh sets forth an example of (the state of) those who disbelieve, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two of our righteous servants (in the sanctity of marriage) , but betrayed them (with their disbelief) , so (the status and nearness of) those two (prophets) did not avail them from Allāh at all, and it will be said: “Enter the Fire (you two women) with those who enter.”
66:11: And Allāh sets forth an example of those who believe, the wife of Pharoah (who did not succumb to her husband’s threatening call to disbelief) , when she said: “O my Lord, build for me a house in Paradise near You, and save me from (the punishment of) Pharoah and (from falling into) his deeds (of polytheism) , and save me from the (polytheism and idolatry of the) wrongdoing people.
66:12: And (the example) of Mary, the daughter of ʿImrān, who guarded her chastity, so We (rewarded her and) blew into (her garment a life-giving spirit) through our angel (for her to miraculously conceive Jesus) and she believed in the words of her Lord (through Gabriel, regarding her son to be) and His scriptures (the Torah, Psalms and Gospel) , and she was of the devoutly obedient.
67:1: Blessed is He in whose hand is the dominion (in the world and the hereafter) , and He is powerful over all things.
67:2: Who created death (in the world) and (eternal) life (in the hereafter) , that He may test you, (as to) which of you is best in deed. And He is the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving.
67:3: Who created seven heavens (perfectly aligned) in layers (elevated above one another) . You will not see any disharmony in the creation of the Most Merciful. So return (your) vision (to the heaven above) , do you see any rifts?
67:4: Then return your vision (to the heaven above) again, and yet again (repeatedly, to find a flaw) , your sight will return to you (in a state of) humiliating disappointment, while it is worn out.
67:5: And We have indeed beautified the nearest heaven with lamp-like stars, and We have made (by means of some of) them what is thrown at the devils (to drive them away from snatching information) , and We have prepared for them a punishment of the Blazing Fire.
67:6: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord (among jinn and men) is the punishment of Hell, and (what) a wretched destination it is.
67:7: When they are thrown into it (with humiliation) , they will hear from it, (the sound of) a (terrifying) gasp (for more inhabitants) , while it boils (and its flames rage and rise) .
67:8: It almost bursts apart from (the intensity of its) rage (against them) . Every time a group is cast into it, its keepers— (Mālik and his assistants) —ask them (in rebuke of them) : “Did there not come to you a warner (to warn you about this Day) ?”
67:9: They will say (remorsefully, acknowledging Allāh’s justice) : “Yes, a warner had come to us, but we denied (him) and we said, ‘Allāh has not sent down anything (of revelation to anyone) , you are not except in great error.’”
67:10: And they will say (acknowledging that all their excuses have been removed) : “If only we had (benefited from these faculties and) been listening (to the warner) or using our intelligence (to take heed) , we would not be among the companions of the Blazing Fire.”
67:11: Thereby, they will have confessed their sin (and that they deserve their punishment) . So (just as they did away with the warners and the truth) , then done away with are the companions of the Blazing Fire (to the Fire) .
67:12: Verily, those who fear their Lord (while He and His punishment are) unseen (or: while they are unseen by men) , they will have forgiveness and a great reward.
67:13: And conceal your speech (O polytheists, in reviling the Prophet) or proclaim it (openly) , indeed, He is All-Knowing of what is (hidden) in the breasts (of men) .
67:14: Should He who created not know (or: Should He not know whom He created) , while He is the Most-Subtle (in knowing the secrets of men’s hearts) , the All-Aware (of what they contain of good and evil) ?
67:15: It is He who made the earth a subservient terrain for you (to subsist upon) , so proceed among its (vast and diverse) paths, and eat of His provision (that He causes to grow and makes lawful for you) , and to Him will be the return (after resurrection) .
67:16: Do you (who persist in oppression and disobedience) feel secure that He who is above the Heaven will not cause the (very) earth (from which comes your provision) to sink with you and then suddenly it trembles and spins (until it swallows and destroys you) ?
67:17: Or do you feel secure that He who is above the heaven will not send against you (from the very sky from which your provision descends) a fierce whirlwind of stones (as just recompense for your ingratitude) ? Then shall you know how (severe and truthful) was My warning.
67:18: And indeed, those before them— (such as the ʿĀd and Thāmūd, and Noah’s and Lot’s people) —had (also) denied (My warners) (in a like manner) , and (do they know) how terrible was My condemnation (of them) ?
67:19: Do they not see the birds above them spreading out their wings and folding them in (to optimise their flights) ? None upholds them (through such creative power) except the Most-Merciful. Indeed, He is the All-Seer of everything.
67:20: Or, who is it (O disbelievers of Quraysh) that can be an army to you to aid you (against your enemies) (or: against Allāh’s punishment) besides the Most-Merciful (Himself) ? Indeed, the disbelievers are not but in delusion (in their belief that their gods can protect them or draw them near to Allāh) (or: because of devils who deceive them in their belief that they will not be held to account and punished) .
67:21: Or who is it that can provide for you (besides the Most-Merciful) if He withheld His provision? Rather (despite knowing that their deities are unable to aid them or provide for them) , they have persisted in (displaying) arrogant insolence and fleeing (from the truth, that only one Lord is worthy of worship) .
67:22: Then is he who walks overturned on his face (having overturned truth with falsehood, blinded in vision and insight, ignorant, misguided, a servant to many lords, on a crooked path of many directions) better guided, or the one who (sees ahead and) walks upright on a straight path (of servitude to only one Lord) ?
67:23: Say: “It is He (alone, the Most-Merciful) who has originated (your creation) and endowed you with hearing (to listen to Allāh’s verses and commands) , seeing (to observe His signs) and hearts (to reflect upon what is heard and observed) . Little, do you give thanks (for these favours) .”
67:24: Say: “It is He (alone, the Most-Merciful) who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him (alone) you will be (resurrected and) gathered (for reckoning and recompense) .”
67:25: And (when unable to oppose these proofs) they say (in mockery and denial) : “When is (the occurrence of) this promise (of the Day of Resurrection, Reckoning and Recompense) , if you are being truthful?”
67:26: Say: “The knowledge (of its precise time) is only with Allāh and I am only a clear warner (to notify and warn you of its occurrence) .”
67:27: But when they see it approaching, the faces of those who disbelieved will be distressed (with grief and gloominess) , and it will be said: “This is (the occurrence of) (the promise) which you used to (mockingly) call for! (or: which you claimed would never come to pass!) ”
67:28: Say (O Muḥammad) : “Consider and tell me (after putting aside your wishes and cravings for my death) that if Allāh causes me to perish and those with me, or He shows mercy to us, then (no matter what happens to us) who will protect the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”
67:29: Say (O Muḥammad) : “He is the Most-Merciful (who promised mercy to His believing servants) , we have believed in Him, and upon Him have we relied. So soon, you will come to know (O polytheists who deny that He is the Most-Merciful and rely upon helpless idols) who it is that is upon clear error.”
67:30: Say (O Muḥammad) : “Consider and tell me that if your water was to become sunken (into the earth and be out of your reach) , then who (besides Him) could bring you flowing (drinkable) water?”
68:1: Nūn. By the (instrument of the) Pen (that writes destiny and records knowledge) , and what they (the angels) write (of men’s deeds) (or: what men write of scripture and knowledge) .
68:2: You (O Muḥammad) are not, by the grace of your Lord, a madman (as the polytheists say) .
68:3: And indeed, for you is a never-ending (immeasurable) reward (for what you impart of revelation, guidance, righteousness, morals and just law) .
68:4: And indeed, you are on a great (and deeply-rooted standard of) character.
68:5: So you will see and they will see.
68:6: (As to) which of you is afflicted (with madness) .
68:7: Indeed, your Lord knows better who (among them) has strayed from His path (of guidance and success in both the worlds) , and He knows better (who are) the rightly-guided (on His path) .
68:8: So (remain firmly on your path and) do not obey the deniers (who deny the proofs that He alone is worthy of worship and call you instead to their idolatry) .
68:9: They wish that you would compromise (your religion, by flattering them and not falsifying their idolatry) , so they (too) would compromise (with you and flatter you) .
68:10: And do not obey every lowly (contemptible) frequent swearer (of oaths) .
68:11: (And) scorner (who mocks and backbites people) , spreader of malicious gossip.
68:12: (And) preventer of good (that is should reach people) , transgressor (against others) , (habitual) sinner (who transgresses against his own soul) .
68:13: (And) cruel (in disposition, of vile manners) , moreover, ignoble pretender (known for evil) .
68:14: (Who displays these traits) because he is a possessor of wealth and children.
68:15: When our verses are recited to him, he (denies them because We gave him affluence and) says: “Tales of the ancients.”
68:16: We shall brand him over the nose (in battle, as humiliation for the rest of his life) (or: in the hereafter, as distinction for the severity of his disbelief) .
68:17: Indeed, We have tried them— (the Meccan polytheists, with famine and hunger) —as we tried the companions of the garden when they swore to harvest its crops in early morning.
68:18: But without making exception (by saying “If Allāh wills”) .
68:19: So there passed by the garden an affliction (in the form of a fire) from your Lord while they were asleep.
68:20: And by morning it became (black) , like a pitch-dark night (and was completely ruined) .
68:21: And they called out to one another when they reached the morning.
68:22: (Saying) : “Go early to your crop, if you want to cut and collect it.”
68:23: So they departed (towards it) while lowering their voices (making them hushed and secret) .
68:24: Saying (to each other) : “There surely will not enter upon you (in the garden) today, any poor person.”
68:25: And they went early (in the morning) , determined and feeling able (to implement their plan of collecting the harvest early to deprive the poor) .
68:26: But when they saw it, they said: “Indeed, we are lost (thinking they came to the wrong place) .”
68:27: (And when they realised, they said:) “Rather (we have not lost our way, but) , we are (the ones who have been) deprived (of our crops) .”
68:28: The most upright of them said: “Did I not say to you: ‘Why do you not (refrain and repent from your evil intentions and) glorify Allāh (by saying: ‘If Allāh wills’ and giving something to the poor) ?’”
68:29: They said: “Glorified is our Lord (with perfection and praise) , indeed, we were wrongdoers (against our souls by depriving the poor) .”
68:30: Then they turned to one another, blaming each other.
68:31: They said: “O woe to us, indeed, we were transgressors (who denied Allāh’s favour and withheld the right of the poor) .”
68:32: “Perhaps Allāh will give us in exchange (through the blessing of sincere repentance) what is better than it. Indeed, we turn to our Lord, desirous (of forgiveness and a restored blessing) .”
68:33: Such is the (worldly) punishment (for transgression and ingratitude) , but indeed, the punishment of the hereafter (that they, the polytheists, deny) is greater. If only they knew.
68:34: Verily, for the pious (who shun what incurs Allāh’s wrath and displeasure) are gardens of pleasure near their Lord.
68:35: Then shall We treat the Muslims (who believe, repent often and work righteousness) like the criminals (who disbelieve, worship idols and deny resurrection) ?
68:36: What is (the matter) with you? How do you judge?
68:37: Or (if it’s not corruption of your intellects) do you have (in your possession) a scripture (from Us) in which you learn.
68:38: That indeed for you is (Paradise and) whatever you choose (therein of bliss) ?
68:39: Or (if it’s not a scripture) , do you have oaths (binding) upon Us (as covenants) , extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you (in the hereafter) is whatever you judge?
68:40: Ask them, which of them stands responsible (as the claimant) for that (fabrication) ?
68:41: Or (if they do not have oaths binding upon Us) do they have (from their gods) partners (that have made them and the Muslims equal in the hereafter) ? Then let them bring their ‘partners’, if they are truthful.
68:42: (Let them bring their partners) On the Day when the Shin will be uncovered (revealing Allāh’s grandeur and majesty) and they (the hypocrites and the believers) are called to prostrate (to Allāh) but they (the hypocrites) will not be able to do so.
68:43: (With) their eyes cast down, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be called to (make) prostration (through the call to prayer) while they were sound (in bodily constitution) (but they did not respond) .
68:44: So (sufficient it is for you, O Muḥammad, to) leave Me with (the affair) of the one who denies this speech (of the Qurʾān regarding the resurrection) . We will draw (the punishment) upon them, gradually (through imperceptible ways and means) , from where they do not know.
68:45: And I will give them respite (and not hasten the punishment at once) . Verily, My plan (against the mockers) is strong (it cannot be prevented or halted) .
68:46: Or do you (O Muḥammad) , ask them for a payment (for delivering your message) such that they are burdened with debt (and thus, unable to receive your message with acceptance) ?
68:47: Or (after the invalidation of their previous claims) do they have (knowledge of) the unseen (by which they judge that they are upon truth and rewarded in the hereafter and that rejecting truth and hindering people from it is the truth) , so that they write (it down) (and prescribe this course of action upon themselves) .
68:48: Then (after the invalidation of their claims against you and this Qurʾān) be patient (in waiting) for the decision of your Lord, and be not like the Companion of the Fish (Jonah) , when he called out (to his Lord) while he was distressed (with anger against his people) (or: in the belly of the whale) .
68:49: Had not a favour from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been cast out (of the whale) onto the shore, in a blameworthy state (for lack of patience) .
68:50: But his Lord chose him (by purifying him of his error and sending him to over 100,000 of his people who repented and believed) and made him of the righteous.
68:51: And indeed, (out of their intense hatred and enmity) those who disbelieve would almost make you slip (from your station of prophethood) with their eyes (wishing to wrestle or assassinate you) , when they hear the reminder (of the Qurʾān and are unable to criticise or revile it) , and they say: “Verily, he is a madman.”
68:52: But it is not except a reminder to the worlds (which is conveyed by a trustworthy, upright messenger with a great standard of character) .
69:1: The Inevitable Occurrence (of the Day of Realities) .
69:2: And what is the Inevitable Occurrence?
69:3: And what will make you know what is the Inevitable Occurrence?
69:4: (The nations of) Thāmūd and ʿĀd denied the (Day of) the Terrifying Calamity.
69:5: Then as for Thāmūd, they were destroyed (for their disbelief and transgression) . by the exceedingly powerful blast
69:6: And as for ʿĀd, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent (extremely cold) wind (which penetrated their bodies) .
69:7: He imposed it upon them (relentlessly) for seven nights and eight days, in straight succession (sparing no one) , (if you were present) then you would see the dead people therein overthrown (on the ground) , as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms.
69:8: So do you see any surviving remnants of them (who are of their lineage) ?
69:9: And there came Pharoah and those (nations of Abraham and Noah) before him, and (the cities of the people of Lot) overturned by sin.
69:10: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them (in punishment) with a seizure (of) exceeding (severity).
69:11: Indeed, when the water overflowed (its limits against Noah’s people) , We carried you (mankind) in the sailing ship.
69:12: That We might make it a reminder for you (when you see ships sail) and (that) an (attentive) ear may comprehend it (and receive admonition) .
69:13: Then when the Horn is blown once (with the first blowing) .
69:14: And the earth and the mountains are removed from their places and crushed (to dust) with a single crushing (and made into a level plain) .
69:15: Then on that Day, the Inevitable Occurrence will have befallen.
69:16: And the heaven will split (and be torn apart) , for on that Day, it will be fragile.
69:17: And the angels will be (positioned) by its (intact) edges (looking on at earth's transformation) , and carrying the Throne of your Lord above them that Day will be eight (angels) (or: eight rows of angels) .
69:18: That Day, you will be brought forth (for reckoning and judgement) while nothing (of each person's thoughts, feelings, statements and actions that are) concealed among you will be hidden (from Allāh) .
69:19: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand, then he will say: “ (Come, O righteous men) , take (and) read my record.”
69:20: Indeed, I was certain that I would surely meet my reckoning.
69:21: So he will be in a life, well-pleased (with his achievement) .
69:23: Its fruits (always) near at hand (to be picked without effort, whether standing, sitting or lying) .
69:24: (It will be said to them) : “Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you left behind in the days past (during the world) to be sent onwards (for this day in the hereafter) .”
69:25: But as for he who is given his record in his left hand, he will say (in grief) : “I wish, if only I had not been given my record.”
69:26: “And that I had not known what my reckoning is.”
69:27: “I wish, (the worldly death), if only it had been the decisive end (for me) .”
69:28: “My wealth has not availed me (in anything) .”
69:29: “Gone from me is my power (and my arguments) (to absolve myself from disbelief and associationism) .”
69:30: (It will be said) : “Seize him, and shackle him (with his hands brought to his neck) .”
69:31: Then, cast him (only into) the Blazing Fire (to burn) .
69:32: Then, to a chain whose length is seventy cubits, fasten him (by threading it through his body) .
69:33: Indeed, he never used to believe in Allāh, the Most Great.
69:34: And nor would he encourage (himself and others with) the feeding of the poor.
69:35: So there is not for him this Day, here, any close friend (to benefit him) .
69:36: Nor any food, except the discharge of wounds (the pus of the people of Hell) .
69:37: None will eat it except the errant (who preferred disbelief, associationism, oppression and sin) .
69:38: So I swear by what you see (in the earth and heavens, of perceptible signs)
69:39: And what you do not see (of angels, souls, the affairs of the hereafter and all that is imperceptible) .
69:40: That indeed, it is certainly the (recited) word of a noble messenger (as conveyed from his Lord) .
69:41: And it is not the word of poet, (not even) little, do you believe.
69:42: And nor is it the word of a soothsayer, (not even) little, do you remember.
69:43: (It is) a revelation sent down from the Lord of the worlds.
69:44: And if he (Muḥammad) had fabricated some sayings against Us.
69:45: We would surely have siezed him by the right hand (or: with power and might) .
69:46: Then We would certainly have cut off his (heart’s) artery.
69:47: And there would be none among you who could prevent Us (from him) .
69:48: And verily, (the Qurʾān) , it is indeed a reminder for the pious.
69:49: And verily, We know indeed, that among you are deniers (of this Qurʾān and its conveyer) .
69:50: And verily, it will indeed be (a cause of) intense regret for the disbelievers (when they see the believers rewarded on the Day of Reckoning) .
69:51: And verily, (this Qurʾān) (or: this intense regret of the disbelievers) it is the absolute truth with certainty.
69:52: So glorify (with praises) the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
70:1: A questioner (mockingly and defiantly) asked for an impending punishment ...
70:2: … to (hastily befall) the disbelievers. There is none to avert (its occurrence) ...
70:3: ... from Allāh, Owner of the ways of ascent (through the heavens) .
70:4: The angels and the Spirit (Gabriel) will ascend to Him during a Day whose measure is fifty thousand years (of your reckoning) .
70:5: So be patient (with them and their abuse) with a gracious patience.
70:6: Verily, they see it (as something) far off (or: far-fetched) .
70:8: The Day that the sky will be like molten metal (or: like the residue of oil, with reddish tinge) .
70:9: And the mountains will be like (loose, fluffy fibres of) wool.
70:10: And (from the intensity of fear) no close friend will ask (anything) of a close friend (as to his troubles and distress) ...
70:11: ... (Even though) they will be made to see each other. The criminal will wish that he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day with his children.
70:12: And his wife and his brother.
70:13: And his nearest relatives who shelter him.
70:14: And all that are in the earth, so that it might save him.
70:15: But no (there will be no ransom for the criminals) ! Indeed, it will be the Fire (of Hell) .
70:16: Which strips the exteriors (of men, the scalp, skin, flesh, nerves and tendons, with its intense heat) .
70:17: It invites he who turned his back (on the truth) and turned away from (obedience) (drawing and plucking him) .
70:20: When evil touches him (such as disease or poverty) , (he is) distressed.
70:21: And when good touches him (such as fitness, vitality and riches) , (he is) stingy, prohibitive (in showing gratitude and charity) .
70:22: Except the observers of prayer (whose prayer prevents them from such qualities) .
70:23: Those who are constant in (observing) their prayer (never distracted or delayed from it) .
70:24: And those in whose wealth is a known right (of charity) ...
70:25: ... For the (needy) one who asks and the one (who does not ask, while) deprived (due to a calamity or hardship) .
70:26: And those who (truthfully) believe in the Day of Reckoning and Recompense (through righteous actions) .
70:27: And those who— (despite their righteousness) —are fearful of the punishment of their Lord.
70:28: Verily, the punishment of their Lord is not to be taken lightly (and is to be feared) .
70:29: And those who guard their chastity (by protecting their private parts from all types of unlawful sexual activity and all the steps and ways leading to it) .
70:30: Except with their wives and what their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed.
70:31: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors (of the boundaries of what is lawful) .
70:32: And those who keenly observe their trusts and covenants (cautiously avoiding any infringements) .
70:33: And those who stand firmly in (giving) their testmonies (with impartiality, to preserve people’s rights and enact justice) .
70:34: And those who guard (the careful and timely observance of) their prayers.
70:35: They will be (abiding) in gardens (of Paradise) , honoured.
70:36: So what is it with the disbelievers who (have no hope for reward in the hereafter but) hasten to flock around you (O Muḥammad) (in order to mock you and what you convey of glad tidings for the righteous, claiming they are more worthy of it) .
70:37: Sitting on the right and left (of you) in separate groups.
70:38: Does every man among them hope to enter a garden of bliss (in the hereafter, without faith and righteousness) ?
70:39: No indeed (the affair is not as they crave it to be) ! Verily, We have created them from what they know (a despised fluid that they emit, and their resurrection is just as easy) .
70:40: So no (the affair is not as you claim, that you will not be resurrected) , I swear by the Lord of the eastern (points of) sunrise and the western (points of) sunset, that indeed, We are able …
70:41: … To (destroy and) replace them with (others) better than them and we are not to be outdone (in doing so) .
70:42: So leave them to indulge in vain (idle) talk, and (amuse themselves with) play until they meet the their Day which they are promised.
70:43: The Day they will emerge from the graves quickly, as if they were rushing towards an erected sign (for them to gather at) (or: towards an erected idol, just as they would in the life of the world) .
70:44: (Outwardly) Their eyes will be downcast in (fear and) humility, (with) disgrace overwhelming them (inwardly) . That is the Day they were promised (on the tongues of Allah’s Messengers, and which they asked about in mockery and defiance) .
71:1: Verily, We sent Noah to his people (saying to him) : “Warn your people (against the injustice of idolatry and sin) before there comes to them a painful punishment (in this world and the hereafter) .
71:2: He said: “O my people, indeed, I am to you a clear warner (against disbelief, idolatry, ingratitude and sin and of an impending punishment) .”
71:3: “ (Calling you to save yourselves with the message:) That you should worship Allāh (alone) , fear Him and obey me (in rectitude) .
71:4: “He will forgive you your sins, and delay you for an appointed term (to enjoy His blessings in this world) . Verily, the term of Allāh (granted to each soul) , when it comes, will not be delayed, if only you knew.”
71:5: He said: “My Lord, indeed, I have called my people (with what You commanded me) night and day.”
71:6: “But my call did not increase them (in anything) but flight (from the truth) .”
71:7: “And indeed, every time I called them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, and covered themselves with their garments (so as not to hear and see me) , and persisted (in their denial of the truth) , and were arrogant (towards faith and obedience) with severe pride.”
71:8: “Then verily, I (also) called them (to faith and obedience) aloud.”
71:9: “Then verily, I (also) announced (my call) to them (openly) and went to them (individually, confiding with them) in private.”
71:10: “And I said: ‘ (Abandon sin and) Ask forgiveness from your Lord (for what has passed) , verily, He is always Oft-Forgiving.’”
71:11: “He will send (clouds from the) the sky with continuous (rain) (to revive you and your land with provision) .”
71:12: “And He will give you increase in wealth and children and make for you gardens (in abundance) and make for you rivers (that flow therein) (both in this life and the hereafter) .”
71:13: “What is the matter with you that you do not (affirm Allāh’s true greatness and) hope in (the mercy and reward of) Allāh with (His exclusive worship and ) reverent obedience (that is rightfully due to Him) ?”
71:14: “While He created you in (various) stages (of creation, in the wombs of your mothers, and from birth to full stature) .”
71:15: “Do you not see (and consider) how Allāh has created the seven heavens in layers (one above another) .”
71:16: “And made the moon therein a light (for the darkness of night) , and made the sun a lamp (for the pursuits of the day) ?”
71:17: “And Allāh created you out of (the dust of) the earth, causing you to grow (upon it, from smallness to largeness) .”
71:18: “Then He will make you return into it, and bring you out (again) with an extraction (from your graves, to resurrect and recompense you) .”
71:19: “And Allāh made the earth a (spread out) carpet for you (to prepare and settle upon) .”
71:20: “That you may traverse therein (its) broad (and diverse) paths.”
71:21: Noah said: “My Lord, indeed, they have disobeyed me and (continued to) follow one whose (enticement and diversion by) wealth and children (from the truth) will not increase him (in the hereafter) except in loss.”
71:22: “And they conspired an extremely great conspiracy (against the truth and its people) .”
71:23: “And said (to their people) : ‘Never abandon (the worship of) your gods, and never abandon (the worship of) Wadd, and nor Suwāʾ, and nor Yaghūth, and nor Yaʿūq and nor Nasr (for the worship of Allāh alone) .’”
71:24: “And already, they— (the heads of disbelief) —have misguided many. And (my Lord) do not increase the wrongdoers except in (the ruin of further) misguidance (as just recompense for their insolence) .”
71:25: Because of (the entirety of) their sins (comprising disbelief, polytheism, sins, disobedience and disdain, abuse and mockery of Noah and the believers) , they were drowned (by the flood) and (then) entered into the Fire, and they found not for themselves, any helpers besides Allāh.
71:26: And Noah said: “My Lord, do not leave upon the earth from the disbelievers, a single inhabitant.”
71:27: “Indeed, if You leave them (in part or whole) , they will misguide Your slaves and they will they not beget except a wicked (sinful) disbeliever.”
71:28: “My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house a believer, and the believing men and the believing women. And do not increase the wrongdoers, except in destruction.”
72:1: Say (O Muḥammad) : “It has been revealed to me that a group of (three to ten) jinns listened (to this Qurʾān) . They said: ‘Verily, we have heard an amazing recital.’
72:2: ‘It guides to the right course (of truth and righteousness) and we have believed in it, and never will we associate with our Lord, anything (in worship) (after it has detailed the evidences for the futility of shirk) .’
72:3: ‘And (it teaches) that He, exalted is the grandeur (majesty and self-sufficiency) of our Lord, has not taken a wife nor a son (nor any offspring) .’
72:4: ‘And (reveals) that the foolish among us (Satan, or the disbelieving jinn) used to utter against Allāh an excessively wrong saying (far-removed from the truth) .’
72:5: ‘And that (in out state of ignorance and misguidance) , We had (erroneously) thought that the men and jinn would never utter a lie against Allāḥ (and thus, believed their false doctrines) .’
72:6: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn (to ward off their evil) , but they (the men) increased them (the jinn) in sin (and transgression) .
72:7: ‘And that they (the men) had (erroneously) thought as you (the jinn) thought, that Allāh will not send anyone (as a messenger to men and jinn) (or: raise anyone from the grave) .’
72:8: ‘And we have sought to reach the heaven (as we used to) but found it (in this time) filled with powerful guards and burning flames.’
72:9: ‘And (before this time) we used to take positions therein to sit and eavesdrop, but whoever listens now (from those positions) will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.’
72:10: ‘And (with the guarding of the heaven) , we do not know (therefore) whether (some) evil is intended for those on the earth (if they are decreed to disbelieve in this message) or whether their Lord intends for them a right course (of belief and righteousness) .’
72:11: ‘And among us are the righteous and among us (are those who) are otherwise. We were of (many) variant ways (religions and sects) (before this Qurʾān) .’
72:12: ‘And we are (now) certain that we cannot escape (the punishment of) Allāh in the earth, nor can we escape Him by fleeing (into the heaven) .’
72:13: ‘And when we heard the guidance (of the Qurʾān) , we believed in it (without hesitation) . And whoever believes in his Lord (and what He revealed) will not fear deficiency (in his reward) or transgression (in punishment) .’
72:14: ‘And among us are Muslims (who submitted to their Lord) and among us are the unjust (who have chosen paths of deviation) .’ And whoever embraced Islām, then those (are the ones who) have chosen the right course (with care and diligence) .
72:15: But as for the unjust (who deny the truth and set up rivals for Allāh) , they will be fuel for Hell.
72:16: And (Allāh has revealed) that if they had remained steadfast on the (right) path We would have given them rainwater in abundance (giving them ample provision) .
72:17: So We might test them (for gratitude) therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord, He will draw him into an arduous (relentless) punishment.
72:18: And (Allāh revealed) that the mosques (and places of prostration of the body, the forehead, hands, knees and feet) are for (the worship of) Allāh alone, so do not invoke anyone alongside Allāh.
72:19: And (Allāh revealed to me) that when Allāh’s servant (Muḥammad) stood up (reciting and) invoking Him, they (the jinn) eagerly formed a dense crowd around him (and almost overwhelmed him) .”
72:20: Say (O Muḥammad) : “I only (worship and) invoke my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him (in worship and invocation) .”
72:21: Say: “Indeed, I hold for you no power over harm (to repel it from you, if you reject guidance) or right direction (to make you follow it) .”
72:22: Say: “Verily, none will protect me from Allāḥ (if I disobeyed Him) and I will not find a (place of) refuge with any besides Him.”
72:23: “Except (that I only hold the responsibility of making) conveyance from Allāh and (conveying) His messages (to you) . And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger, then verily, for him is the Fire of Hell, to remain therein forever.”
72:24: (But, they will not cease upon their way ) Until when they see what they are promised (of punishment) , then they will know (truly) who is weaker in helpers (when they find none to save them) and fewer in number (when they are resurrected alone) .
72:25: Say (if they ask you) : “I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will make for it a delayed term (to a known, appointed time) .”
72:26: (He alone is) The Knower of the Unseen and He does not disclose His (knowledge of the) unseen to anyone.
72:27: Except to a messenger whom He has chosen, for verily, He places (guardian angels) before and behind him (protecting him from the interference of the devils) .
72:28: So that He may (confirm what He already) knows, that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord (and thereby, established His proof upon mankind) , and He has encompassed all that is with them (in their role as messengers) , and has enumerated all (other) things (besides that) .
73:1: O you who wraps himself (in garments) .
73:2: Stand to pray the (whole) night, except a little.
73:3: Half of it, or reduce from (half) a little.
73:4: Or add to it, and recite the Qurʾān (aloud in the night-prayer) in a slow, clearly-pronounced, and pleasant tone.
73:5: Indeed, We will send upon you a weighty word (of great meaning, admonition, guidance and law) .
73:6: Indeed, the rising by night is more potent in consolidating (the heart and tongue) and most suitable for (reciting, memorising and comprehending the) words (of the Qurʾān) .
73:7: Indeed, there is for you during the day, much preoccupation (with worldly needs and duties) .
73:8: And remember the name of your Lord (at all times and in all situations) and (sincerely) devote yourself to Him with a complete devotion (through worship, supplication and reliance) .
73:9: (He is) the Lord of the east (and its night) and the west (and its day) , there is none worthy of worship but He, so take Him (alone) as Disposer of (your) affairs.
73:10: And be patient over what they (the polytheists) say (of words of mockery and abuse) and (do not confront them but) avoid them with a gracious avoidance.
73:11: And leave Me (alone) to deal with the deniers, those possessing (worldly) riches, luxuries and pleasures, and give them respite for a little while.
73:12: Verily, with Us (as just recompense) are shackles and a raging fire.
73:13: And food that chokes and a painful punishment.
73:14: On the Day when the earth and the mountains will tremble (continously and violently) and the mountains will (disintegrate and) become a heap of sand pouring down.
73:15: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger (who was born among you) to be a witness over you (if you disbelieve) , just as we sent Pharoah a messenger (who was born among them) .
73:16: But Pharoah disobeyed the messenger (as you have disobeyed the Messenger) , so We seized him with a severe (and heavy) punishment.
73:17: Then how will you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children grow old (and become weak and grey-haired) ?
73:18: The heaven will be split apart (from the heavy burden of that Day) . His promise is always fulfilled.
73:19: Verily, this is an admonition (to remind you, O mankind) , so whoever wills, may take a path (of righteousness) to his Lord.
73:20: Verily, your Lord knows that you stand (to pray for) almost two-thirds of the night, or a half, or a third, and so do a group of those with you. And Allāh determines (the measures) of the night and the day. He knows that you are unable to (pray the whole night) , so He has turned to you (mercifully, with a concession) . So (henceforth) recite what is easy (for you) of the Qurʾān. He knows that there will be among you the sick, and others travelling through the land, seeking of Allāh’s bounty (through work and trade) , and others fighting in Allah’s cause, so recite what is easy from it. And establish the prayer, and give the zakāh and lend to Allāh a goodly loan. And whatever you send forth for yourselves of (any type of) goodness, you will find it with Allāh, it will be better and greater in reward. And ask Allāh for forgiveness, indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
74:1: O you who covers himself (with a garment) .
74:2: Arise and warn (those steeped in idolatry, oppression and sin) .
74:3: And your Lord magnify (above what they ascribe to Him) .
74:4: And your clothing purify (from treachery, injustice and sin) .
74:5: And (the) impurity (of idolatry and sin) shun.
74:6: And consider not (your prophethood a favour to others) to gain more (of the world) .
74:7: But be patient (over harm and injustice and do your duty only) for (the sake of) your Lord.
74:8: For when the trumpet is blown.
74:9: Then (indeed) , that Day will be a difficult day.
74:10: Not easy (at all) for the disbelievers.
74:11: Leave Me (to deal) with one whom I alone created (Walīd bin al-Mughīrah) (or: whom I created alone in the womb) .
74:12: And granted him abundant wealth (and means) .
74:13: And offspring (who remain) in his presence.
74:14: And prepared for him (a life of) affluence, luxury and status.
74:15: Then (after all that) he desires that I should give (him) more.
74:16: Never! Indeed, he has been obstinate (with his ingratitude) towards Our signs.
74:17: I will exhaust him with unrelenting hardship (by changing his present state to one of loss and ruin in this world, before the hereafter) .
74:18: Indeed, he (Walīd, the wealthy head of disbelief) thought and plotted (as to how to discredit the Messenger and the Qurʾān) .
74:19: So may he be destroyed (or: cursed) (for) how he plotted.
74:20: Then again, may he be destroyed (or: cursed) (for) how he plotted.
74:21: Then he considered again (as to which lie he should choose) .
74:22: Then he frowned and scowled (while engaged in thought) .
74:23: Then, he turned his back (on Islām) and was arrogant (after his knowledge that this Qurʾān is not the speech of a man) .
74:24: And said (knowing that he is lying, in order to please his people) : “This is nothing but magic, learned and narrated (from others) .”
74:25: “This is nothing but the word of a human.”
74:26: I will cast him into Saqar (a level of Hellfire) .
74:27: And what will inform you what is Saqar?
74:28: It lets nothing (thrown into it) remain (undestroyed) and lets nothing (remain destroyed until it is brought back again for more) .
74:29: Burning (and blackening) the skins (with an intense blackness) .
74:30: Over it are nineteen (angels as keepers) .
74:31: And We have not made as keepers of the Fire except angels (that are strong and stern, that do exactly what they are commanded, without pity and mercy) , and We have not made their number (to be this small) except as a trial for those who disbelieve (that they may belittle and mock it, as confirmation of their arrogant disbelief) , so that those (Jews and Christians) who were given the scripture may be certain (about the truthfulness of this Qurʾān so that the proof is established against them) , and that those who believe may increase in faith, and that those who were given the scripture and the believers will have no doubts left, and so that those in whose hearts is a disease (of hypocrisy) and the disbelievers will say: “What does Allāh intend by this example?” Thus, does Allāh leave astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except He. And this (warning of Hellfire) is not except a reminder to mankind.
74:32: No (the affair is contrary to their claim that they will overwhelm the keepers of Hell) , and by the moon.
74:33: And (by) the night when it departs.
74:34: And (by) the dawn, when it brightens.
74:35: Indeed, it (Hellfire) is one of the greatest calamities.
74:37: To whomever among you wills to advance (with piety and righteousness) or remain behind (with sin and disobedience) .
74:38: Every soul is a pledge (held in liability) for what it has earned.
74:39: Except the companions of the right.
74:40: (Who will be) in gardens, asking one another.
74:42: (And asking them) : “What caused you to enter Saqar (Hellfire) ?”
74:43: They will say: “We were not of those who prayed (the obligatory prayers) .”
74:44: “And nor did we used to feed the poor.”
74:45: “And we used to engage in false (vain) discourse (in belittlement and rejection of this Qurʾān and the truth) with vain talkers.”
74:46: “And we used to deny the Day of Recompsense.”
74:47: “Until there came to us the certainty (of death) .”
74:48: So the intercession of the intercessors will be of no benefit to them.
74:49: So what is (the matter) with them that from the reminder, they turn away.
74:50: As if they were startled (wild) donkeys.
74:51: Fleeing from hunters (or: snipers,) (or: a lion) (in aversion and fear) .
74:52: Rather, every man among them desires that he should be given scrolls (of scripture from Allāh) spread out (and read to them, addressing them by name and telling them that they must follow the Prophet and the Qurʾān) .
74:53: No (they will not be given what they desire) ! Rather (even if they were given it, they would still disbelieve because) , they do not fear the (punishment of the) hereafter.
74:54: No (again, they will not be given what they desire) ! Indeed, (this Qurʾān) is a reminder.
74:55: So whoever wills (to do so) will (read and) receive admonition from it.
74:56: And they will not receive admonition unless Allāh wills. He is worthy of being feared with reverent obedience and worthy of granting forgiveness (to the righteous believers) .
75:1: I swear by (the sanctity and greatness of) the Day of Resurrection.
75:2: And I swear by the self-reproaching soul (that this day is a certainty) .
75:3: Does (the disbelieving) man think that We will not assemble his bones (after death) ?
75:4: Yes (leave aside his bones) , We are able to put together his (very) fingertips.
75:5: But man (denies or forgets the Resurrection and hence) desires to continue committing sins (and delaying repentance) .
75:6: He asks (in denial and jest) : “When is the Day of Resurrection?”
75:7: So when the vision is bewildered with intense fear (at the moment of impending death) .
75:8: And the moon (loses its light and) darkens.
75:9: And the sun and moon are joined together (ending the alternation of night and day) .
75:10: Man will say on that Day: “Where is the place of refuge (from Allāh) (or: from the Fire) ?”
75:11: No! There is no refuge (of any sort) .
75:12: To your Lord (alone) , that Day, is the ultimate destination.
75:13: On that Day, man will be informed of what he sent forward (of good or evil deeds) and what he left behind (of good or evil effects that others followed) .
75:14: Rather, (the faculties and limbs of a) man will be a witness against himself.
75:15: Even if he was to present excuses (to escape liability for his deeds) .
75:16: Move not your tongue with (the Qurʾān) to hasten (its recitation) (for fear of not memorising it) .
75:17: Indeed, upon Us is its collection (in your heart) and its recitation (on your tongue) .
75:18: So when We have recited it (to you through Gabriel) , then follow its recitation.
75:19: Then, upon Us is the clarification of its (meanings and laws to you) .
75:20: No (it is not as you presume, that you will not be resurrected) , but you love the present (life of this world) .
75:21: And you neglect (working for) the hereafter.
75:22: (Some) faces that day will be radiant (from the bliss of their hearts and joy of their souls) .
75:24: And (other) faces that Day will be frowning (grim and gloomy) .
75:25: Expecting that an evil, destructive calamity is about to be inflicted upon them.
75:26: No (it is not as you presume, that you will not be resurrected, so be warned that) when (the soul) has reached the collar-bone.
75:27: And it is said: “Who (among the physicians) will attend to him (to save him from death) .”
75:28: And he has become certain that it is the time of departure (from the world) .
75:29: And the severe affliction (of the world, death) is joined with the severe affliction (of entering the hereafter) .
75:30: To (the destination of) your Lord, that Day, will be your passage.
75:31: So he (the disbeliever) did not believe (in the truth of this Qurʾān and the resurrection) , nor did he pray (to show gratitude for the innumerable favours of his Lord) .
75:32: But (instead) he denied (the truth) and turned away (from Allāh’s commands) .
75:33: Then, he went to his people, strutting conceitedly (full of pride) .
75:34: Woe to you, and woe to you (again) .
75:35: Then woe to you, and woe to you (again) .
75:36: Does man think that that he will be left, neglected (without purpose, guidance, accountability and recompense) ?
75:37: Was he not (a mere) sperm from semen that was emitted (and lodged into a womb) ?
75:38: Then he was a clinging clot and then He created (his form) and fashioned (him) with proportion (and precision) .
75:39: And made him (the human) into two sexes, the male and female.
75:40: Is not that One (Who does all of that) able to give life to the dead? (Yes, most surely) .
76:1: Has there (not) passed over man a (lengthy) period of time when he was not a thing (even) mentioned?
76:2: Indeed, We created man out of a drop mixed (from the male and female) in order to try him, so We made him hearing (to hear our verses) , seeing (to see our signs) .
76:3: Indeed, We have showed him the way, whether (he chooses to be) grateful (for Our favours) or ungrateful.
76:4: Indeed, We have prepared for the (ingrate) disbelievers, chains (to lead them) , and shackles (to fasten their hands to their necks) and a blazing Fire (to burn their flesh) .
76:5: Indeed, the righteous (who lovingly obeyed their Lord) will drink from a cup (of wine) mixed (with the water of the spring) of Kāfūr.
76:6: A spring from which Allāh’s servants will drink, they will cause it to gush forth in abundance (wherever and whenever they wish to drink from it) .
76:7: They (are those) who fulfil their vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread (affecting the heavens and the earth and all therein) .
76:8: And (when hungry) they give food, despite their love for it, to the needy, the orphan and the captive (of war) .
76:9: (While saying:) “Indeed, we feed you seeking only (the pleasure of seeing) Allāh’s Face. We do not wish from you any reward and nor gratitude.”
76:10: “Indeed, we fear from our Lord (the punishment of) a Day that is stern and severely distressful (causing faces to frown with extreme dislike) .”
76:11: So (because of their piety) Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance (on their faces) and joy (in their hearts) .
76:12: And He will reward them for what they patiently endured (in righteousness and restraint from evil) with a garden (in Paradise) and silk (garments) .
76:13: (While) reclining therein on raised couches, they will not see a sun therein (with discomforting heat) and nor (experience) bitter cold (but rather, enjoy its pleasant and blissful air) .
76:14: And close above them (in the garden) are its shades (from its trees) and its fruit-bunches are lowered for them, for ease of reach (and easy picking) .
76:15: And there will be passed among them vessels of silver and cups (made) clear like glass.
76:16: (Like) clear glass made out of silver, whose (size and measure) they will determine (according to their wishes) .
76:17: And they will be given to drink therein a cup (of wine) mixed with ginger.
76:18: (From) a fountain there, called Salsabīl (with the most palatable drink of the smoothest texture) .
76:19: And around them will be boys of eternal youth (to serve them) . When you see them, you would think them scattered pearls (due to their pure complexions and radiant faces) .
76:20: And when you look (anywhere in Paradise) , you will see (unimaginable) delight and a great dominion.
76:21: Upon them will be garments of fine, green silk and thick brocade. They will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and (to honour them) , their Lord will give them a pure (and purifying) drink (free of the defilements and inclinations of the wine of this world) .
76:22: (And it will be said:) “Verily, (all of) this is a reward for you, and your striving (upon truth and righteouness in the world) has been appreciated.”
76:23: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you (O Muḥammad) , the Qurʾān in installments, divided in stages (for profound wisdoms necessitating that) .
76:24: So be patient upon the decision of your Lord (to test you and then aid you) and do not obey among them, neither a sinner (engrossed in immorality, such as ʿUtbah bin Rabīʿah) nor an ingrate disbeliever (steeped in pride and arrogance such as al-Walīd bin al-Mughīrah) .
76:25: And mention the name of your Lord, morning (in the prayer of Fajr) and afternoon (in the prayers of Ḍhuhr and Aṣr) .
76:26: And (likewise) during the night (in the Maghrib and ʿIshā prayers) , and glorify (His perfection) for a long part of the night (in the Tajahhud prayer) .
76:27: Indeed, these (disbelievers) love the present (life of the world) and throw behind them a heavy (difficult and terrifying) day (neither preparing for it nor caring about it) .
76:28: It is We Who created them and strengthened their joints (with tissues, nerves and tendons, to confer upon them a strong build) . And if We willed, We could (destroy them and) replace them completely with others like them (of similar build, who would be righteous) .
76:29: Verily, these (verses of the Qurʾān) are a reminder (containing deep admonition) . So whoever wills, let him take a path (of righteousness) to his Lord.
76:30: But you do not will (to take the path) , unless Allāh wills (for you to take it) . Indeed, Allāh is All-Knowing (of who desires and deserves truth and guidance) and All-Wise (in whom He guides or leaves astray) .
76:31: He admits whomever He wills into His mercy (of Paradise) , but (as for) the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment (as just recompense) .
77:1: By the winds sent forth in succession, one after another (or: the angels, sent with good) .
77:2: And the winds that blow violently (or: the angels that bring the raging winds) (or: the angels that rage in their courses, hastening to obey their Lord) .
