77:3: And by the winds that scatter (clouds and rain) (or: the angels that disseminate good) (or: the places revived by rainwater with scattered vegetation) .
77:4: And those (angels) (or: verses) that bring what separates (truth from falsehood, right from wrong) .
77:5: And those (angels) who deliver revelation (to Allāh’s messengers) .
77:6: As an excuse (from Allāh to those who believe and repent from prior disbelief or sin) or as a warning (so that none have any argument against Allāh on the Day of Resurrection) .
77:7: Indeed, what you are promised is surely to occur.
77:8: So when the (light of the) stars (is taken away and they) are obliterated.
77:9: And when the heaven is cracked open.
77:10: And when the mountains are pulverised (and levelled to the ground) .
77:11: And when the messengers’ time has come to be gathered together (to bear witness over their nations) .
77:12: For what day (has the appointment of these messengers) been delayed?
77:13: For the Day of Judgement and Separation (between those of Paradise and those of Hell) .
77:14: And what will inform you what is the Day of Judgement and Separation?
77:15: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers (of this Qurʾān and its message) .
77:16: Did We not destroy the former nations (who denied resurrection and accountability) ?
77:17: Then We will make others to follow them (in like destruction) ?
77:18: Thus, do we deal with the criminals (with just recompense) .
77:19: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:20: Did We not create you from a despised fluid (of semen) ?
77:21: Then We placed it in a safe lodging (the womb) .
77:22: For a known period (of gestation, nine months, give or take) .
77:23: And We determined (for) it (to grow in that safe lodging into a being with a soul) , and most excellent a determiner are We.
77:24: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:25: Have We not made the earth (with its surface and its interior) a receptacle for you (to meet all your needs) ?
77:26: For the living (to subsist on) and the dead (to be buried in) ?
77:27: And We have placed therein lofty, firmly-fixed mountains and have given you sweet water to drink (from rivers and springs) .
77:28: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:29: (They will be told) : “Depart to that which you used to deny (in the world) !”
77:30: “Depart to a shadow (of smoke from Hellfire) having three columns.”
77:31: “Providing no cool shade, nor being of any use against (the heat of the) flame.”
77:32: Indeed, it (Hellfire) throws sparks like fortresses (or: tree-trunks) (in their size) .
77:33: As if they were (groups of) yellow camels (or: stones) (or: huge twisted ropes) .
77:34: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:35: This is a Day when they will not speak (due to intense fear) (and their limbs will be made to speak as witnesses against them) .
77:36: And nor will they be permitted (to speak) whereby they (could) make (their) excuse.
77:37: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:38: This is the Day of Decisive Judgement and Separation. We have gathered you and the former peoples (to judge between you) .
77:39: So if you have a plan (among yourselves, to escape My justice) then plan against Me.
77:40: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:41: Indeed, the reverently obedient (who shunned ingratitude and sin) will be among shades and springs.
77:42: And fruits (of every sort) , such as they desire.
77:43: (Being told:) “Eat and drink comfortably (without interruption or disturbance) for what you used to do.”
77:44: Verily, thus, do We reward the doers of good.
77:45: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:46: (O ingrate disbelievers) , eat and enjoy yourselves for a little while. Verily, you are the criminals.
77:47: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:48: When it is said to them: “Bow (in prayer, out of humility and gratitude for your Lord’s innumerable favours) ”, they do not bow (out of pride and arrogance) .
77:49: Woe, that Day, (of ruin and destruction) to the deniers.
77:50: Then in what statement after it (the Qurʾān) will they believe?
78:1: About what are they (the Pagans of Quraysh) asking each other?
78:2: (It is) about the great news (of the Qurʾān, which you have conveyed to them, and which concerns the reality of the resurrection and recompense) .
78:3: (The great news) about which they are in disagreement (between themselves) (or: with the believers) .
78:4: No (the affair is not as they presume in their denial of resurrection) ! They will soon come to know (of its reality when they have been resurrected) !
78:5: No again (the affair is not as they presume it to be) ! They will soon come to know.
78:6: (As evidence that We can and will resurrect you in order to judge you) : Have We not made the earth as a stretched-out expanse (for habitation and rest) ?
78:7: And the mountains as pegs (to stabilise the earth) ?
78:8: And We created you in pairs (of all types, male and female, good and evil, tall and short, black and white) .
78:9: And We made your sleep as (a means of) rest (for your bodies) .
78:10: And We made the (darkness of) night as a covering (for you to retreat and rest in your abodes) .
78:11: And We made the day for (pursuing) livelihood (wherein you travel, work, earn and trade) .
78:12: And We constructed above you (as a ceiling) seven strong (heavens) (precise in their creation, without rift or flaw) .
78:13: And We made (therein) an intensely hot, glowing lamp.
78:14: And We sent down, from the (wind-driven) rain clouds, abundant water (repeatedly, again and again) .
78:15: That We may bring out (of the earth) therewith, grains (of various types) and vegetation (for you and your livestock) .
78:16: And (crowded) gardens, of thick, entwined growth (with varieties of colours and fruits) .
78:17: Indeed, the (time of the) Day of Rendering Decisive Judgement has already been appointed.
78:18: The Day when the Trumpet will be blown and you will come in crowds (nation by nation, group by group, from every direction) .
78:19: And the heaven will be opened up and will become doorways (for the descent of the Angels) .
78:20: And the mountains will be removed (from their places) and will be (as) a mirage (disappearing from view, after being crushed to dust and scattered into non-existence) .
78:21: Indeed, Hellfire has been prepared as an ambush (for every person, who must either pass over it or fall into it) .
78:22: For (those who) transgressed (in religion with disbelief, polytheism and sin, or in worldly affairs with injustice against others) (it will be) a dwelling place.
78:23: They will remain therein for ages (unending for the disbelievers, limited for disobedient believers) .
78:24: They will not taste anything cool therein (to relieve burning) , nor (receive) any drink (to relieve thirst) .
78:25: Except boiling water and the pus (of the people of Hellfire, from their skin, flesh and wounds) .
78:26: A befitting recompense (according to the nature of their crimes) .
78:27: Verily, they never used to believe in a reckoning (for their deeds) (and hence, never feared or prepared for it) .
78:28: And they denied Our signs with stubborn denial (over and over again) .
78:29: And everything (from their deeds) We have enumerated in written form (in the Preserved Tablet before their creation, and in the scrolls recorded by the angels as they performed their deeds) .
78:30: So taste now (the consequences of your disbelief) (which is pus and boiling water in Hellfire) and We shall not increase you except in (further) punishment.
78:31: Verily, for the pious (who feared and obeyed Allāh) will be (the) success (of being delivered from Hellfire and entered into Paradise) .
78:33: And young, mature, full-breasted (maidens) of equal age.
78:34: And a full cup (of pure, wholesome, non-intoxicating, delicious wine) (filled repeatedly) .
78:35: They will not hear (false, evil, impure,) vain speech therein and nor any lying (as they will never be intoxicated) .
78:36: A reward from your Lord, an ample (and generous) gift (calculated according to the very best of their good deeds) .
78:37: The Lord of the heavens and earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They will possess no authority to speak to Him (that Day) .
78:38: The Day that the Spirit (Gabriel, or another mighty angel, or the souls of men) and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak (in order to intercede for another) except he to whom the Most Merciful grants permission and who had said what is correct (the word of pure monotheism, lā ilāha illallāh, while being true to its requirements) .
78:39: That is the True Day (whose occurrence is real) . So whoever wills, let him take (a path to) a place of return to His Lord (through righteous deeds) .
78:40: Verily, We have warned you of a near punishment, on the Day a man will look at what his hands have sent forth, and the disbeliever will say: “Woe to me! How I wish that I were (the decomposed) dust (of my dead body, and had not been resurrected) (or: How I wish I had suffered the fate of the animals and been turned to dust) !”
79:1: By those (angels) who forcefully pull out (the souls of the disbelievers and the wicked at death) (in a long, drawn out, repetitive manner) .
79:2: And (by) those (angels) that take out (the souls of the believers) gently and quickly.
79:3: And (by) (all) those (things) that move swiftly and smoothly (the angels, sun, moon, stars, ships, horses and so on) .
79:4: Then (by) (all) those (things) that push forward as in a race (including: the angels rushing to hear revelation) (and: the angels rushing to fulfil Allāh’s commands and decrees) (and: the angels rushing the souls of the believers to Paradise) (and: the souls of the righteous rushing to the angels at death, fond of meeting Allāh and receiving His mercy) .
79:5: Then (by) those (angels) that arrange every affair (of creation, by Allāh’s command) .
79:6: On the Day when the violent shaking (of the earth and mountains) will take place (with the first blowing of the Trumpet) (and all creatures will die) .
79:7: A subsequent (blowing) will follow it (and all creatures will be resurrected) .
79:8: (Some) hearts that day will tremble with fear and anxiety.
79:9: Their eyes cast down (in awe, humbled by the terrors of that Day) .
79:10: (Yet at present) (the Pagans) say: “Will we be returned (from our graves) to our original state of life (as we are right now) ?”
79:11: “Even after we have become hollow, decayed bones?”
79:12: They say: “That then, (if true) , would be a losing return. (or: That then, is a false, futile return, because it is impossible) .”
79:13: Indeed, it— (the second blowing) —will be but a single cry.
79:14: Then, behold, (after being buried in the earth) they will be (brought back to life) standing on (its) surface.
79:15: Has there (not) come to you (already) (O Muḥammad) the story of Moses?
79:16: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā.
79:17: “Go to Firʿaun, indeed he has transgressed (limits in haughtiness, arrogance, disbelief and sin) .”
79:18: “And say to him: ‘Would you (wish to) purify yourself (by declaring none is worthy of worship but Allāh and rectifying your deeds) ?’.”
79:19: “And (would you wish) for me to guide you to your Lord (by teaching you pure monotheism) so that you (may) fear him?”
79:20: Then (after Firʿaun’s rejection of Moses’ invitation by way of dialogue and reason) he (Moses) showed him the greatest sign (of the staff and hand) .
79:21: But Firʿaun denied (that these signs were from Allāh) and disobeyed (the command of Moses to worship and obey Allāh) .
79:22: Then he turned his back (from accepting the truth) , striving hard (against it, causing corruption in the land) .
79:23: Then he gathered (his people and his army) and called out (to them) .
79:24: And he said: “I am your Lord, the Most High.”
79:25: So Allāh seized him with an exemplary punishment (of Hellfire) for the latter (statement, ‘I am your Lord, the Most High’) and (of drowning for) the former (statement, decades earlier, ‘I know of no other deity for you besides me’) .
79:26: Verily, in that— (the wicked deed of Firʿaun and his punishment in this life and the next) —is an exemplary warning for whoever fears Allāh.
79:27: Are you more difficult to create (whether for the first time or after your death) or is the heaven (more difficult) ? He constructed it (over the earth) .
79:28: He elevated its ceiling (without any pillars) and proportioned it to perfection (without any rifts, splits, or defects) .
79:29: And He darkened its night (so that all the earth would experience darkness from above) and extracted (from it) its brightness (by way of the sun and daytime, to facilitate livelihood) .
79:30: And after that, He spread out the earth.
79:31: He brought out of it, its water (as springs and rivers) and its vegetation.
79:32: And the mountains He fixed (into the earth) firmly (to keep it stable for you) .
79:33: (All) as beneficial provision for you and your livestock.
79:34: But when the Greatest Calamity will come (that of the Day of Resurrection, Reckoning and Recompense) .
79:35: The Day when man will remember all that he strove for (of deeds, good and evil) .
79:36: And Hellfire will be made apparent (in full view) for everyone who sees (both the believer and the disbeliever) .
79:37: Then as for he who transgressed (through disbelief, polytheism, oppression or sin) .
79:38: And preferred the life of the world (over working for the hereafter) .
79:39: Then indeed, Hellfire will be the abode (for him) .
79:40: But as for he who feared standing before his Lord and restrained his soul from the desire (of lusts, passions and deviations) .
79:41: Then verily, Paradise will be the abode (for him) .
79:42: They (the Pagans of Mecca) ask you (O Muḥammad) about the (Final) Hour, when will it be established?
79:43: In what (position) are you (or: of what benefit is it for you) to mention it (to them) . (Rather, the benefit lies in it being hidden from mankind) .
79:44: To your Lord belongs (all) knowledge of it (and thus, it is said, ‘Allāh knows best’ regarding it) .
79:45: Verily, you are only a warner for he who (benefits from being reminded of the Hour and) fears it.
79:46: It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained (in the world) except for an afternoon (of a day) or its morning.
80:1: He (the Prophet) frowned and turned (his face) away.
80:2: Because there came to him the blind man (ʿAbd Allāh bin Umm Maktūm) (who interrupted his dialogue with the nobles of Quraysh about Islām) .
80:3: And what would inform you (O Muḥammad) that perhaps he might be purified (by being taught knowledge) .
80:4: Or that he might receive admonition so that the reminder benefits him (and he purifies himself of sins) .
80:5: As for he (from those Pagan Quraysh) who considers himself self-sufficient (from his Lord) (and does not seek guidance) .
80:6: To him you advance (and give him attention) .
80:7: Though it matters not to you (and nor would you be blamed) that he should not become purified (of his polytheism, disbelief and sin) (because your duty is only to convey to the hearts, not guide them) .
80:8: But as for he who came to you striving (in pursuit of knowledge and guidance) .
80:10: From him you divert your attention and preoccupy yourself (with others) .
80:11: No (do not do this again) ! Indeed, these (verses of this Qurʾān) are a reminder (in which there is admonition) .
80:12: So whoever wills to remember (this admonition and act upon it) will do so.
80:13: (This admonition is) in Scrolls (of record) held in honour (with Allāh) .
80:14: Raised high (in their status and in their location, the seventh heaven) , purified (touched by none except the pure) .
80:15: Carried by the hands of angel scribes (or: angel messengers) .
80:16: (Who are) noble and dutiful (which means being truthful, obedient and pure) (these being the qualities to be emulated by those who learn and memorise the Qurʾān) .
80:17: Cursed be (the disbelieving) man, how ungrateful he is (for Allāh’s innumerable favours) (or: what made him choose disbelief and become ungrateful?) .
80:18: From what thing did He create him (such that he becomes so arrogant) ?
80:19: He created him out of a small amount of (despised, ejected) fluid and then gave him his (pre-determined bodily) form with due proportion (in numerous stages) .
80:20: Then He made the passage (of birth) easy for him (or: made easy for him to acquire knowledge of the path of good and evil) (or: made easy for him the path to his destination, Paradise or Hellfire) .
80:21: Then He causes him to die and places him in a grave (saving him from rotting on earth and from being eaten, as an honour for him, having inspired the son of Adam to do so) .
80:22: Then, when He wills, He will resurrect him (to his original, fully developed form) .
80:23: No (the affair is not as the disbeliever presumes) ! But (man) has not done what He commanded him (of obligations) (except little) .
80:24: Then let man— (after remembering his lowly origins and shortfall in gratitude) — (now) look at his food (which keeps him alive after birth) .
80:25: (In that) we pour down rainwater in abundance (from whence his provision comes) :
80:26: Then We split open the earth into clefts (into which the water flows and settles) (or: out of which plants grow) .
80:27: And cause to grow therein grain.
80:28: And grapes and herbage (as fodder for cattle) .
80:30: And gardens, dense (with trees and shrubbery) .
80:31: And (every type of) fruit and grass.
80:32: As beneficial provision and enjoyment for you and your livestock.
80:33: So when there comes the Deafening Blast (of the Day of Resurrection, when the Trumpet is blown a second time) .
80:34: (That will be) the Day a man will flee from his brother.
80:35: And (from) his mother and his father.
80:36: And (from) his wife and his children (fearing that all those mentioned might see his dire situation) (or: fearing that they will seek compensation and justice for his wrongs) (or: knowing that they cannot help him at all) .
80:37: For every man among them, that Day, will be enough (distress about his situation) to preoccupy him (from his family and relatives) .
80:38: Some faces, that Day, will be bright (and beautiful) .
80:39: Laughing (with joy) , delighted with the good news (of entering Paradise and receiving its bliss) .
80:40: And (other) faces, that Day, will be stained with dust.
80:42: Those (with this evil outcome) are the disbelievers (in Allāh and His Messengers) , the wicked (who fabricated lies against Allāh’s religion and committed evil deeds) .
81:1: When the sun will be coiled up (and lose its light) .
81:2: And when the stars will fall down (and scatter) .
81:3: And when the mountains will be swept away (from their places, having being turned to dust) .
81:4: And when the pregnant she-camels (that reach full-term) will be left idle, without care.
81:5: And when the wild beasts will be gathered together (for retribution to take place between them, before they are turned to dust) .
81:6: And when the oceans will be kindled ablaze (after having merged together) .
81:7: And when the (various categories of) souls will be paired together (on the basis of their actions in this world) (or: when the souls are returned to their bodies) .
81:8: And when the female newborn (who was) buried alive will be asked.
81:9: For what sin she was killed.
81:10: And when the scrolls (of the good and bad deeds of every person as recorded by the angels) will be spread open.
81:11: And when the heaven will be torn out (from its place) .
81:12: And when the Hellfire will be kindled ablaze (its burning rage reflecting the sins of mankind and Allāh’s anger) .
81:13: And when Paradise will be brought near (for the pious) .
81:14: (When these events have taken place) then will every soul know what it has brought (of good and evil for this Day) .
81:15: So I swear by the retreating celestial bodies (the Sun, Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter and Saturn, which lag behind the stars in their motion) .
81:16: (All of which) — (including the stars) —run their courses (from east to west) and disappear (from view) .
81:17: And by the (darkness of the) night when it comes and goes.
81:18: And by the dawn when it appears and emits (brightness until it becomes day) .
81:19: Indeed— (by all these phenomena which you observe) —(this Qurʾān) is certainly the speech of (Gabriel) a noble messenger.
81:20: Owner of (tremendous) power, of exalted rank, in the presence of (Allāh) the Owner of the Throne.
81:21: (Who is) obeyed there (by the Angels in the heavens above) , trustworthy (in conveying revelation and in all things entrusted to him) .
81:22: And (O people) , your companion (Muḥammad) is not mad.
81:23: And he (Muḥammad) has already seen (Gabriel) in the clear horizon (towards the east) .
81:24: And he (Muḥammad) does not withhold (or: lie about) the unseen (which is the revelation revealed to him, the Qurʾān. Rather, he conveys and teaches all of it) .
81:25: And it is not the word of a devil outcast (Satan) (being neither poetry nor divination) .
81:26: So (to) where are you going (by turning away from this Qurʾān and its truth, guidance and healing) ?
81:27: It is no less than a reminder to all the worlds (of Men and Jinn) .
81:28: For whoever among you wills to be upright (in following the path of truth) .
81:29: And you do not will (anything) unless (it be) that Allāh wills, the Lord of the Worlds.
82:2: And when the stars scatter as they fall.
82:3: And when the oceans are made to gush forth— (merging into each other) —and dry out.
82:4: And when the graves are overturned (and expel their occupants) .
82:5: (Then) (every) soul will know what it has sent forth (➀ of good or evil deeds) (or: ➁ of charity) (or: ➂ of righteous deeds) and what it has left behind (➀ of ways of good or evil that others followed) (or: ➁ of inheritance) (or: ➂ of righteous deeds it neglected and wasted) .
82:6: O man! What has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Abundantly Generous One (such that you disbelieved in Him) ?
82:7: Who created you, shaped you (in your mother’s womb) and proportioned you (with the best balance) .
82:8: In whatever form He willed to produce you (so be grateful that He did not give you the form of a dog, donkey or swine, but rather honoured you over His other creatures) .
82:9: No (O disbeliever, the affair is not as you presume it to be, that your worship of others is true, just and correct) ! But you deny the (Day of) Reckoning and Recompense.
82:10: And indeed, (appointed) over you are (angels) that certainly observe you (and all that you do) .
82:11: Noble (with Allāh) , (accurately) recording (your statements and deeds) .
82:12: They know whatever you do (so respect and honour them by avoiding all that is shameful, repugnant and evil) .
82:13: Indeed, the pious (who feared Allāh, obeyed Him and shunned evil) will be in (eternal) pleasure (in Paradise) .
82:14: And indeed, the wicked (disbelievers, oppressors and sinners) will be in a blazing fire (of Hell) .
82:15: They will (enter and) taste its (heat and flames) on the Day of Reckoning and Recompense.
82:16: And never (for any moment) will they be absent therefrom (neither by exiting it, nor by dying within it) .
82:17: And what will inform you what is the Day of Reckoning and Recompense?
82:18: Again, what will inform you what is the Day of Reckoning and Recompense?
82:19: It is the Day when a soul will not have any power (to do anything) for any other soul. And the affair will (only) be with Allāh (with none to contend with Him) .
83:1: Woe to those who (deceptively) give less (than full weight or measure) (in trading goods) (or: fulfilling rights) (or: in acts of worship) .
83:2: Those who, when they are to receive (something) by measure from people, demand full measure (or more) .
83:3: But when they have to give to them by measure or by weight, they give less than (what is) due.
83:4: Do they (who engage in such deception and fraud) not think that they will be resurrected.
83:6: The Day when mankind will (arise from their graves and) stand before the Lord of the Worlds?
83:7: No!— (Their actions of dishonesty, and their denial of resurrection and accountability, this is not how the affair is) —Indeed, the record of (the deeds of) the wicked is in (a place called) Sijjīn.
83:8: And what will inform you (O Muḥammad) what is Sijjīn?
83:9: It is (their destination—a prison, in the lowest of earths and the narrowest of places— as recorded) in a Register inscribed.
83:10: Woe, that Day, (of justified punishment and ruin) to the deniers.
83:11: Those who deny the Day of Reckoning and Recompense.
83:12: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor (who goes beyond bounds in disbelief, oppression and disobedience to his Lord) .
83:13: When Our verses (from this Qurʾān) are recited to him, he says: “Tales of the ancients!”
83:14: No (the affair is not as they presume, it is Allāh’s Speech and Revelation to His Prophet) ! Rather, what they used to earn (of evil deeds) has covered their hearts with a stain (which prevents them from recognising and desiring the truth) .
83:15: No (the affair is not as they presume) ! Indeed, they, from (seeing) their Lord, that Day, will be veiled.
83:16: Then indeed, they will surely (enter) and taste (the heat and flames of) Hellfire.
83:17: Then it will be said (to them) : “This (punishment) is what you used to deny (when you would mock Allāh’s Messengers) !”
83:18: No (the affair is not as they presume) ! Indeed, the record of (the deeds of) the righteous (who fulfil their obligations and avoid the prohibitions) is in ʿIlliyyūn (above the seven heavens, in Paradise, by the Throne) .
83:19: And what will inform you (O Muḥammad) what is ʿIlliyyūn?
83:20: (It is the highest of places, in the seventh heaven, in which there is) a Record inscribed (mentioning their righteous deeds and their rewards) .
83:21: (Which is) witnessed by those (Angels) brought near (to Allāh).
83:22: Indeed, the pious (who feared Allāh, obeyed Him and shunned evil) will be in (eternal) pleasure (in Paradise) .
83:23: On (raised, adorned) thrones, looking (at their dominion and reward) (or: at the Face of Allāh, in contrast to the disbelievers, who were veiled from Him and are being punished) .
83:24: You will recognise in their faces the radiance of pleasure (and the happiness which fills their hearts) .
83:25: They will be given to drink from a pure (wholesome) wine, (which had been) sealed (so none has ever touched it) .
83:26: Its remnant is (the smell of) musk (or: its residue is musk) (or: its outcome is musk) . And for this (reward) then let those who compete, compete with each other (by hastening to piety and righteousness) .
83:27: And (what will be added to this wine as) its mixture (which will flow down from above them into their cups) is from (the spring of) Tasnīm.
83:28: A spring (of Paradise) from which those brought near to Allāh (for being foremost in righteousness) will drink.
83:29: Verily, those (heads and elites from the Pagan Quraysh) who committed crimes (of polytheism and disbelief) used to laugh at those (poor and weak ones) who believed (in pure monotheism) .
83:30: And whenever they passed by them, they would wink at one another (in mockery and belittlement) .
83:31: And when they returned to their own people (in their homes and gatherings) , they would return delighted (and impressed with what they were upon of disbelief and polytheism, considering it to be better guidance) .
83:32: And when they saw them, they would say: “Indeed, these ones— (the Prophet’s Companions) —are truly astray (for not being upon our way) .”
83:33: But they (the disbelievers) had not been sent over them (the believers) as watchers (to observe and record whatever they do and say, rather they were commanded to worship Allāh alone and obey Him) .
83:34: So (on) this Day (of Resurrection) , those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers.
83:35: (Seated) on (raised, adorned) thrones, looking (down at how the disbelievers are being punished in the very Hellfire they used to deny and mock) .
83:36: Have the disbelievers not been recompensed in full for what they used to do (of derision and mockery of the believers, which they added to their disbelief in Allāh, His Prophet and His message) ?
84:1: When the sky has split open.
84:2: And hears (and obeys) its Lord, and it must do so.
84:3: And when the earth is stretched out (and made level) .
84:4: And has cast out whatever was in it (of the dead, and of treasures and resources) and became empty.
84:5: And hears (and obeys) its Lord, and it must do so.
84:6: O man, verily, you are labouring (with your deeds) towards your Lord with a sure return (to Him) , and then you will meet Him (with your deeds, good or evil) .
84:7: Then as for he (the believer) who is given his record (of deeds) in his right hand.
84:8: Then he shall be reckoned (with) an easy reckoning (without scrutiny and examination) .
84:9: And return to his family (who already entered Paradise before him) (or: the Ḥūrī wives of Paradise) with joy .
84:10: But as for he who is given his record (of deeds) (in his left hand) behind his back (for having turned his back on the Qurʾān in the life of the world) .
84:11: Then he will invoke destruction (upon himself) (to escape disgrace, humiliation and punishment) .
84:12: And shall taste (the burning of) a Blazing Fire.
84:13: Indeed, (in the world) he used to be among his people with happiness (enjoying pastimes and pleasures, oblivious and unconcerned about the hereafter) .
84:14: Indeed, he thought that he would never return (back to us to be judged and rewarded or punished) .
84:15: But (it is not as he thought) ! Verily, his Lord was ever watchful of him (from the day of his creation to the day of his resurrection) .
84:16: So I swear by the reddish afterglow of sunset.
84:17: And (by) the night and what it covers and gathers (in its darkness) (of creatures returning to their abodes) .
84:18: And (by) the moon when it becomes full (in its light and its roundness) .
84:19: You shall certainly transition (O man, as you labour towards your Lord) from state to state (from embryo to newborn, then infancy, then youth, then maturity then old age, from life to death, from this world to the hereafter, from sufficiency to need and vice versa, from health to sickness and vice versa) (this being proof that you indeed have a Lord and that He alone is worthy of worship) .
84:20: So what is (the matter) with them (that) they do not believe (in this Qurʾān and its message, and in the resurrection and reckoning) ?
84:21: And (what is with them that) when the Qurʾān is recited to them, they do not prostrate (in prayer) .
84:22: But those who disbelieve reject (Muḥammad and the truth he has brought, after it has become clear to them) .
84:23: And Allāh is most-knowing of what (intentions and motives) they conceal (and what actions they do in private) .
84:24: So announce to them tidings of a painful punishment (that has already been prepared for them) .
84:25: But those who believe (in pure monotheism, messengership and resurrection) and work righteous deeds (with sincerity) , for them will be an unending reward.
85:1: By the sky possessing stars (or: stations) (across which the sun and moon move in their orbits) .
85:3: And (by) (everything that serves as) the witness (on that Day) and (everything that is) the witnessed (on that Day) .
85:4: Cursed were the People of the Ditch...
85:5: ... (The large ditch with) the fire, given fuel (in abundance) .
85:6: While they were sat over it (watching those whom they punished by burning) .
85:7: And they, to what they were doing against the believers (of forcing them to abandon their religion and burning them to death if they refused) , were witnesses.
85:8: And they despised them not (for any reason) except that they believed in Allāh, the all-Mighty, the all-Praiseworthy.
85:9: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh is over all things a witness (seeing the actions of all His servants) .
85:10: Verily, those who put believing men and believing women to trial (in their religion) (and torture and burn them) , and then do not repent, for them is the punishment of Hellfire (for their disbelief) , and for them is the punishment of a burning Fire (for burning the believers) .
85:11: Verily, those who believe (in pure monotheism) and work righteous deeds (with sincerity) , they will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great success.
85:12: Verily, (O Muḥammad) , the vengeful seizure of your Lord (against the criminals) is indeed severe.
85:13: Verily, it is He who begins (punishment of the disbelievers in this life) and repeats (it again, in the hereafter) (or: originates creation and then repeats it on the Day of Resurrection) .
85:14: And He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Loving (towards his believing servants, Who is loved by them) .
85:15: Owner of Throne, the Glorious One (or: Owner of the Glorious Throne) .
85:16: Doer of whatever He wishes (with none to hinder or stop Him) .
85:17: Has the story reached you (O Muḥammad) of the (disbelieving) hosts (who gathered against their messengers) ?
85:19: But those who disbelieve (from your people O Muḥammad, the Pagans of Quraysh, and the People of the Scripture and others) are in denial (of you and the Qurʾān, just like those nations before them were in denial) .
85:20: And Allāh, from behind them, is all-encompassing (of them and their deeds, and is able to punish them as He punished those before them) .
85:21: But (rather) , this is a Glorious Qurʾān (full of guidance, honour and blessing for those who follow it) .
85:22: (Inscribed) in a Preserved Tablet (protected from alteration) .
86:1: By the heaven and the star (that arrives by night) .
86:2: And what will make you know what is the star (that arrives by night) ?
86:3: It is (every) piercingly bright star (that ascends to the highest part of the sky) .
86:4: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector (from the angels, who watches over its sustenance, deeds and lifespan, till its appointed time of death) .
86:5: So let man observe (the baseness of) that from which he was created.
86:6: He was created from a fluid emitted.
86:7: Emerging from between the backbone and the (lower) ribs.
86:8: Indeed, He— (who produced man through such means) — is certainly able to bring him back (to life) (on the Day of Resurrection) .
86:9: The Day when the secrets (of the hearts, their motives and intentions and deeds done in concealment) will be examined.
86:10: Then will (man) have no power (of his own to repel punishment) , nor any helper (to aid him) .
86:11: By the sky (that has rain-clouds) , bringing rain, again and again (or: stars, which return every night, again and again) .
86:12: And (by) the earth, having clefts (on a large scale, which form pathways for rivers, grazing animals and travel) (or: on a small scale, out of which trees and plants emerge) .
86:13: Verily, it (the Qurʾān) is a decisive word (of justice) that (separates truth from falsehood, ends disputes between all factions, and ends oppression and evil through its laws) .
86:14: And it is not (a thing that has come for) amusement (or falsehood) .
86:15: Indeed, they (the pagan disbelievers of Quraysh) are scheming a plot (against you O Muḥammad, to kill you) .
86:16: But I (too) am scheming a plot (against them) .
86:17: So give respite to the disbelievers. Leave them for a while (and wait, without haste, for the punishment that awaits them) .
87:1: Glorify the name of your Lord, the Most High (from that any besides Him should be called by His name) .
87:2: Who created (all things) and proportioned (every creature in the best of forms) .
87:3: And who determined (for every type of creature its abode, sustenance, and means of reproduction) and then guided (it to its instinct and behaviour) .
87:4: And who brings out the (various types of) pasture (upon which animals graze) .
87:5: And then He turns it into dark, dry stubble.
87:6: We will make you recite (and memorise this Qurʾān, O Muḥammad) , so that you do not forget (it) (or: so that you do not neglect acting upon it) .
87:7: Except what Allāh may will (to abrogate from it) . Indeed, He knows what is apparent (of speech and action) and what is hidden. (Or: Indeed, He knows what you, O Muḥammad, know of the Qurʾān already, and what is yet to be taught to you) .
87:8: And We will make easy for you (O Muḥammad) , the easy path (to doing good deeds and entering Paradise) .
87:9: So remind (the people with this Qurʾān) , where reminder (will) benefit (them) .
87:10: (For) he will receive reminder (and take admonition) who fears Allāh.
87:11: But the one who is (decreed to be) wretched (in Allāh’s prior knowledge) will avoid it (by choosing disbelief) (and thus become wretched) .
87:12: (He is the one) who will burn in the greatest (and most intense part of the) Fire.
87:13: Thereafter, he will neither die therein (such that he is relieved) nor live (with a life that is of any benefit to him) .
87:14: He shall achieve success who purifies himself (from polytheism, disbelief and sin) .
87:15: And mentions (only) the name of his Lord (in his invocation) and then prays (the five daily prayers) .
87:16: But you (O Mankind) give preference to the life of the world.
87:17: Though the hereafter is better (for the believer) and is more lasting.
87:18: Verily, this— (what has been mentioned in the previous four verses) —is in the former scriptures.
87:19: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
88:1: Has there come to you (O Muḥammad) the report of the Overwhelming Event (of the Day of Resurrection) (which will envelope people with terrors and hardships) (or: envelope the faces of the disbelievers with punishment and disgrace) ?
88:2: Some faces, that Day, will be humiliated (their works being of no benefit to them) .
88:3: Labouring hard (in worshipping others besides Allāh in the life of the world) (or: in Hellfire) , exhausted (with disbelief and sin) (or: exhausted with punishment and disgrace in Hellfire) .
88:4: They will burn (in) an intensely hot, blazing fire (whose heat and rage never dissipates) .
88:5: They will be given to drink from a boiling hot spring (that has reached the peak of intensity in heat) .
88:6: There will be no food for them (when they seek relief from extreme hunger) except from a vile, poisonous, thorny plant.
88:7: Which neither nourishes nor avails from hunger.
88:8: (Other) faces, that Day, will be joyful.
88:9: Pleased (with the reward of Paradise, given to them) for their striving (in the world upon righteousness) .
88:10: In an elevated garden (of Paradise) (above the seven heavens) .
88:11: Wherein they will hear no false, vain, speech.
88:12: Within it are (various types of) flowing spring(s) (each providing a delicious drink) .
88:13: Within it are thrones raised high (from which one’s dominion and reward in Paradise can be seen) .
88:14: And cups placed (by their sides) (or: by the sides of flowing springs) (for them to drink from at will) .
88:16: And soft, rich carpets, spread out.
88:17: Do they (who reject Allāh’s power to create and resurrect) not look at the camels (from which they derive food, drink and transport) —how they have been created?
88:18: And at the sky, how it has been raised (over the earth without any pillars to hold it) ?
88:19: And at the mountains, how they have been fixed (into the earth) (holding it firm and still) ?
88:20: And at the earth, how it has been spread out (to facilitate habitation and travel) ?
88:21: So remind (them O Muḥammad, by conveying this Qurʾān, its signs and evidences) , for you are only one who reminds.
88:22: You are not a dictator over them (to compel them to faith) .
88:23: However (or: except) , the one who turns away (after being reminded) and disbelieves...
88:24: ...Then Allāh will punish him (for his disbelief) with the greatest punishment (in the hereafter, which is eternity in Hellfire) (after punishing him in the world) .
88:25: Indeed, to Us is their return (after death) .
88:26: Then indeed, upon Us is their reckoning.
89:1: By the dawn (of the first day of Dhū al-Ḥijjah) (or: the dawn prayer) .
89:2: And (by) ten nights (of the beginning of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the month of pilgrimage) (or: of the end of Ramaḍān, the month of fasting) .
89:3: And (by) the even and the odd (the 10th and 9th days of Dhū al-Ḥijjah, the Day of Sacrifice and the Day of ʿArafah) (or: the four daily prayers with even units and the sunset prayer with odd units) (or: whatever exists as a pair in creation and Allāh, Who is the One, the Unique) .
89:4: And (by) the night (of Muzdalifah where the pilgrims gather) (or: the night in general) when it passes over (bringing serenity, calm and rest to creatures) .
89:5: Indeed, there is within that (collection of oaths) sufficient evidence for the possessor of intellect, erudition and understanding.
89:6: Have you not considered (O Muḥammad) how your Lord dealt with (the first nation of) ʿĀd?
89:7: (The Tribe of) ʾIram, endued with tallness and strength.
89:8: The likes of (whose city) (or: whose physique) had never been created in the lands?
89:9: And (how your Lord dealt with) Thamūd, those who carved out rocks in the valley (to make dwellings) ?
89:10: And Firʿaun, the owner of (metal or wooden) pegs (to which he would bind people for torture) .
89:11: Who all went beyond bounds (with their disbelief and oppression) in the lands (misguiding and harming others) .
89:12: And they made much corruption therein (through their disbelief and its branches of sin) .
89:13: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge (among His scourges) of punishment.
89:14: Verily, your Lord is ever-watchful (over His servants and their deeds) (or: waiting in ambush for the criminals and oppressors) .
89:15: So as for (the trait of the polytheist) man (who has no conviction in the resurrection and the Hereafter) , when His Lord tries him by being generous to him and favouring him (with wealth and increase) , then he says (with joy and pride) : “My Lord has honoured me” (without praising and thanking Him) .
89:16: But when He tries him and restricts his provision (to the bare necessities) , he says: “My Lord has humiliated me” (without appreciating his soundness of health and the little he has been given) .
89:17: No! (Both these claims are rejected, you were not honoured with riches, nor humiliated with poverty. Rather, you were put to trial) . But (despite Allāh’s favours upon you) you do not honour the orphan.
89:18: And nor do you encourage one another to feed the poor person.
89:19: And you devour the inheritance (in its entirety, whether lawful or unlawful) with severe greed (and leave nothing of it for women and children) .
89:20: And you love wealth with immense, severe love.
89:21: No! (This is not how you engage with wealth) . When the Earth has been (repeatedly) crushed and levelled (into a smooth plain) .
89:22: And your Lord has come, and the Angels (from each heaven) , rank upon rank.
89:23: And on that day, Hellfire will be brought close (into view, carried by the Angels) . That day, man will remember (by feeling remorseful and repentant for neglecting his duty to his Lord) , but how will that remembrance benefit and avail him?
89:24: He will say: “Alas! I wish I had sent forth (good deeds) for (this never-ending) life of mine (in the hereafter) ”.
89:25: So on that day, none will have punished (in the world) with the (severity) of His punishment (upon this disbeliever) (or: none will be have been punished in the world, as this disbeliever is to be punished) .
89:26: And none will have bound (anyone in the world) with the severity of His binding (upon this disbeliever) (or: none will be have been bound in the world, as this disbeliever is to be bound) .
89:27: (The Angels will say to the pious when taking their souls at death) : “O you, the soul (that was) convinced, reassured and satisfied (with servitude to Allāh and His promise of reward) ...”
89:28: “... Return to your Lord (while you are) well-pleased (with Him and His reward) , and well-pleasing (are you to Him) .”
89:29: Then (on the Day of Judgement, it will be said) : “Enter among My (honoured) servants.”
90:1: No (O man! The affair is not as you presume that you will not be resurrected) . I do swear by this city (of Mecca) (in which you reside O Muḥammad) .
90:2: And you are free and without blame with regards to (how you mete out justice to the oppressing polytheists of) this city (after you are expelled from it and then conquer it) .
90:3: And (by) the father (Ādam) and what he fathered (of progeny) .
90:4: We have certainly created man into hardship (from his birth to his death) (which is evidence that he has a Lord) .
90:5: Does he think that (on account of his strength) none will ever overcome him?
90:6: He says (in boast): “I have squandered wealth in abundance (to hinder Muḥammad’s message) .”
90:7: Does he think that no one has seen him (such that he will not be held to account for how he acquired and spent his wealth) ?
90:8: Have we not made for him two eyes (with which he sees) ?
90:9: And a tongue (with which he speaks) and two lips (which aid him in speech and consuming his food) ?
90:10: And have shown him the two ways (of good and evil) (or: guidance and misguidance) ?
90:11: But (despite this) he has not embarked boldly (in striving to pass) over the steep path (to prove his sincerity and earn his deliverance) .
90:12: And what will make you know (O Muḥammad) (the way to pass over) the steep path (so you can teach it to others) ?
90:13: (It is) the freeing of a slave.
90:14: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger...
90:16: ... Or a needy person afflicted with (the) misery (of poverty, hunger or debt) .
90:17: And (alongside these righteous deeds) he was of those who believe (in pure monotheism, messengership and resurrection) , work righteous deeds, advise one another with patience (amid difficulties and harms) and advise one another to show mercy (to others) .
90:18: Those are the Companions of the Right Hand (the dwellers of Paradise who are given their record of deeds in their right hands) .
90:19: And those who disbelieve in Our signs (this Qurʾān and all its evidences) , they are the Companions of the Left Hand (the dwellers of Hellfire who are given their record of deeds in their left hands) .
90:20: Over them will be a fire, made to surround and lock them in (without any light, opening or escape) .
91:1: By the sun and its (warm) brightness (when it rises) .
91:2: And (by) the moon, when it follows (the sun) (during the first half of the month) .
91:3: And (by) the day when it displays (the sun and its brightness) .
91:4: And (by) the night, when it conceals (the sun and its brightness) .
91:5: And (by) the heaven and its construction (or: He who constructed it) .
91:6: And (by) the earth, and He who spread it out (as a vast expanse) .
91:7: And (by) the soul (the person of Ādam) (or: all Jinn and Men) and how He proportioned it (with harmony and gave it its natural inclination) .
91:8: And then inspired it with (knowledge of good and evil so that it knows) its (deeds) sinfulness and its (deeds of) piety.
91:9: (By the preceding seven mighty oaths) , he will have succeeded who purified it (from sins) .
91:10: And he will have failed who corrupted it (with disbelief, polytheism, sin and disobedience) .
91:11: (The people of) Thamūd rejected (their prophet) by way of their transgression.
91:12: When the most wicked man among them was sent forth (to kill the she-camel) .
91:13: So the Messenger of Allāh— (Ṣāliḥ) —said to them: “ (Do not harm) the she-camel of Allāh and (nor prevent her from) her drink.
91:14: But they rejected him (and his warning of punishment) and killed her. So their Lord gave them over to destruction because of their sin and brought it upon all of them equally.
91:15: And He feared not the consequence (of destroying them) (or: he—the one sent forth to kill her—feared not the consequence of his wicked deed) (or: he—the Prophet Ṣāliḥ—feared not the consequence of his people’s rejection and harm) .
92:1: By the (phenomenon of) the night, when it covers (the day and all creatures therein with its darkness) .
92:2: And (by) the day, when it appears (and reveals what was hidden by the night) .
92:3: And (by) Him Who created the male (Ādam) and the female (Eve) .
92:4: Indeed, your striving is (for) diverse (motives, aims, causes and purposes) .
92:5: As for him— (Abu Bakr) —who gives (in charity) and fearfully keeps his duty (to Allāh) .
92:6: And believes in al-Ḥusnā (the statement of monotheism) (or: the obligations of prayer, fasting and charity) (or: the promise of Allāh) (or: Paradise and its reward) .
92:7: Then We will make easy for him (the path to) (further) righteousness (or: to Paradise) .
92:8: But as for he— ( Umayyah bin Khalaf) —who is miserly (with respect to his wealth and Allāh’s right upon him) and considers himself self-sufficient (from his Lord) .
92:9: And rejects al-Ḥusnā (the statement of monotheism) (or: the obligations of prayer, fasting and charity) (or: the promise of Allāh) (or: Paradise and its reward) .
92:10: Then We will make easy for him (the path to) evil (or: Hellfire) .
92:11: And what will his wealth avail him when he perishes (or: falls into Hellfire) ?
92:12: Indeed, upon Us is (to explain) the (path of) guidance (from the path of misguidance) .
92:13: And indeed, to Us belongs (whatever is in) the Hereafter and the present (life of the world) .
92:14: So I have warned you (O inhabitants of Mecca and all others) of a Fire which blazes fiercely.
92:15: None shall (enter and) burn therein except the wretched one.
92:16: Who had rejected (My Signs and My Messenger) (with his heart) and turned away (from obedience) (with his limbs) .
92:17: But the pious one— (Abu Bakr) —will be far removed from it.
92:18: (The one) who gives his wealth (in freeing slaves and in obedience to his Lord) , (seeking) to be purified.
92:19: Without (there being) anyone who has done a favour to him for which recompense is expected.
92:20: But (he gives) only seeking (to see) the Face of his Lord, Most High (in Paradise) .
92:21: And he (and whoever is like him) will surely be pleased (when he enters Paradise) .
93:1: By the forenoon (when the sun has appeared) .
93:2: And by the night (when it approaches with its darkness, covers everything and becomes still) .
93:3: Your Lord (O Muḥammad) has not forsaken you (with His revelation) and nor hated you.
93:4: And certainly, the (life of the) Hereafter is better for you than the present (life of the world) .
93:5: And verily, your Lord is going to give to you (victory in this life and intercession in the next) , whereby you will be pleased.
93:6: Did He not find you (O Muḥammad) as an orphan and gave you shelter (with your grandfather and uncle) ?
93:7: And He found you unaware of (the Book and faith) and then guided you?
93:8: And He found you (in a state of) poverty and dependency (in which you remained patient) and then He made you become self-sufficient (so that you become grateful) .
93:9: So as for the orphan, do not withhold his right and oppress (him) (keeping in mind that you were also an orphan) .
93:10: And as for the beggar, do not repel him (keeping in mind that you were also poor) .
93:11: And as for the favour of your Lord (in granting you Prophethood, the Qurʾān and all other bounties) , then narrate it (to others) .
94:1: Have We not expanded for you (O Muḥammad) your chest (so that you can receive guidance, faith, truth and wisdom) ?
94:2: And removed from you your burden (of past errors, and of being in the days of ignorance, and of the heavy weight of prophethood) .
94:3: Which had weighed down (and weakened) your back?
94:4: And made lofty your mention (in the call to prayer, the sermons, the daily prayers and the various remembrances) ?
94:5: Then verily, with the hardship (of patiently calling to truth and repelling transgression) there is ease (in this life and Paradise in the next) .
94:6: Verily, with (that same) hardship there is (additional) ease.
94:7: So when you have finished (from your occupation) , then stand up (in prayer and supplication) .
94:8: And towards your Lord turn (all your intentions, hopes and aspirations) .
95:1: By the fig and the olive (which grow in the region inhabited by Jesus) .
95:2: And (by) Mount Sinai (upon which Moses received revelation) .
95:3: And (by) this secure city (of Mecca, whose security Abraham prayed for, and where Muḥammad received revelation) .
95:4: We have certainly created man in the best stature (in form, appearance, balance and strength, coupled with innate disposition, fiṭrah, and the power of reason) .
95:5: Then— (due to his disbelief and opposing his fiṭrah) —we return him to the lowest of the low (in physical location, the Hellfire) .
95:6: Except those who believe and work righteous deeds, for they— (due to their gratitude for being created in the best stature by worshipping Allāh alone and obeying Him) —will have an unending, continuous reward (in Paradise, in the afterlife) .
95:7: Then what (is it) (O disbelievers) that causes you to deny the Reckoning and Recompense (on the Day of Judgement) ?
95:8: Is not Allāh the most just of all judges (who will judge with perfect justice between His servants and never wrong them in anything) ?
96:1: Recite (what is being revealed to you, O Muḥammad) by (commencing with) the name of your Lord Who created (all things) .
96:2: He created man out of what clings (to the wall of the womb) .
96:3: Recite, and your Lord is the Most Generous (in providing for His servants while overlooking their disbelief, polytheism, sin and disobedience) .
96:4: (The One) Who taught (the art of writing) by the pen (to Prophet Idrīs, Enoch) .
96:5: He taught man— (Ādam) (or: each person) —that which he knew not (of the names of all things) (or: through the faculties of hearing, seeing and reflecting) .
96:6: But no! Indeed, man (due to his traits of ignorance and oppression) transgresses (the bounds) .
96:7: Because he considers himself— (on account of his property, vast riches, offspring and helpers) —to be self-sufficient (and independent of his Lord) .
96:8: (But he has forgotten that) indeed, to your Lord is the return (on the Day of Resurrection, wherein he will be accountable for the favours he enjoyed) .
96:9: Have you seen (Abu Jahl) , the one who forbids...
96:10: ... (Muḥammad) , a servant (of Allāh) , when he prays.
96:11: Have you considered (your situation, O Abu Jahl) if he, (Muḥammad) , is upon guidance.
96:13: Have you considered (O Muḥammad) if he— (Abu Jahl) —rejects (the truth, this Qurʾān) and turns away (from pure monotheism and righteous works) .
96:14: Does he not know that Allāh sees (him and whatever he does) ?
96:15: No! If he does not desist (from his transgression) , We shall surely drag him (in humiliation) by his forelock.
96:16: A forelock (given to) lying (in speech) and erring (in deed) .
96:17: Then let him call his associates (from his relatives and his helpers) .
96:18: We will call the (mighty, severe, stern) guardian Angels (of Hell to deal with him) !
96:19: No (O Muḥammad) ! Do not obey him (at all) , but prostrate (in prayer) and draw near (to Allāh through worship and obedience) .
97:1: Verily, We sent it— (the whole Qurʾān) —down (to the lowest heaven) during the Night of Decree (for it to be revealed piecemeal thereafter) .
97:2: And what will inform you what is the Night of Decree?
97:3: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
97:4: The Angels and the Spirit— (Gabriel) —descend therein by the permission of their Lord with (decrees) for every affair.
97:5: Peace it is (for Allāh’s believing servants) (or: as the salutation from the Angels to every believer they come across) , until the emergence of dawn.
98:1: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Book and the Polytheists were not going to be parted (from their disbelief and polytheism) until there came to them clear evidence.
98:2: (This being) a Messenger from Allāh, reciting pages purified (of all falsehood and containining all goodness) .
98:3: Within which are upright (truths contained in past) scriptures (and just laws and prescriptions) .
98:4: And those (Jews and Christians) who were given the Scripture (and were awaiting the arrival of a Messenger in Arabia) did not become divided (regarding the Messenger and his mention in their scriptures) until after the clear evidence— (this Messenger and this Qurʾān) —had come to them (so some believed and others disbelieved) .
98:5: And they were not commanded (in their scriptures) except to worship Allāh (alone) , being sincere to Him in religious devotion, being upright and inclined (to truth) and to establish the prayer and to give obligatory charity. And that is the upright, correct religion.
98:6: Indeed, those who disbelieved among the People of the Book and the Polytheists will be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein. They are the worst of creatures (in terms of their oppressive actions in the world and in terms of their situation and outcome in the Hereafter) .
98:7: Indeed, those who have believed and worked righteous deeds, they are the best of creatures.
98:8: Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of eternity beneath which rivers flow, they will abide therein forever. Allāh will be pleased with them and they will be pleased with Him. That (outcome) is for the one who fears his Lord.
99:1: When the (whole) earth is shaken violently with its (final) earthquake.
99:2: And the earth expels its burden (of dead bodies) .
99:3: And man will say: “What is the matter with it (that it shakes and expels its burden) (and for what reason does it do so) ?”
99:4: That day it will inform of its news (regarding the commencement of the Hour) (or: of the deeds of good and evil done upon it) .
99:5: Because your Lord (will have) commanded it (to report its news) .
99:6: That day, people will proceed in categories (of ‘believer’, ‘disbeliever’, ‘obedient’, ‘sinner’) that they may be shown their deeds.
99:7: So whoever worked (what equals even) an atom’s weight of good will (come to know it and) see it (in his scroll) .
99:8: And whoever worked (what equals even) an atom’s weight of evil will (come to know it and) see it (in his scroll) .
100:1: By the steeds (of war) that run with panting breath.
100:2: Striking sparks of fire (with their hooves) .
100:3: Making charge (against the enemy) at dawn.
100:5: (Altogether) penetrating right into the midst (of the enemy) .
100:6: Indeed man, to his Lord, is ungrateful, (unappreciative) .
100:7: And verily, He (Allāh) is indeed a witness over that (or: he—man—is a indeed witness to that by his own deeds) .
100:8: And indeed, in his love for wealth, he is certainly intense.
100:9: Does he not know that when (the occupants) of the graves are brought out (and raised again) .
100:10: And that which is in the breasts (of men) is made known.
100:11: That indeed, their Lord, that day, will be fully acquainted with them (and all that they did) .
101:1: The Terrifying Calamity (of the Day of Resurrection) .
101:3: And what will inform you what the Terrifying Calamity is?
101:4: (The Terrifying Calamity) will be on the Day (in which) people will be like moths, scattered around.
101:5: And the (dense, heavy) mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
101:6: Then as for the one whose scales (of good deeds) are heavy (outweighing his evil deeds) .
101:7: Then he will live a pleasant life (in Paradise) .
101:8: But as for the one whose scales (of good deeds) are light (being outweighed by his evil deeds) .
101:9: His abode will be a pit (of Hell) .
101:10: And what will inform you what it is?
101:11: It is an intensely hot, blazing Fire.
102:1: Mutual rivalry (and boasting) in accumulating (worldly possessions) diverts you (from fulfilling your duty to your Lord) .
102:2: (You continue in this heedlessness) until (when death comes to you) you will visit the graveyards (and the reality of the resurrection, reckoning and recompense will become apparent to you) .
102:3: No, (the affair is not as you presume) ! You will soon come to know (that which would have prevented you from being distracted by the world) !
102:4: Then again, no (the affair is not as you presume) ! You will soon come to know (that which would have prevented you from being distracted by the world) !
102:5: No! If only you knew (that which lies ahead of you) with sure knowledge (that settles firmly in the heart) ...
102:6: ... That you will surely see the Hellfire (then you would not have been distracted by the world) .
102:7: Then (again) you will surely see it (in front of you) with the eye of (absolute) certainty.
102:8: Then, indeed, you will be asked about (your gratefulness for) the pleasures (which had preoccupied you in this world) .
103:1: By (the phenomenon of) time (which Allah manifests through His creation of night and day and in which the servants perform their deeds) .
103:2: Indeed, (all of) mankind is in loss.
103:3: Except those who believe (in Allāh, His Angels, Books, Prophets, the Last Day and the Divine Decree) and work righteous deeds (which are sincere and correct) and mutually advise each other (in calling to and abiding by) the truth and mutually advise each other with patience (in facing the inevitable harms brought by calling to the truth) .
104:1: Woe— (of ruin and destruction) —to every scorner (who scorns people to their faces through speech or gestures of the body) and back-biting mocker (who slanders people when their backs are turned) .
104:2: (The one) who has gathered wealth and (continuously) counts it (whilst recording its types and forms) (without any desire to spend it for charitable cause) .
104:3: He thinks (due to his ignorance) that his wealth will make him abide forever (and thus he strives to accumulate more and more wealth) .
104:4: No (the reality is not as he thinks) ! He will surely be thrown into the Crushing Fire (that destroys everything) .
104:5: And what will inform you what the (reality of the) Crushing Fire is?
104:6: It is the fire of Allāh, kindled, ablaze, scorching (and ready to receive its fuel) .
104:7: (The fire) which envelopes and penetrates the hearts (to consume the effects and stains of disbelief and sin therein) .
104:8: Indeed, it will be made to surround and lock them in.
104:9: In extended columns (in which their necks and feet are shackled in preparation for a prolonged punishment) .
105:1: Have you not (been informed and) considered (O Muhammad) how your Lord dealt with the Companions of the Elephant (who plotted and embarked to destroy His Sanctified House) ?
105:2: Did He not make their plan (of killing and enslaving the Quraysh) (to falter) into misguided (failure) ?
105:3: And He sent against them (larger numbers of) birds in (successive) flocks.
105:4: Pelting them with stones of hardened clay.
105:5: And turned them (by way of this heavenly onslaught) as if like (an empty) field of stalks whose leaves (of grain) have been eaten (by cattle) .
106:1: (This destruction of the Companions of the Elephant) was My favour upon the Quraysh (for their preservation, unity and security) .
106:2: (For the protection of their) accustomed (trade) (in) their journey of winter (to the south) and of summer (to the north) .
106:3: Then— (for this great favour from Allāh) —let them (shun polytheism and) worship the Lord of this House (the Kaʿbah, built by Abraham and Ishmael) .
106:4: (The Lord) who (in responding to Abraham’s supplication) fed them against hunger (by facilitating trade for them) and secured them from fear (of harm) (by destroying their enemy) .
107:1: Have you seen (and considered) the one who denies the Recompense (on the Day of Resurrection) ?
107:2: For that is the (hard-hearted) one who drives away the orphan.
107:3: And who does not encourage others with the feeding of the poor (let alone feeding them himself) .
107:4: So woe be to those (hypocrites) who pray.
107:5: Those who are neglectful in their prayer, (by delaying it from its time, and not performing it with attention and humility) .
107:6: Those who (wish to be seen and praised by others) by making a display of their deeds.
107:7: And who withhold (even the smallest acts of) assistance and kindness (to neighbours, the needy and those who ask) .
108:1: Indeed, We have granted you, (O Muhammad) an abundance of goodness (inclusive of Prophethood, the Qurʾān, Islām and a large nation of followers in this life, and in the hereafter, the Ḥawḍ, a drinking pool, and Kawthar, a river in Paradise) .
108:2: So pray to your Lord (with gratitude by standing upright, raising the hands and then placing one hand over the other on the chest) and sacrifice (to Him alone) .
108:3: Indeed, your (abusive) enemy is the one to be cut off (from all goodness in this life and the next) .
109:2: I do not worship that which you worship (of false deities and fabricated conceptions of Allāh) .
109:3: Nor are you worshippers (at present) of what I worship— (Allāh, the only deity worthy of worship in truth) .
109:4: Nor will I (ever) be a worshipper (in the future) of what you have worshipped (of false deities and fabricated conceptions of Allāh) .
109:5: Nor are you worshippers (at present) of what I worship— (Allāh, the only deity worthy of worship in truth) .
109:6: To you is your religion, and to me is my religion.”
110:1: When Allāh’s help arrives (against the Pagans) and victory (in taking back Mecca has been achieved) .
110:2: And you see the people entering into Allāh’s religion (of Islām) in multitudes.
110:3: Then glorify the praise of your Lord (in abundance) and ask Him for forgiveness. Indeed, He has always been Tawwāb— (One Who guides His servants to repent and accepts their repentance, again and again) .
111:1: Perish the two hands of Abū Lahab (and remain void of any good) and may he (himself) perish (for his severe enmity and causing of harm to his nephew, the Prophet) .
111:2: His wealth (which We bestowed upon him) and the children he sired (or the evil deeds he earned in harming the Prophet) will avail him nothing.
111:3: He will (die upon disbelief and) burn in a Fire of blazing flame.
111:4: And his wife (as well) , the carrier of splinters of firewood (which she would place in order to harm the Prophet) (or: the tale-bearing slanderer) .
111:5: Around her neck (in the Fire) will be a rope of (twisted) fibre (this being the burden of her disbelief and harm) .
112:1: Say (with a firm, resolute statement) : “He is Allāh, (who is) uniquely One (in His perfect names, attributes, actions and His right to worship) .
112:2: Allāh, the Eternal, Self-Sufficient Master (of utmost perfection in His attributes, to whom all creatures turn for their needs whilst He has none) .
112:3: He did not beget (such that He became a father) nor was He begotten (such that He became a son) .
112:4: And there is none equal, similar or comparable to Him (in His perfect names, attributes and actions) .”
113:1: Say: “I seek refuge (with Allāh) the Lord of the daybreak.
113:2: From (every) evil (present) in whatever He has created.
113:3: And from the evils (and harms) lurking in the darkness (of night) when it comes and settles.
113:4: And from the evil of the (practitioners of sorcery) who blow in knots (to cast their spells) .
113:5: And from the evil (effects of the envy) of an envious one when he envies.”
114:1: Say: “I seek refuge with (Allāh) the Lord of mankind.
114:4: From the evil of the (devil) who repeatedly whispers in the hearts of men (when they are unmindful of Allāh) and constantly retreats (whenever they remember Allāh) .
114:5: (The devil) who whispers (evil thoughts, doubts and desires) into the breasts of men.
114:6: (The devil) from among the jinn and men.”
